NW3TQSShNTCST_fWs9M0EA.text: What a great new addition to Vegas. I love hitting the ones in SoCal up, so having one at home is fantastic. The rotary is on one side only and the other half of the restaurant is iPad ordering only. We waited 15 minutes after opening for a table. Not bad at all. The rolls and nigiri are great! I really appreciate the choices of Toro, ama ebi, and the extra kitchen dishes we can grab off the iPad menus.   We will definitely be back! Ann was our server and was THE BEST. Seriously great service.

kNl24BIzw-0kFVWzyX3O4g.text: I'm not sure what all the excitement is about. It was kind of fun to have the robot server and belt but the quality of the food was nothing special. I've been to several AYCE sushi bars which are superior in both quantity of selection and quality of food. Most notably Naka Sushi and Jjinga.  The mackeral was downright inedible and was taken off our bill.

_KEkiHjY7NS-v70BpDNglg.text: New favorite sushi spot! Each plate is 1.50. The toro and salmon are amazing. I also recommend the ramen and scallops. They have a great selection on their menu so you can try a but of everything. Service is fast and friendly and you really dont have to interact with the staff.   However, I wouldnt recommend this place for large groups because all the small plates add up. It would just be smarter to go somewhere with AYCE too if you can eat a lot of nigiri.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

48Y2gW1zeH6LdRSlBUEvKA.text: I just returned from my first trip here and have mixed thoughts. On one hand, it's a cool experience. On the other hand, I wasn't impressed by the food.  The idea is super cool and interactive. If you have kids, I can see this being a hit! The sushi is portioned out in 2-3 pieces per plate and are labeled as they pass along on the conveyor belt. It's $2.50 per plate which is pretty affordable. There are a few speciality items that can be ordered via the tablet on the table and arrive at your table via a robotic tray.  The food is really nothing to write home about, ironically. Out of the 15 or so different types of sushi available, the only plate that sticks out is the popcorn lobster. All of the others seem basic or standard.   The topic of freshness is debatable. You can see the chefs preparing the sushi and placing the plates on the conveyor belts. At the same time, the same plate is seaweed salad passed me by the entire duration of my meal. Granted, that just means no one wanted it. But in the same breath, if someone arrived towards the end of my meal and choose that salad, by then it's far from fresh.   Tip: a table closer to the beginning of the conveyor belt means you'll get the best pick of whatever has been put out. If you're closer to the end ,like the table I was at , you'll have whatever everyone else didn't want. There may be 2 or 3 rotations before the plate you want becomes available.  Insight: the more the merrier but the higher the bill. If everyone is on a mission to get full, you'll go through a lot of plates. And plates = money. But for a date, the two of you could eat for less than the price of one person at an all you can eat spot.

ieuxp1lZg9YUn2BcLUDRPQ.text: So far, this is probably the best revolving sushi spot I've been too that meets quality & freshness ...and for $2.50 for every plate that comes from the conveyor belt ....that is a steal! The restaurant has a contemporary/ modern setting and you can also order other dishes via iPad that's stationed at every booth.  Not everything on the iPad menu is on the conveyor belt, but definitely has variety of rolls & sushi ...enough to satisfy our sushi cravings. I also want to highlight that their rolls don't have a lot of rice which I looove and appreciate! :)  Staff was also great! Definitely a must for me to come too whenever I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tqlDT16DqqMkcn8p8P_l0g.text: The place is spacious and clean inside. Nicely decorated and open space. I like how when you order the little robot deliver your food to you. It's cool. Sushi was good but the udon was a little sweet for us. Most of the nigiri is $2.50. Everything adds up so if you are hungry and want to eat a lot, be prepare to spend more than all you can eat price. The iPad would shut off if you don't order or touch it for a few minutes. That's probably something they can fix because it should always be on. It's newly open so they have time to fix all the kinks. Overall, I would come here when I want to snack on some sushi.

biDACJichkw9GK98Zid74Q.text: This is a really cool restaurant and the price is AFFORDABLE! This is a sushi restaurant with a revolving belt with sushi dishes that come through each table. Came here for dinner on a Friday night. The place was CROWDED and there was a large line but it moves very quick. Each dish on the revolving belt is $2.50 each. I usually saw either 1-2 nigeri or 4 simple rolls to each dish. There is an iPad at each table where you can order specific appetizers, sushi, or specialty rolls. The items you order come to you on a robotic cart on top of the revolving belt. It's actually pretty cool. The food here is really good, I'm not a fan of uni nigiri (sea urchin) but it was really good here. I also enjoyed the soft shell crab. Overall, I had a great experience here and it's probably one of my favorite places to get sushi now in Las Vegas. Will definitely be back some day.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soft shell crab. I recommend trying this.
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This tablet is at every table. You use it to order.

Xcww9c-wFj4DgcHjsessag.text: Best happy hour prices. 2pcs good sushi $1.50 only. Good portion ramen for $4.25 any time.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Highly recommend this place especially during their happy hour time.

M0YvLzGKTmaLut-PMs0Okw.text: While it's great welcoming a revolving sushi to Vegas, its disappointing to find the quality of food subpar.  We had several types of sushi. Fish were cut very thin, and rice was not good. Beef Katsu horribly jerky and over fried and over priced.  If you like endless parade of California rice rolls with bits and pieces of fishes and cream cheese, this will do the job. Do not expect quality sushi though.

DpbtERD6_LRz02YD6dWDcg.text: Not my first revolving sushi experience but the fanciest revolving sushi experience (with the iPad order system and the special delivery cart).  Enjoyed my time here!  I stopped by around 3:30PM after hiking for like 5 hours in Utah and driving 4 hours to Vegas.  I was extremely hungry by the time I arrived and an unanticipated benefit of eating here was that there's food ready to eat on the revolving tracks!  I ended up having 6 of the plates and placing 11 other sushi/appetizer orders on the iPad.  The sushi is very good and the food comes fast.  Although I do have some concerns about the sushi that is traveling around for long periods of time when there's less foot traffic (I saw some of the same plates going around for at least 30 minutes), not sure if they are somehow refrigerated/cooled when going around on the conveyor for so long.

Ua3GIEwEvDaCHVApiE3G8A.text: Owner read me a new one. Bad customer service.  How about please be my guest for your birthday? Don't see place lasting long with the,way owner treats potential guests.  Enough places to eat in this town. Too bad was looking forward to trying this place.

MwQv8uYpDN8d9_eDG12pww.text: Nice place to eat fresh food ! Everything is homemade so you can see the cookers close to you ; you can choose and place order directly with a tablet on your table and you can get a large choice of fresh sushi... Staff is very friendly and professional. The restaurant is clean and nice decor ! Prices are moderate. Parking.

R8cXhsEn_ShYJGNU2ZQFVw.text: This place is definitely the best rotating sushi bar place I've been to. While obviously not as good as prepared and eaten right away, the place tracks and replaces the plates of food regularly. Also service is really quite good. I tend do drink a lot of water during meals, but my glass was never empty and when the our iPad stopped working, the host was over right away to fix it.   Not only that, but for a sushi bar like this, the quality of the fish not terrible. In fact, the salmon quality is very comparable to some sushi bars. The tuna, however was quite fishy. Some recommendations are the smoke salmon, salmon belly, the squid, the spider hand roll, and if you want to be adventurous, their mini tacos aren't bad either.

7xeh2w3zkvfTNowKrpW6RQ.text: I've had better sushi, first off.  Second, I've had better sushi at restaruants with the same conveyour concept. Third, the portions have gotted significantly smaller since they opened. The salmon and tuna nigiri was good, stay away from the burned garlic tuna what ever the heck that is. Please. Don't do it.  The udon is pretty good tho!  My kiddos enjoyed the sushi tram. Tempura was good, hot and crunchy. Atmosphere was good also. Our server was kind of an ass as we had to ask for water and drink refills and he replied with an RBF face.

D9tg6z3T3VhsCvj2CefW3g.text: Their happy hour is the best! The food and the service are awesome. Although the portions are small, the cool revolving belt makes it worth the trip overall.

DijHLIqvGpBjZ8ViLfDj3Q.text: Went to check it out for lunch with friends.   After the novelty of the conveyer belt and the delivery "tray" for the specially ordered kitchen items wears off, there was really nothing about the place I would come back to check it out.  Service was prompt and friendly. That's the only thing that the place has going for them. You get charged by the plate which is $2.50 (*edited pricing*) unless otherwise noted. Waters were refilled on a timely manner. The cons outweigh the pros:  1. They do not carry natto (fermented soybeans).   2. The ordering tablet doesn't allow you to make special requests from what I've seen unless I was completely blind.  3. The skin on branzino with the orange puree looks pretty on the tablet but fails upon delivery. Skin was not crispy at all. The carrot puree underneath was lacking seasoning, however, the sweetness of the carrot came through.   4. Some of the sushi on the conveyer belt had dried out edges to it. Some of the "higher" priced items like salmon belly looked iffy.  5. Limited dessert selection.  If you want to try it out, come for the novelty. Prices does get out of control if you don't watch it. It averaged out to about $30 for 3 people, so basically stick to your AYCE spots unless you're here to entertain friends.

rhfDK9sfTCGQi9ohAPXE2w.text: Went to Sapporo last month a Saturday around 8pm and there was a wait about 45min - 1hr long. We weren't to unhappy as there was their bar with open seats. We were able to hang out at the bar for 40min. The drinks were definitely on point and the time flew by. The sushi and appetizers were just as great and we knew we needed to order another round of drinks from the bar before we left.

b85lrx1I443-g_J7RgteHg.text: Great sushi, great services, 5 minutes from the strip. Reasonably priced. The qualities are excellent

vkfqH1bvChSfb_3qnGvAYQ.text: Sapporo is an amazing concept. Much like Yo! Sushi in Europe, this place has sushi on conveyor belts revolving around you as you sit. There is still a waiter assigned to you to help you with things such as drinks, to-go orders, and any confusion you may have with the process.   As a vegan, there were very limited options. They do offer a cucumber roll and an avocado roll, but that's the extent of the veggie sushi. I'd like to see them add some more vegetable rolls in the future. They do offer miso soup and white rice as well for very low prices. You can ask your server for sauces, such as garlic ponzu, to put on your side of rice. They also offered a variety of ramen and udon noodles, but I did not have the chance to ask if they were (or could be prepared) vegan.   The person I went with was not a vegan, and was very impressed by he quality of the food. You can see the chefs in the kitchen preparing fresh sushi as you sit which he really enjoyed.   The price of everything at the end was extremely reasonable. For three people to eat until completely full, with sake and beer, our totally tallied up to $100.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sTSvf48cIv5BFxxmyrTgKQ.text: This place has the best quality sushi for the price. Maybe because the owner of the restaurant also owns three other establishments in Vegas, he can easily get high quality fish - conquering other low priced sushi establishments. The service is awesome and you can even get fresh wasabi if you order from the tablet. I shouldn't even write a review for Sapporo, it's the best in town and I don't want it to get any more popular!  Yes, its $1.50 a plate for Happy Hour.  A must for all Vegas locals and visitors.

KFRapjcwy58l8tRKxSj1uw.text: Every time we have gone they never messed up our orders and also were very nice . Our favorite is the Garlic Ramen and the Mexican roll . They have many others

n3Lfjod0MejKNbp1Yo2vEw.text: Delicious and fun! I'm shocked it's the first conveyor belt place in Vegas  Keep an eye on what's new on the belt. Some of the items that have been there for awhile aren't the best.

QGYfevqA4vidSWIpN5fK-w.text: This is probably the most fun you'll have at a sushi restaurant.  Conveyor belt sushi is something I have always wanted to experience since I saw it on an episode of Lonely Planet about 20 years ago.  The thing is when you have 50-100 pieces revolving around at room temperature you're not guaranteed a fresh piece every time; it's not really about the quality here as much as it is about the gimmick.  But, anyway, staff is very friendly, very accommodating, and the environment her is very positive.  Also the pepper tuna is absolutely nasty; its like licking the steel on a WWII battleship.  Edit: from a comment from the owners, the plates are RFID tracked for freshness, which is refreshing to know. Just a tip to the restaurant, it would be comforting for the staff to inform their customers of this when we sit down.

w3k9rOgvzv1nVzYyPxggjg.text: Sushi is fresh. Decor is nice. Our waitress Elena was so nice we are still in shock. Didn't expect that from this area. Will definitely come again.

IBfET_cfZzXK1zkqdKAo9Q.text: What a fun spot! Brought the family here and we really enjoyed our meal. We were newbies and no one spent any time explaining it to us, but the items on the revolving belt are all the same price. The fun part though is when you order from the iPads on the table. It comes on a little sushi train, starts blinking for you to grab it and then scoots back to the kitchen after you press the button. Needless to say, our night was filled with orders from that thing because the kids were having so much fun.   As for the food, their shrimp tempura was delicious and their black garlic ramen and udon were really tasty. One order filled up one of my kids. Edamame is a bit salty, but you can always scrape that off. The shrimp tempura roll has a thick coat of teriyaki sauce on it which made it a bit too sweet. But the spider hand rolls were delicious and the other rolls were delicious and a great portion size so we really enjoyed our meal. Will definitely be back!  Note: the bathrooms are nice but aren't that clean when it's busy. It's one bathroom per gender. Also try to go during off times to avoid the crowds!

IdWd7n4phIEsjv8-Wb-pDQ.text: My wife and I are pretty picky when it comes to sushi, nothing has reached as good as my Japanese mother in law, but this place is good. Friendly service and great variety and taste!

CK1CRBzyHFPzCGWTAs0PBg.text: Good spot! Modern surroundings. All very clean. We had 11 plates from the conveyor belt, each $2.50. Anything else we ordered from the touchscreen easily. We liked all the rolls, seaweed salad, miso soup. My friend said the oysters were very fresh. Fun date spot.  We went went it wasn't busy and sat right away.

pWQeqCts6f0IW3UZ-OKEQw.text: This place is amazing. The service was spot on. The ingredients are fresh, it's so affordable, unless you're ordering off the not on the belt menu. There's a ton of seating, so even when it's busy, it doesn't feel like you're waiting too long, as they move pretty quickly to get tables bussed. Came here for lunch and I'll definitely come again.

fxXtzb3d8lbeQ8z4nvr-yw.text: Pretty good for what it is. We don't have revolving sushi places in Vancouver anymore. Garlic ramen was yummy and perfect portion sizes

x-Dc8Sp503n5pR5Y0zdCjg.text: First time trying revolving sushi and I loved it. I like the ability to try small plates of a roll because then I eat to try more. It's also not super expensive. The staff was extremely nice. we special ordered the udon, green tea ice cream and oyster! GET THE OYSTER! It's spicy but not too spicy. And it was delicious. We ate 19 plates plus all the stuff we ordered and only spent like $70. Will securely be coming back. Plus the cart that brings you the special stuff is so cute!

my93L1Js1FIiyUPhzKPYsg.text: Loved the experience and the service. The server that I had was so amazing. The manager was amazing as well. Loved the food. Definitely would recommend people to go here because it is funny and tasty !

UASUoLS1dzf4rSeL79VpNg.text: For a conveyer belt sushi restaurant, it's decor is very modern and clean. I found all the sushi to be fresh and high quality and I consider myself a food snob. The little robotic food tray that come flying out for special orders is very cool and quite novel. This place is highly recommended and I look forward to returning. Prices are very fair too.

oXIH6h386XGmstgEr2NphA.text: Came in for lunch this afternoon. Was greeted and seated immediately. The server was very helpful in explaining the menu, the conveyer belt food and the ordering on the iPad.   Food came out quickly and was very good. The conveyer belt sushi was very fresh, you can tell it was made within the last 5min or so.   Place was pretty upscale in appearance. Def a place to bring a significant other for a date or even a group of friends to dine and drank.   Will be back!

BAV_8bpXsGBbCrbuFXRETg.text: If you eat at the steakhouse tables ask for Ivan to be your waiter he was absolutely amazing! My gf has celiac and he made sure to check on everything to make sure she could eat it! At other places waiters tend to be kind of rude when we tell them if her allergy. Ivan didn't make us feel like a burden at any point! They had her food prepared specially in the back, whilst Tim cooked the rest of the party's food. He was incredibly entertaining rivaling Benihana's staff easily! The food tasted incredible and I don't see any point in going to the strip to eat Benihana's after today. The restaurant is broken up into two parts, a rotating sushi bar area and the steakhouse area. We were able to sit down almost immediately even though there was a line by going to the steakhouse tables (like Benihana tables), the only catch is someone has to order something from the menu for that area. Easy because the price of the food is significantly cheaper than Benihana's but the taste is just as good! You can't go wrong eating here!

qlStNzBnbJIQEXjDiWzGFA.text: First time visiting and got me sick ugh! I think that sushi was sitting out way too long! Drive sushi, NOT THE BUSINESS! Yuk. Not going back

Drgs0iyQFzBEVVbhFHYxJg.text: Best sushi in town. Excellent price and fantastic quality! The conveyor belt is just like being back in Japan. Would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who likes sushi and will be back again on our next trip to Las Vegas!

Ik896ivtDvQ2LLo9YoC4UQ.text: Delightful! So fun and different. Fish on plates goes right by your table. There is an i-Pad to order anything else you don't see going by. Some food, like the tasty BLACK GARLIC RAMEN will be brought out by your server, who also takes your drink order at the beginning. However, we ordered FILET MIGNON NIGIRI and UNAGI NIGIRI (both fabulous), and those arrived via a little table-car-robot thing that rides along a track above the sushi belt and knows what table to stop at and sings to you while you retrieve your tasty selections from it. The FATTY SALMON NIGIRI was my favorite thing from the belt and I had a bottle of NIGORI SAKE (my favorite, it's unfiltered, white and milky in texture, a little sweet and you drink it chilled). Service was great. Nothing we tried was bad. Will certainly go back and recommend to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ordering extras on the i-Pad.
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black garlic ramen. Delightful. And love that the portion size is small. This was only $4!
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filet mignon and unagi (eel) nigiri. So lovely.

WaNcYX58Ze3mprqQsk579A.text: Pros:  Clean.  Hi tech.  Servers are attentive.  Novelty factor is very high with iPad-enabled ordering system.  Uni was decent.  Cons:  If you are a sushi/sashimi connoisseur, then you might seek elsewhere.  The nigiri portions are about half of standard sized pieces and made with not all that particularly good quality fish.    It is somewhat entertaining, some selections were decent/good (uni), but others (toro) was actually not so good.

IpzZ4O_X0s53pDFEYOsj5A.text: Wow! What a great concept and execution! I am not so big on ayce simply because I get full quickly and I hate the idea of ordering something new, hating the item yet having to finish it. I landed at Sapporo Revolving because my usual spot doesn't open until 5pm. I'm pretty sucky about change so I didn't want to go to any new sushi spot but my cravings beat me! And thank god for that! Since this place has awesome reviews I thought what the heck do I have to lose. Service standards/greets/etc all get thumbs up. I am in love with the revolving line. I get to try new items, and enjoy the items I already love for only $2.50!!! Plus there are awesome dishes on the iPad freshly prepared upon ordering. Based on revolving items I picked from the line, I tapped at $17.50. I didn't quite like one of the dishes I picked up so guess what: I didn't finish it!!! And I got to try new awesome fish I'd probably never have tried before. So happy I ended up coming here! Can't wait to return and bring friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w9oUX7NQfoNh4V6PGC-JUA.text: I was really looking forward to having a rotating sushi restaurant in Las Vegas, I was used to going to many of them in Los Angeles... which gives me pretty high standards.   And I know they just opened but, my experience was terrible and I'm not going back.   They did give us a discount because were so many problems over all that night with lack of food on their conveyor belts and slow service. But that still doesn't make me want to go back.   Pros:  The staff was nice, large space, clean, and nice aesthetics.   Cons:  1. The conveyor belts had like nothing 85% of the time we were there. When there was stuff on the conveyor belt it was only sashimi and no rolls at all or any variety. (Tried to attach a video I took but it doesn't give me an opinion to post it, I see if I can post it at some point) and we were there around 8pm on a Saturday and there were a lot of people. Also some of the times that they did have items on the conveyor belt they didn't match the title card that was in front of them. (Towards the time we were leaving, like after an hour was when they started to have more items on the conveyor belt, but again all sashimi and nothing else)  2. A lot of the food had no taste  3. The pictures on the screens don't really match to the size that you get. For example I got an avocado roll and it was the size of my finger it was so tiny(looked much smaller than the picture see attached)   4. The iPads they use for the orders don't swivel to your direction so it's very annoying, it stays perpendicular to you at all times. And screen is so sensitive that if you tap on something by mistake, it puts the item in your order list, then when you go to your screen were you double check your order before ordering it, things will pop up that you didn't even know you pressed. You can delete them before you press order. But it's very annoying.   5. There are no descriptions of what is in any of the food. If you're ordering a roll for example you don't know what's in the roll unless it's like a basic California roll or something. If you order a specialty roll or more pricey food you have no idea what's in it.   6. The rotating belt delivery boat for when you order something off the screen didn't work on our row but It worked on the other two. All our food had to be delivered by servers. The servers kept asking us over and over which items we had received from our order, which got really annoying.   In my opinion, It's a very large conveyor belt sushi restaurant which shocked me that they weren't prepared for the amount of people that they had that night. It's the first one in Vegas.... you're gonna have a lot of people. Any place that I've ever been to has tons of food on the conveyor belts at all times and are much smaller places with people waiting outside for 2 hours.   When you go to a conveyor belt sushi restaurant you want your food then and there, it goes very quick. You shouldn't have to wait because there's nothing on the conveyor belt, then you have to place the order without knowing what half of the food is and then wait for a server to bring it to you. (some food is self-explanatory by looking at it, but certain items are not) If that were the case I could've gone to a regular all you can eat sushi restaurant that lists all the food and ingredients and it's only brought by a server.  Take a look at Kula in Los Angeles for an example of how to run a restaurant like this. There restaurants are small and are super crowded and sometimes you have to wait outside for two hours. But they always have food on the conveyor belts from the second you sit down. And it's a variety of salads, rolls, sashimi, desserts, etc. They even have sashimi that isn't raw fish and alternatives if you don't eat fish or raw fish other than tamago. (Though the aren't perfect by any means, but there a great example of always being busy and being on top of their food and having their conveyor belts and boats work.)  Maybe doing research on other conveyor belt sushi restaurants would help to fix certain problems.

jQMluYdOtYNKri-fi6RdKw.text: (Update) left review few months ago and have been visiting regularly and we can feel this restaurant listens what customer says. Everything got better from the moment we felt discomfort. Now we can enjoy our dinner whenever we choose this place.  Glad some friendly servers recognize our family and  our family member get what we ordered right away. We feel welcomed there and so far our family could get what they wanted at this location.  Good to see every plate comes out in such a consistency. And also little ones get little chopstick helper even we didn't ask for.  So far many of our friends visited here after we recommend here for good dining spot. Good job Revolving Sushi, Sapporo!

Please you can order certain items from the kitchen as well like ramen and udon.  Bon appetite!

6Ll7uix0x7yzNQ8u-Ax_mg.text: First time in during evening shift. Service definitely different. Got a booth right away. Great!  No waiter for a minute or a few. Ok, no big deal. Self service conveyer belt. I am well into my second plate and I have to wave down my waiter. No beverage as of yet.  Food is always great. Service could of been 75% better.  I seen three tables get their drinks refilled. Mine has been empty for a while. I have even received my bill and still no h2o. It is just sitting at edge, waiting. Lol  Better luck at lunch time. Everyone else is getting good service. Maybe because I am in corner.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour

jigjtd-3lhb07uvMnK09hg.text: $1.75 per plate for Late Night Happy Hour (after 10pm)! Sushi is not bad and had a decent variety of things on the conveyor belt. Service was attentive to fill our waters and other items we ordered. Definitely a place to try if you are off the strip and in LV!

PZ2WmkE6afIEI4TiFq6thA.text: Great place for something quick! You can park anywhere even though it doesn't say Sapporo! we had a hard time finding parking but later found out you can park anywhere.   The dining room is lively and clean. They also have a  nice bar. The dining room features three conveyor belts rotating through, and each plate is a flat price of $2 50. Our favorites were Rainbow roll, Super white tuna, Shrimp taco, and Green tea cake. The sushi were pretty fresh. They count the plates left on our table. We had 16 plates!   In addition you can use the screens they have at each table to order a specific order and those prices varies. We ordered Shrimp tempura, and Soft pork Belly. When it's ready, an automated monorail robot deliver your food above the conveyor belt, that is so cute.  We were starving and only about 40 mins. Service was quick and friendly.  A good place to bring an out of towner for this experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. pork belly

Es66MKLgqJG-99w5L3YlWQ.text: Hands down this is the best sushi restaurant we have been too. We recently moved here from Florida and were bumped we couldn't find a great sushi place like we had back home until now. The restaurant is clean, staff very nice and service is excellent. I have already told all my colleagues about this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My absolute favorite creamy lobster

aFFEZI0_GUzuChiJ5Zf4Qw.text: Revolving sushi usually doesn't have a great reputation, but Sapporo Revolving Sushi does it well. Most other revolving sushi chains I've been to have been a hit or miss depending on the day and time you go (busier times = better usually). However, Sapporo has LOTS of seating but only opens certain sections during non-peak hours so items are fresher since they're not circling around as much!  Love the options here! I def recommend waiting for the roll options to come around on the conveyor belt instead of ordering off the touchpad system bc they come in smaller portions (4 pieces for $2.50 vs. whole roll for $7.50). My personal fav was the sapporo garlic tuna roll - can't go wrong w/this roll if you love tuna. Also, the toro here is SO good! Toro is more expensive than the regular tuna options ($2.50 for one nigiri), but it's absolutely worth it. They don't always have it, so don't hesitate on grabbing it when you see it! The ikura and unagi are also tasty, but I don't think they offer it on the conveyor belt.    I come here for the sushi, but their kitchen options (hot dishes) are also good. I've tried both the striped bass and the butter yaki shrimp, and although they are a bit pricey compared to the $2.50 sushi plates, the portions are pretty large!   Obviously you're not gonna get Sugarfish (and above) quality fish here, but for $2.50 a plate you can stuff yourself without having to worry about your wallet. Can't wait to come back on my next Vegas adventure!

yMyNkR2EiF7vhiyk8tqjzw.text: Ok now let's give this place its proper review I get how us local forks go crazy for new trendy places especially this place with the conveyer belt.   I totally get it but I was not that impressed with the food and especially the service it was sad to say the lease  I love salmon belly this place it did not make the cut the Ramon was ok.     There are so many other great sushi places is Vegas to go to..... I'm just saying the 40 min wait was not worth it at all.... sorry but I gata keep it real people..... the spicy tuna hand roll was the best thing there for me.....the fish is defiantly of lower quality and it came out the same place as your all you eat sushi   So I don't need all the hype I rather get good food and service.   It's not for me I was not impressed   So if your looking to take someone to sushi to impress them bells and Whistles this is your place.    But if want good sushi go some where else Sakana is great.   Good luck.....   That pic if a tuna taco that was also good

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna taco

JMedzABbgvJvMLMqt_tfcQ.text: Came here for dinner with the family.  My kids thought it was fun but the best part is they also liked the food.   I enjoyed the selection they have to offer.  I didn't have a stand out item to point out but I liked everything I got.  They say it's not all you cn eat but technically it is you're just charged by the plate.  It actually ended up being cheaper for my whole family to eat this way than AYCE .  The items ordered off the menu come to you on a robot tray, kind of like The Jetsons.    The booth was kind of small for a family of 5 but other than that I  have no complaints.

m1jBm_YQj3u8Wg7am13eGQ.text: Look, this will always be my favorite sushi place the food and quality is great, but the service is becoming worse and worse.  Sad to say I have to remove 1 Star. Recently I have been having to flag down waiters, they don't come and check on you at all. I come here at least once a week if not more since they've opened and I've just noticed the service going downhill.  There's always new people every time working here as well who don't know what they are doing and don't know the menu at all.

lwR3Ou2BJOHYXYZuiOyLRw.text: I am easily amused and impressed by technology.  Put that together with food and I am over the moon!  First off, the revolving sushi is impressive.  We got here at a great time before the dinner rush, and they were just opening one of the sides of tables so we knew everything coming out was going to be fresh.  Little by little, the tiny round plates of sushi started coming out and soon, there was an endless stream of nigiri and maki to our delight.  You can't beat the $2.50 a plate deal.  But wait, there's more.  We ordered a few items from the touch pad and like kids waiting for Christmas, we anxiously waited for the upper tray to shoot out from the kitchen and arrive with our dish.  Again, I am easily amused by technology.  Definitely a good selection and options on the menu for those that aren't into sushi, though why go there if you're not?    I wish I could visit here more often, but this place will definitely be one of my go to spots every time I go to Vegas.

Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp tacos

LTmhosM8d8bIpGyi4bRarw.text: Popped in after driving back from Utah and it was a perfect choice. If you haven't been here yet a conveyor belt runs alongside everyone's booths at about eye level. The sushi is covered and a sign let's u know what it is. You just grab what u want and stack your plates. I think it was $2.50 a plate and $1.75 during happy hour.   Good selection, fresh and good quality. 10 plates for 2 people and it was only $25.  That's a deal.    They have a small touchscreen where u can order drinks and other dishes from.  A small device delivers that to your table via the top of the conveyor belt.    Cool casual place with good sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic tuna.
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some other stuff

myfDADAAjoi7YLxWc9AVMg.text: What a cool concept! Hubby had actually told me about this place, sound so cool, and it was around my birthday I got to try the place with another Yelper and good friend Stefany. She and I got there and the staff was so nice and attentive to us. Was a nice change, but I know since most of the place is all on the revolving track or robotic car that brings you stuff they do mostly drinks, refills and picking up lids because you keep your plates til the end.   The track of sushi has a good range of sushi being offered from appetizers like endamame to desserts like tiramisu. The range of rolls is good, very fresh and quite a diverse bunch. One of my favorites is the little sushi tacos, salmon is always a favorite of mine and to have it as a little taco was yummy. Each small plate is $2.50 ea. Prices vary on menu items from a tablet style on each table. I just stuck with the little plates got to try more that way. Instead of being stuck with a whole roll of the same kind it's 4 pieces which was nice and not to filling.   Stefany and I definitely finished off a good pile of plates but enjoyed everything we had. The staff, sushi and ambience definitely wanted me to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7QXAeQ0VjQv3HmriI2fFPg.text: Loved it, my second visit to a revolving sushi restaurant and Sapporo was by far the best ! Everything we tried was excellent, restaurant was clean and staff were very friendly. I will definitely return the next time we visit Las Vegas ! 5 start all the way

uggHuxLYHLOeWoerZdt1Tw.text: Fun to sample different options as it passes by table on conveyor belt. Very well priced to try a variety. A wider variety could be ordered on table tablet. Very fresh!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Constant flow of options. Special orders neatly delivered on top belt.

2VUKKRuJ6qfnxuH_7kxdGg.text: I got nothing for checking in. Not even a free iced tea and I'm still giving this place 5 stars. Haha. My kids love revolving sushi bars, but I never found the quality to be anything to rave about until now. The menu items are amazing. Halibut carpaccio, truffle Octopus, Yusuf tuna!!! Omggg so good. I devoured the crispy Brussels sprouts and loved the playing of my soft shell crab. Can't wait to come back and try more. $2.50/plate off the belt only. The menu items are $6-$11 bucks but still excellent quality at a good value. I urge you to Eat here but don't make me wait for a table next time I come. Haha

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So pretty. Soft shell crab
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussels sprouts. Crispy and satisfying
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Order kitchen food and more sushi from iPads if you don&#39;t see what you want roll by

hCkFAIR5bcZKX22iimZceQ.text: Not going to lie, I was a little hesitant when my friend sent this place to me to try. How do they keep everything so fresh, on a conveyor belt? I read a little more into it and read the specifics: it's only on the belt 30 min before it's discarded and they really had to work with the health district on this one. So I say ok!  Pretty easy to find off Spring Mountain. Well kept, clean restaurant with 4 belts that rotate 2 sections. Great selection of sushi: albacore tuna, halibut, salmon, shrimp, crab. Along with a nice selection of rolls and soups. Everything was so incredibly fresh and delicious. Little white plates roll out, covered, and you just grab what you want. If you take the rolls off the belt, you get about 3-4, which is good if you want to try everything. You do have the option of ordering a plate which comes out to you on this cool rolling tray that talks to you to grab your food. So hip! Haha! Once you take your food, it rolls back into the kitchen.   The staff here are pretty awesome, too. They explain how everything works for the new comers.   This place was so good the first time, we came back the next night!

rz5kyTlWkGKBPAg8o-Ioew.text: Exactly what you'd expect. This is a nice place with good sushi and of course you get the fun aspect of grabbing your food off of the conveyor belt. And you aren't limited to what's on there, you can also order stuff from the online menu and it is sent to your table on a little cart thing above the conveyor belt. This is a fun thing to do for sure, I feel like more and more places like this are opening. Bye bye servers...

VhojU-i960kSHoqvpdBSJQ.text: *ahem* An endless conveyer belt of good quality sushi and a robot that brings you amazing food from the kitchen that you self order on an iPad. Also friendly service and really cold beer. Go here anytime for any reason.   That is all.

Ll0VwKg2hRWVLlStjm7Qcw.text: Super cool concept, place was immaculate on the inside. Very affordable. Will be back again soon!

JOaGWY1cCVwkGLzxwSx_hg.text: If you're looking for fancy rolls, this place is NOT for you. That said, the simplicity of the sushi here is definitely what I look for in nigiri - which is what I come here for. The conveyor belt items are all $2.50 ($1.50 during HH) with each plate having 2 pieces of nigiri. The fish to rice ratio is probably the most proportionate nigiri I've had. Most of the food items are served on a conveyor belt and while you can grab whatever comes out on the belt, you can also from the pad that's located on every table. You must be thinking that the sushi mustn't be fresh if it's constantly being left out on the conveyor belt however, that is not the case. The sushi that comes out is just as fresh compared to if you're ordering through the pad.  I can't stress enough how silky and melt-in-your-mouth the fish is!  This restaurant does offer a pretty extensive menu, which includes ramen. Their "bowl" of ramen is pretty much mini bowl but the flavors will not disappoint!

xr5NOVe9BvJfMYiJ6SNyBQ.text: This restaurant really needs to work on improving the logistics behind seating their guests. Extremely disorganized establishment.

jay0ou6fV7mGllLfPDr3VA.text: What a experience!!!! This place is amazing not only is the quality of the food great but they are EXTREMELY high tech. I will not lie at first I was overwhelmed due to sensory overload there are conveyor belts right in front of your table, a touch screen menu and a little robotic cart that brings food out. Once I got the hang of it all I was totally immersed in the experience. Plates off of the conveyor belt are only two dollars which is super reasonable and you can either pick up 1 to 2 piece sushi or half rolls for that price. However if you'd like a full roll or anything from the kitchen you were able to order that as well. The selection was pretty large. This restaurant is kid friendly and both of my children both loved it. We Will definitely be heading back there.

Bx14DS_B0MM6UYl9FaVRrA.text: 3 Times here and every time it's great! Never too busy, the staff is very helpful!  I'm a huge salmon fan! The king salmon is wonderful! And I finally found a place where I like there gyoza! The ambiance is great too, nice decor and the music is appropriate!

QT5elB6VfcrgmD0IJjRtzw.text: I wanted to give this place a higher rating. The place is modern and clean. The service is polite and attentive. However the sushi is just okay. I was disappointed with the size and nigiri sushi. They were small and lack flavor. The tempura shrimp was also disappointing. I felt that Sapporo didn't provide much value in its products

PDbcTDrLzdYhJvCHJFTXiA.text: FINALLY! Vegas has a legit revolving sushi place to fill my sushi loving needs! Not only do I get spoiled with the fresh AYCE options but now I get to be served without a wait. Coming from Hawaii and California, I am pretty spoiled when it comes to being served sushi with finesse. I've seen sushi on revolver belts, trains, and boats in water so being in Vegas where AYCE sushi is a BIG thing I was shocked there was no place like this until now. Me and my party arrived at 5pm and I suggest you all do the same as there was a wait soon as the restaurant opened and filled up all their seats. Our hostess gave my friend the rundown on how it works. Everything on the belt is $2.50! Yes TWO-FIFTY a plate! Such a deal for the options they give you. Please consult pictures for some of the mouthwatering options made available to to you. i would recap them for you but I fear I would start drooling. Now for those who want more than what's being on the belt, you can order off their computerized menu. Yes no waiting for your server to come around. You just choose what you want and send it on through. Sounds like heaven right? Wait, there's more! Most orders (not soups or desserts) will come out on their robotic food tram is what I called it. It plays music and stops right at your table all lighted up like a Christmas present!   The restaurant itself is very clean and put together so well. 3 rows of booth tables with each row having their own belt and robotic food tram. They do have a bar so you are more than welcomed to sit there but why bother going if you are't going for the experience? Oh yeah, the FOOD!  AND SERVICE! Ann took great care of us and even offered to set my dessert on the robotic food tram if I wanted. Deep down I did, but she had more important things to worry about. Sadly, the strawberry shortcake I wanted was unavailable but the manager compensated for any other dessert on the house. The owner and manager came by to make sure everything was ok which I always give a restaurant high marks for.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Shortcake - yum!
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

alLY4OTmztqIS_jMl02Qlg.text: First revolving sushi in Vegas and I'm impressed! Finally, we have a revolving sushi! Coming here, I didn't have a much of an expectation since a lot of revolving sushi restaurants I've tried in Cali are just fads. When we walked right in, the place is very roomy and has a bunch of tables, we came during dinner rush but only waited for about 5-10 minutes.   Everything on the menu is $2.50 a plate, unless you want full-sized rolls then they'd be about $7. They explained that they have a timer on each of their plates that come out of the conveyor belt and after 30 minutes of being on the belt, they automatically get rid of them. Salmon is my favorite sashimi and I must say, I was very impressed with the quality! Super fatty and fresh. I also really liked the lobster popcorn roll. If you ever want something that you're not seeing on the conveyor belt, you can always order on the ipad and it'll come to you hot and fresh!   I can't wait to come back and try more. I'm more than impressed with their quality as well as their excellent customer service. Give this place a try!

pN4utsrFl6JjFeH07wMzoA.text: Super solid experience.  Rotating sushi concept takes all the waiting out of the usual sushi dining experience.  Seeing stuff come out creates instant new ideas and tastings.  Staff is courteous, affable, and pricing is even better than an AYCE location. Place is clean and decorated well.   Love it.

ELr8QYfRntEoDlIJtJyKsA.text: Good foods for a good price. Love that you don't have to really wait for food. They have sushi on belt for you to choose from and if you want you can also order on your table. The server need to be a little bit more attentive. When requested the bill we had to wait for 15 mins to get our bill when it washed busy at all.

C6zCx4FX5pLu444YjtgA0w.text: Yummy sushi place. Hi tech place where you can order individually on an iPad provided at each table.   The food you ordered individually are delivered by this small robot car that stops are your table. Pretty fun for the kids to see. And of course there's a revolving belt that have small plates of sushi/edamame/ small tapas. You are charged for every plate taken. Go here during happy hour for a discount- I think we paid like 1.50 a plate. This a fun hip place.

r3NbxogOAC9wgRk1SZAebA.text: Quality is really good and the service is excellent.  Fun atmosphere.  My family's favorite.  The noodle is out of the world and is less than $5 during happy hour and the quality is at par at those Ramen noodle house who charges $12-15!, this is in-sane. Will make sure I go every time I am in town.  Love it Love it!

4-UyRFSbXGdVU3YPkErSew.text: This place is hands down the coolest revolving sushi I have ever been to. The robot that brings you the food is pretty amazing!!! All you need to do is order from the iPad on your table then press Place Order. The robot will roll next to you! Pretty awesome! The revolving plates are all $2.50 (can't go wrong with that!) The fish are all fresh. The proportion of fish and rice are reasonable. the service is great! Your glass of water will never go empty! The servers are always there to check up on you.  Great place to bring some friends and have some good sushi!   Tip= skip the desserts! They are not that great! We got the ice cream and the matcha cake. It did not gave a wow factor.  Lucky for you, it is located in Chinatown and there are plenty of desserts/boba nearby!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VmZ-m3KMmKzDOASh3o0G1Q.text: Finally Las Vegas gets a revolving sushi spot with good quality sushi. We tried almost everything on the belt and it tasted very good and fresh. They have a large selection so I recommend getting 1 type of dish at a time so you are able to try everything. They are also open late which is amazing if you have a late night cravings :)  Food pricing: $2.50 a plate, special pricing for items ordered on iPad's  Servers were amazing and friendly even tho there is not much to do for them they always came around to check if we needed beverages filled.   Will I be coming back HECK YES!

BlHbqWutJlt6jkCruT5oBw.text: We were looking for the best sushi in vegas and this restaurant showed up on yelp! They are close very late so we stopped by before we were heading back to Orange County! Foods are so amazing fresh and delicious, only $2.5 for a plate and side orders are all delicious! We can't wait to go back here again for our next trip to Vegas! Thanks for all our service for the free Ice cream and candle for my boyfriend birthday! Highly recommended this place!

Fo1LxSpyFbojkg3TNkKIQg.text: Came here for a change from the Strip and for something a bit cheaper. It was an excellent choice! We came at happy hour which was even more affordable. We got a ton of plates and our bill was only around $35 for two people. The sushi is above average..but nothing amazing. Definitely made better by the entire experience. Would definitely recommend!

borhBmvBiciZOjhuRAQ8kg.text: It's a cool place. Food is good  But the parking area is dangerous. 5 cars got broken into. Don't leave any bags in your car. Look out for suspicious people. They drive a grey SUV.

GDbcO9Ob10wDzD8DtreiKQ.text: Its about time Vegas FINALLY has a conveyor belt sushi restaurant! This will save me about $600 in airfare to get my fix at Genki Sushi in Oahu! lol   The food is fresh and I had some of the black garlic ramen...which was really good!   The service is awesome. My waitress, Ann Marie, was very sweet and efficient. She made sure we had our drinks always filled and kept our table clean.   I'll definitely come back again. Maybe I'll bring the kids next time too! Lol

t8UykRmJUWlYnf9GHBqWgw.text: PROS: -Cool interior + bar while you're waiting -The experience, itself, is pretty fun. There's no other place that does revolving sushi in Las Vegas, so kudos to them.  FOOD 3/5: -Food is average. Nothing special. -Has all the sushi that you can get at any AYCE sushi place   CONS:  -The food. -The COST. It's $2.50 per plate while in CA revolving sushi it's $1 per plate. These plates DO add up, I only got 8 plates because that sums up to $20. -Me and my boyfriend left the restaurant feeling hungry because we REFUSED to spend more than $40. At other sushi places, you can get $25 AYCE sushi and walk out happy + full.

QhIdZy9qwJEmeZyc_jo0nw.text: Sapporo Revolving Sushi is the first conveyor belt sushi place in Vegas. Every plate off of the conveyor belt went for $2.50. You can also make a selection of a full sushi roll (6 pieces) on the iPad on the table and a little robotic trolley will come and deliver your food, which is unique and cool.   They also have ramen available, but I did not try it. I went for the sushi off of the conveyor belt, which tasted great. Good for small or big appetites.

InVa9GDGgNr-xEGknXsuDQ.text: This is fun for my son and very similar to the sushi bars in Japan. I originally wanted to come because they serve Ramen. Most of the fish was really good the ramen was excellent also it comes in a very small portion. This place is definitely worth going to if you want to have a little bit of fun while you eat. Or if you want to try a Japanese style sushi bar.

P_f_s8r182WrJcG-EI-EPg.text: Not a long wait. Great atmosphere. Love the choices on the revolving line. Especially the Cajun albacore. Very reasonable prices. Definitely will be back.

7UN_4zBXxsF-Goah00HWtQ.text: Nice this, pick your own sushi.  $2.50 per plate on the conveyor belt, and order a la carte for other items.  It can add up quickly for the plates from the belt if you don't pay attention

L5dgAnrX7eN_FaihmGnx8w.text: Came from NY and had the best time. Not only was ALL of the sushi fresh (which we were nervous about), but the place is SUPER CLEAN. It was so fun and I can't wait to go back again! FABULOUS JOB! Would recommend the Mexican roll

zQjE2J2eRjGtLwPgDqjMAQ.text: Been wanting to check this place out since I'm pretty sure this is the first revolving sushi restaurant in Las Vegas (as I miss places like this back in Hawaii).   Place had a very modern/trendy vibe to it from the music they were playing and the I-pads you order from if you want something other than what is coming out on the conveyor belt.  We were seated immediately around 7 the day after Christmas,  but it was 2 of us, I think for larger groups there could be a longer wait. If you are looking for an AYCE sushi place this is not it....but if you are looking for a quick sushi fix the fish was fresh and quickly served.   My husband really enjoyed the garlic tuna nigiri. I tried a roll that had shrimp tempura in it (dont remember which one) but stayed away from other rolls that had it because I thought the tempura tasted stale. Even though this is supposed to be a sushi restaurant we really enjoyed the garlic ramen, the broth was one of the best we've had in a while!

zeBj63OgKPZsiRZz56GL1A.text: You get what you pay for. Average sushi with not so fresh fish. I recommend other sushi places next to this area. They are more expensive but still better. This place is good to satisfy your sushi cravings without spending too much money.

Pgypdl6NEboRoPNUww0dJg.text: Omg this is great Sushi. Great atmosphere . Great place for the family. Highly recommend. We have been there so many times. Toney and Elly were our servers and they both rocked it. The atmosphere is very comfortable too. If you need help they are willing to help you.

alalS7qdwlXlMl2BOHkREQ.text: My new go to place. 1.50 during happy hour is awesome. 10 plates 15$ and i am full. Better than paying $25+ for all you can eat. Wide selection of rolls and very fresh fish. Cant wait until centennial location opens  since i live in aliante area. Highly recommended.  Great service. Great ambiance and atmosphere. Thanks for coming to vegas! A+++ @elchinotacos

YqBX4BaPyti7YEtJX-GllA.text: This place is so good! Best revolving sushi bar that I have ever been to. I would definitely recommend to anyone who is in the area

V5LnWvllbJBW7wD65VgDRw.text: If you don't actually have time and patience, don't be here these days. The guy in front even told us that we might be wait 45-50m up to an hour. That was fine until he crossed out my name, we had to come and ask him again and he said sorry. I was extremely disappointed and upset. I also expressed that negative attitude with our waiter, but I immediately felt sorry because Jeremy was pretty nice and he was not the person that caused the problem. About food, we expected more than that when we read the reviews on Yelp. Sushi on the belt are poor and not fresh tho, that's our personal thought. The only one we love is Kanto rolls with soft shell crabs and onion, good combination.  We also ordered Caterpillar, lobster and popcorn lobster rolls. They were all the same, too sweet, nothing special, not our taste. I ordered Gyu Katsu for my bf, omg the carrot sauce is very sweet and not related to the meat, it's weird. Miso ramen is normal.  Btw, if you go to ayce sushi restaurants, you pay less and get a huge number of appetizers, sushi rolls and nigiri than here. Good luck.

Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K7yPw1bwvrt0xmTj1gmXkQ.text: Yes!!!' The late night happy hour is such fun and very tasty! My husband and I had a blast at eleven o'clock at night. We stopped in after a show and we were not disappointed

T9LzjMMfij5C16fhMQkGpw.text: Love, love, love this restaurant!  Food is amazing and service impeccable!!!  Ask for Tony!  He is the most personable, professional waiter out there! Highly recommended to all my friends and family!

N2OQn3as4zu0TqulANvJ7Q.text: This is a brand new restaurant in Vegas, I think the first conveyor belt sushi in Vegas? Jessica was extremely fun and helpful with everything. From the kitchen there were some hiccups with orders but she got them fixed right away. It seemed like things are still being worked out from an organizational sense. Our table and others around the restaurant didn't seem to have soy sauce trays out with chopsticks, ginger and wasabi. $1.99 Beers were great and the quality of the food was good. We did order some times on the iPad but they never showed up. Later we found out they're sold out. They should have a way to mark out the item on the menu so other customers don't order and find out like we did. TNT roll was delicious though!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iGJgAZb1kCXcninvxN2tbQ.text: For a carousel style sushi place, this place is great. Don't come expecting the five star food but it is very good for quick and cheap. Unfortunately the service is pretty nonexistent. They have a cool feature where you can use the tablet system on the table to request a waiter to come but after 20 minutes of eating, no one ever showed up.

2JYv6VxGTFSOtwq5ivGSlw.text: Finally tried this place tonight with some friends, was served by an amazing server name Pure. She was so attentive and delightful, recommended this lychee martini that was so refreshing. All the sushi was so fresh and the restaurant is very clean. Pure definitely made sure we had a good experience for the first time, thanks Pure! We will come back.

XOEgs8U6gqgX835oTLkTEA.text: Best Sushi experience ever. Sushi on a conveyor belt and very affordable. The little robot is cute too

Db9mASOFK_w2MCXU75hz6Q.text: We tried Sapporo for the first time and were impressed enough to come back a second time while on vacation in Vegas.  The Striped Bass with mango was a hit.  We also tried the Ton Katsu Ramen and Black Garlic Ramen and enjoyed both.  Good balance between cost and good food.

yybg2gwNlHjZVJeJ2hZhsg.text: If you're looking for a fun sushi experience I definitely recommend this place. I loved the conveyor belt grab what sushi you want concept,  but I do not recommend if you're really hungry because it does get it a little pricey. You're better off at an all you can eat spot if that's the case.

Q2iuGPi1QHPOD722fZS_wg.text: Love Love Love this place! Great selections and quality sushi. We dined here twice in four days if that gives you an idea. The Popcorn Lobster was my favorite but everything was just amazing, constantly revolving and fresh!

WnVtxD08eWSnqaz9fbiilQ.text: This place is awesome. Great portions at the right price. Staff was very attentive and helpful for first-timers. A variety of delectable nigiri to choose from as well as appetizers. I'm coming here again.

J5HyH_-hgGee5oQ0OJLA7Q.text: Loved this place! Was craving sushi but didn't want the "all you can eat" ... enjoyed the sushi. The staff is wonderful, will definitely be back

XZ0n_u7BAiTBfPtbj05mLA.text: The food here was overall pretty good. They kept refilling the conveyor belt frequently and there was a lot of variety. Took a bit to get the servers attention for drinks, etc. but I would come back next time I am in the area. The prices were not bad $2.50 a plate and their spicy ramen was good.

9vjImvAWCJFx_ymVkD7xKQ.text: What a great experience coupled with fresh sushi. They say you eat with your eyes and at $2.50 a plate you can't loose. Saporro offers an extensive menu. The Ramen portion was perfect. Enough to keep you satisfied, but not full where you dont have room for more sushi. If you like cooked sushi try the lobster roll. It came nice a crisp from the kitchen. Save room for desert the refreshing pineapple sorbet with pinapple chunks topped off a great dinner.   If your a fan of late night dining prices are right. $1.75 a plate $2.50 Saporro draft beer. I'll be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z0sQXEU5eCLvFeJjKlxnew.text: Why Sapporo: A concept that's new to Las Vegas. Servings of sushi rotating on a conveyor belt. $2.50 per plate is how you'll be charged.  But what if I don't want sushi you say? Then go somewhere else ... jk.  But really ... Buh bye, have a nice day. I joke, hahaha. Loosen up and enjoy.  Ok, so you're not feeling it for just sushi? No problem, a menu/touch pad is on the table. Your order will arrive on a tray that shoots out from the kitchen to your table. No kidding. You'll be like ... What the??? Is this my order? Now your happy - hopefully laughing - other patrons are looking in amazement at just what happened and wishing it was them. Yes, it is your order, take it off the tray and push the button and back to the kitchen the tray goes. Very tech savvy, riiight?  But dude, what about quality/taste of the items? Ok, think to yourself ...  items are rotating on a conveyor belt like your suit case at baggage claim. Are you sitting at a sushi bar and doing shots with Jiro? Again, just trying to be funny ... Ok, my apologies. Sapporo offers a sampling (at a fair price) from nigiri style to specialty rolls to items that are not sushi related. I enjoyed my experience here, I tasted the offerings of tacos (cute taco shell), edamame (the garlic one is awesome), salmon nigiri (salmon belly ruled), toro - one piece nigiri, very thin slice - and different specialty rolls. Yes, I would come back here but only to show the concept with family and friends who've never experienced it. Ambiance, parking and service were spot on! Btw, happy hour is offered but starts at 11p@50% off.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The conveyor belt offerings and the menu pad for other items.
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get the garlic edamame! Get it!
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I should&#39;ve taken the covers off for the pics, sorry.

jc3ssAakABQL8jNxzPD_ag.text: Now that there is a new "Revolving" place in Chinatown,  this review becomes necessary. One is average AYCE quality. The other is Sapporo Revolving Sushi.  Quality of fish here is just next to some of the best in town, the service is great, the atmosphere is nearly elegant. Special shootout to the kitchen dishes (filet,ribeye,branzino,black cod, ramen,etc) which are all superb. Everything is made in-house, including excellent sauces and desserts. Literally cannot recommend this place highly enough. 6 stars

-PqccScY3RAkevFean2gOg.text: We went for early dinner on a Saturday night so there was no wait (6pm) but there was wine when heading out. The service was nice and food was prompt. Overall, fish was pretty fresh!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon

wX1xtwofFLJ44om5F_71Cw.text: Self ordering sushi places are not new in Asia but I guess it is considered new in Vegas. The place is fun but the taste leave a lot to be desired. The food came rather quickly which was a plus. The only thing I really liked and continued to order was the salmon belly. Most nigiri and rolls that I tried were not very fresh or overpacked with rice.   I probably wouldn't come back soon as there are plenty of other great sushi places in the valley. It's a try once for the experience only kinda place.

GTCov3hvzo9i3_xIJgb7lQ.text: Came here for their late night menu, most of their basic nigiri is available at half price, so $1.25 a plate, with 2 pieces of nigiri on each. Their regular menu items are available but not discounted. I think they had drinks deals too. There was pretty good selection in terms of fish including salmon, tuna, amberjack, etc all the classics. Service was very fast and we mostly just took plates off ourselves. The conveyer belt is very long and can hold a lot of options, we took one of each nigiri we saw and two of a few favorites and spent about $20-$25.  Overall I would say this isn't the best quality sushi I've ever had but it was fine and I don't know how good stuff off their a la carte menu is. I think if i were paying full price for these nigiri it would be a bit much but the late night prices are a good deal. I would recommend coming during late night unless you want to order things off the menu in which case it won't matter when you come.

02M6lxjKfLvJdM50ab4YIw.text: I've tried sapporo - spring mountain twice in the last month. Its a perfect late night sushi option near chinatown las vegas.  I love their happy hour deal. Each sushi/nigiri at their revolving belt is $1.75!!  The quality of the sushi/nigiri is better the most of the ayce places around town. The ramen for $5 is also a favorite.  I'm looking forward to coming back to sapporo whenever I get those late night sushi cravings.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Tuna Nigiri
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ramen and various sushi off the sushi belt

oM1v1jYHVhiIjoEp_JJDFg.text: Never had revolving sushi this good before. And there is option for toro, which was so satisfying. Very good sushi options. There are plenty of great restaurants in Vegas Chinatown and this one could be added to that list.  I like that there is little interaction with the staff. Any order you want that is not on the belt, you order through the iPad. A robot slides down and sends the food to you. Very simple to use. But staff was kind too. Considering this is revolving sushi, I don't understand how anyone could rate less than 5 stars. I highly recommend.

th3086c4PzicX0KwOA-3SA.text: Hands down the best revolving sushi I have had. The quality of the fish was fresh, and plenty of choices for a sushi lover.   In addition, I love the iPad ordering and robot delivering. Although, give some time for the robot waiter, orders can take time. ORDER EARLY!

2Ix9FDFp_8wu_r8aibfEig.text: You can't go wrong with a $2.50 revolving sushi place. Other than the revolving belt, all items can be ordered thru a touchpad system. Hot items can be added as well and delivered thru another conveyor system or by a server.  Be aware of the parking situation and long wait during rush hours. However, the restaurant states that you can park anywhere

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $2.50/plate

IxjQOX2lq-val1t3h1mxsA.text: So happy there's a revolving sushi place in Vegas! I'm used to Kura Revolving Sushi Bar in San Diego, and Sapporo is very similar in quality, with almost no waiting time (I've waited almost 2 hours once for Kura).   My favorites are the little salmon tacos and the Toro. In total, we grabbed about 15 plates from the belt and ordered about $10 worth from the iPad, which is much cheaper than some AYCE sushi places. We loved the little train that the food is transported on when ordered. Gives a very futuristic vibe haha  This is a great place to satisfy sushi cravings without stuffing yourself. There are times when they won't have a certain fish available, but there's so much variety that'll still make it worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. (From top to bottom) red snapper, garlic tuna, super white tuna
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stacks on stacks (toro on top and sweet shrimp on bottom are BOMB)
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon tacos (!!!)

ASwaUFJnsdic5cjeWHcNvg.text: Fabulous place! Love the ease of selections either on the conveyor belt or order specific items from the menu. The Black Garlic Ramen it is unbearable! Very garlic though so make sure if you're with a date you both eat it. The spicy tuna hand roll is good, not great, good though. Many selections to choose from and didn't find anything we didn't like. Go and take your time, enjoy well worth every penny especially with the expense of the food on the strip this is far better than anything there.

hnsl-nldms4y5TvgnM3Ixg.text: Sushi! Conveyor belt! I'm in!!!  I must admit that previous experiences with conveyor belt sushi establishments haven't gone well for me. I thought the sushi was straight up foul.   The sushi is actually very good here. Everything coming your way on the conveyer belt is also the same price of $2.50 per plate. I found the fish to taste fresh and everything was nicely balanced with fish to rice ratios.   You can also order plenty of additional items like full-sized rolls, appetizers and main dishes.   Just remember that if you're really hungry this can get pricey. You're paying for the conveyer belt here and ayce sushi is still cheaper with a wider variety of options. But when you need some extra fun in your life this place can't be beat!
