Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail, tuna &amp; super white

84TnRoUmkQp0VMLt0z5QFg.text: Happy hour on Saturday night at 11pm. Service was exceptional here. They are very attentive and quick. The price has gone up to $1.75 during happy hour and I do think quality has taken a bit of a hit as well. But I'm judging this by the value that you get. I don't think you will get this kind of value anywhere else with this type of quality. Even some of the budget sushi places in LA doesn't even come close to the quality here and you will be paying more. What I do wish is that some of the items that are not on the revolving sushi be ordered on the iPad. Depending on where you sit by the time the sushi gets to you it could be gone. Can certainly have it limited to a select few items and have a specific happy hour selection but we got a bit tired of seeing all of the same things over and over again. Would definitely come back again since it's great value.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour is $2 Japanese draft beers! Wow!

zM36LAQD3nryKz6dgn-kqA.text: Sapporo is the first restaurant in Las Vegas to offer "revolving sushi." It may sound like a gimmick, but it's a gimmick that works!  My brother and I shared a booth and also shared many of the items that came along the conveyor belt that runs throughout the restaurant. Each plate on the belt costs $2.50, and much like dim sum, they total up your plates at the end to see how much your owe. There's also a touchscreen where you can order items at various prices, and I highly recommend using it to get exactly what you want.  Although the revolving sushi came by frequently, we never saw any eel cruise by, so we ordered some from the touchscreen. That order came separately on a little car that ran on a track above the belt. Really cute, and you know it was fresh because it was made to order! The revolving sushi, on the other hand, was good, but you just don't know how many times it has moved along that belt before it gets to you  All told, we pulled 9 plates from the belt (salmon, hamachi, seaweed salad, and a few rolls) and ordered 3 more (eel) from the touchscreen. Adding in a large Sapporo beer, the bill was right around $40, so with a nice tip from my brother, we had a great meal for $50.  Sapporo is definitely worth a visit, if only for the novelty factor. But I'll be back for that $2.50 eel!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our special-ordered eel. One went rogue!

2V7CiCclRCtW8E5Wy6dioA.text: Came for their Happy Hour and wasn't disappointed. We arrived at 11pm on a Saturday and of course there was a wait (but not too long!).   Decided to kill time by stopping at the bar to take advantage of their 50% off Japanese Draft Beer. The bartender was helpful. He even gave me a taste of Asahi since I don't recall which one I liked better (Sapporo vs Asahi). Costing only $2 a glass, how can you say no to that Happy Hour deal?   Even before we were done with our beer, we were shown to our seats. The booth was huge and comfy. (You can fit six people easily.) The conveyor belt was easily accessible. Appreciated the fact that there was a cover over each dish. (Some guy at another table was sneezing like no tomorrow.)  The conveyor belt had a variety of choices. The slices of sashimi was generous, while the rice underneath was minimal. The sushi rolls are 4 pieces per dish for the most part. There were appetizers such as seaweed salad and edamame. (Note: Garlic Edamame is spicy. It isn't labeled that way so beware!) And don't worry! If by the time the conveyor belt comes around to you and you're only greeted with a plaque with the name of the dish and no dishes to follow, it will be quickly replenished the next time around. Oh, and I nearly forgot, each dish is only $1.50 during Happy Hour.   And whatever you can't find on the conveyor belt, you can order it from the screen located at your table. We wanted a miso soup to wash down all the deliciousness and was not disappointed when it was brought to us. (Sorry soup doesn't come flying out on top of the tracks of the conveyor belt!) However, Happy Hour prices doesn't apply to items ordered off of the screen.   Overall, it was a fun and filling late night meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Variety of choices!
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Zeland King Salmon
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Popcorn Lobster Roll

nMtNq16jhA0wkjXI5BsJUA.text: The sushi was very delicious here and I was skeptical because the other revolving sushi places I've been had mediocre and sub par quality.   This is easily the best sushi I've had in Vegas and the ginger they serve you is very tasty.   Even their non fish food like the pork belly was very good.   I highly recommend this place. The price is right here too.

NaQSxKlOvYBcxVK9bXnzsQ.text: My family and I ate here today quite possibly for the last time. We drive the 30 minutes from Southern Highlands because we love the sushi here. Today's visit however has me just disgusted. We arrived, were not greeted by anyone. I signed in as "Big Bird" party of 3 (my husband said to pick a funny name). We were going to sit down and wait for a table however when I turned toward the front windows all I saw were BUGS crawling all over the seats and windows. My son had already sat down and had them smashed on the back of his shirt. We immediately informed a staff member who seemed to brush it off( the bug problem, not my sons shirt). We were then greeted by Nina who asked us if we had signed in, we said yes and told her about the pest problem. (So now two employees know, or so we thought) We were seated, ordered just water which took far to long to come. I ordered a miso soup and had to inform the waitress that I had done so and hadn't received it yet. Then my son says "there's a bug in my food and he's alive! Sure enough still alive and straight from the kitchen! We informed the waitress and she took the plate away. Next thing we know a manager is walking by our table with fly traps! Obviously they already knew there was a problem if they already had the traps in their possession! I hate to say it because we LOVE the sushi here but please find the root of the problem and fix it (your bar probably) do not just band aid it with fly traps! No apologies given leads me to say our trip to Sapporo will be our last until they fix the bug problem and customer service problem!!

FuIJGcMNhJANosz-OGkdNg.text: Love this place, sushi is good. Awesome little robots bring you your food (if it isn't soup, got to be safe!) anyway, quality of food is good. I do suggest to order your own potstickers or any sushi that has fried food... you don't want it to be soggy when you get it.

jA51ciR7nPP6O7CdDbYJeA.text: Been looking forward to experience a revolving sushi, this place just ace it from the experience to ambiance to food quality. Very good sushi, service is good. I only gave 4 stars cuz we don't have this in Jersey. Definitely recommends this place to everyone having a vacay at Vegas. Hope to come visit this place again soon.

HOYXZkBi0xWNFunLAZ1rjg.text: Every year when we come to Vegas we visit this place. Good food and our daughter loves it. We are happy with it as well. Not the best sushi, but a lot of family fun.

iIZvyLIQ6XQrR8c3yJnNsw.text: Great place to eat and try unique sushi combinations.  Be sure to get there early as it gets quite busy quickly.

VfcNgp36DlatlN3cXIeDmw.text: I went to this place for a late lunch while I was on vacation in Las Vegas. My first impression of this place was very good, clean dinning area with a huge sushi conveyor system in the middle of the room. Overall, I have a great experience and the sushi were freshly made. On that day, we have about 30+ plate and our bill was decently price ($ 2.50 per plate). I definitely recommend this place for dinning off the Vegas strip and I would come back for a second seating if I ever visit Las Vegas again.

DVjEyeZ9vaw9HenDtwPUuQ.text: Really enjoyed the selection, the pieces were all very fresh and the prices were great!

c1o1T9lHaWvH3Afw1apW4g.text: This place is simply amazing. Great service, affordable, good quality, and the kitchen is very clean! Great for groups or a date. I have nothing bad to say about this place. Happy hour is the best!

ALzREU9XT05c7zPqnlBxPw.text: By no means am I a sushi aficionado, however I do enjoy a good tiger roll. What I enjoy even more is a place I can get that roll, and my kid and other half can choose completely different options and be just as happy. Another major plus, being able to eat as soon as I sit down. Just start grabbing as much as you can shovel in right off the conveyor in front of you.  My boyfriend doesn't eat sushi at all. His go to meal here is the black garlic ramen, the gyoza, the brussels, and the edamame. Me, I switch it up every time. With the sushi coming in 2-4 pieces a serving, you can try everything within a few visits.  The drink options are solid and great prices. Honestly, the prices here in general are great. If you're lucky enough to come at happy hour for the $1.50 plates, you can get insanely full for $20.  My only reason for the 4 stars instead of 5 is the consistency is lacking a bit. I notice some days the ramen will be more garlic-ey than other days. Sometimes the conveyor belt has WAY more options. No huge complaints just things I've noticed.  I hear they're expanding and I look forward to trying the new location as well.

1LF-tUpxBUg5ZXVOwkKcuw.text: Tasty, beer, great sushi,  great staff... great atmosphere...will return and enjoy more fresh sushi...love the technology they use.....

iGvc_OAq_AYSZmm-OizASQ.text: I literally loved it here so much I hope they bring it to Seattle! We need a sushi conveyer belt situation like this that isn't crappy or over-priced haha. (yes I'm talking about Genki hehe)  I don't remember the last time I went to a restaurant and was treated so well as I was here. The waiters/waitresses are so nice and very understanding. I went with a big group and we are definitely the type to ask for one thing after another, the waitress we had was so incredibly nice and was never once annoyed by any of our requests.  The food was on point. I love the train/robot thingy system (lol) that brings out some of your dishes. It gives the restaurant this futuristic vibe. It's also a very well-decorated/cute restaurant too if you couldn't tell from the pictures. Prices here are incredibly reasonable. Being from Seattle, I think we're a little used to paying more for food. I hope that if they do bring it here they can somewhat honor the prices ;) ! The food was such a huge hit at the table we couldn't keep anything on it for more than a few minutes. I honestly think we went through more than 30 plates of food... crazy, but absolutely delicious!  I need to fly back to Vegas just for one more dinner haha.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-X61PPzy0RUs-iw1l3VwxQ.text: I'm never going back to AYCE sushi! My boyfriend and I have been wanting to try this place for months and finally we got the chance. We came in on a Wednesday at 7pm, it wasn't packed yet so we got a table right away. When you walk in a nice hostess showed us to our table, and the inside felt very clean and open. When we got to our table we were asked what we would like to drink, nothing was really explained to us but we already kinda knew what to do and how it all worked. The sushi on the belt is 2.50 for each plate. And of course you can order on the iPad and the little sushi train comes to you and you click the button to send it back. The waiters didn't come around a lot which I like, just to refill my drinks. Now for the AMAZING sushi!!! If I had a second stomach I would have kept eating! It taste so fresh and clean. The nigiri isn't drenched in sauce. It was the first time having a salmon taco and now I'm addicted!   Best to most okay sushi we had (there is no bad sushi):  -salmon tacos  -filet mignon nigiri (my boyfriends favorite) -New Zealand King salmon nigiri  -snow crab nigiri  -shrimp tempura with Ikura  -yellowtail tacos  -baby yellowtail nigiri -shrimp tacos  -White tuna  -toro nigiri  -yellowtail nigiri  -bluefin tuna  -Japanese mackerel nigiri  -smoked salmon nigiri -orange salmon   And we ended it all with a nice miso soup. I would highly recommend everyone try this place at least once! Our total was a little over $90, which for how much we ate and how fresh it all was it was worth it! I can't wait to go back and try some other nigiri and some rolls

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon tacos! My favorite!
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked salmon
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The front of the restaurant

5BAeK76A4MKmoEyQLalmZw.text: Wanna go for a quick sushi bite? The Sapporo is the place to go. The sushi on the belt is good and fresh. Whatever you order from the menu arrives on a little robot car. Staff was friendly. No complaints.

bz-CjU0nA5u__htcHRNx5A.text: It was far the high end sushi for Conveyor belt sushi place. It was busy on Saturday but it was worth the wait. Clean and tables are divided with three different section with three conveyor belt. Small portions of rice and sushi on top which was right proportion. If I come back to Vegas, I will come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front entrance

5dfPt-SNEazDjGjFLCrzIQ.text: Writing a review for a revolving sushi place with a large menu can be hard, since I don't personally think that I've developed the sophisticated palate to differentiate just-okay fish from supreme fish. With that being said, I'll just list a few menu items I really liked and thought was a great value to get at the place. Deducting a star because the rice was dry and a little on the tough side.   1. Uni, really sweet and fresh. Unlike a lot of AYCE places with salty sea water tasting/fishy uni; 2. Premium Yellowtail nigiri: the fish was just so buttery! 3. Salmon belly: same reason as #2. 4. The yuzu dessert cake: two pieces of perfect bite sized cake to end a meal  We also ordered some large plates (tuna tartare, something of yellowtail, scallops, etc.) They were just okay. They have ramen as well. With $2.5/small plate, I can see it being a good place for a quick lunch and a quick stop to satisfy some sushi cravings.  I'd definitely want to go back and try more things.

v1PxEH6c2ipRdq6p0lSQXQ.text: Now this is a place to come and eat! Great service, the waiters are amazing. There's a tablet on each table where you can order food through an app and it comes to your table on a conveyer belt! How cool is that, there's a conveyer belt that has a wide variety of sushi on it and can eat as soon as you sit down. For a place that is pretty much automated don't think it's not a personal experience, they have plenty staff and you can see the cooks through plexiglass and see just how this place operates and see they're hustling their butts off.   Now I came here 2 times in one week, it's more than affordable and if you come during happy hour, plates are pretty much half off.   I can see this place becoming a chain. Only because it's super busy, and people really enjoy it, no ones got frowny faces in here lol! Love this place.

bEfqhjrWzaN9IEJgedcbhg.text: It's a nice place for lunch, came round noon time, probably less than 20min wait on Tuesday. Since I am not hungry, only ate 5 plates and a bowl of ramen. The price is pretty cheap, $2.50 for each plate and a bowl of ramen only for $4.25. Even if you order from the kitchen for whole roll, average around $8. Great price and great food.

SRPrVQNSjjcubrKGsl7bFA.text: This concept is so cool!!!! I'm a big sushi lover so to be able to sit down and have sushi come to me is probably the best thing I can think of lol. The prices were great and the sushi was even better.   Tip: don't get the pistachio ice cream (Horrendous). Go for a basic flavor like vanilla or chocolate.

Uqr8uv4-e1qHD8dIjEgt3Q.text: I like the layout of the place and how it's set up with booths. It's good for groups or individual. I've been to a few sushi places with revolving Sushi and it felt more of a communal experience which I didn't like.   You can also order sushi or appetizers or drinks or desserts through an iPad. They have one at each table. What's cool is that someone either brings out to your table or a machine slides down to your table.  The sushi was okay. Honestly, for $2.50 a plate, I didn't think it was worth the price. One can't help but wonder why it's that expensive for how it tastes. I'm sure the quality is great with fresh ingredients and good quality fish but it just didn't taste all too great for me. It was just okay. I would much rather go to an all you can eat sushi place and get the same amount of food for better taste.  The service was great. They were attentive and nice. They were friendly. They were also very quick but they weren't hawkish.   I'd probably come here with a group if someone wants to go here but it wouldn't be the place I recommend first.

IeBUyDdMmwM1yqC0e1M7RQ.text: This was our first time here. At first we were a little annoyed because we had to wait for a table when there were many empty tables,  but once we got seated it was great.  We ordered some Ramen and an order of Tempura Vegetables. Then we had several of the Sushi plates that came around.  We were expecting the bill to be around $80 - $90,  but it was only $37.50. Wow that was amazing.  Great food at a great price,  friendly staff. We will definitely be going again.

HJjKTjmG42W3BacoDlGyLg.text: I can see the appeal of this place. It appeals to people who enjoy mediocre sushi. It's not that great. The prices help control costs if you don't want to do AYCE. I did enjoy the hand rolls but everything else was okay.

0OKcVjTV-X8t3JxqiFLGRw.text: My friends and I wanted to see what all the hype was about so we tried this place out!  It is a pretty cool concept, but takes a bit to get used to.  The conveyor belt goes pretty fast and theres this interesting robot machine thing on top that drops off food (which confused us a bit cause we never knew if the food on there was for us or the table next to us).  I did like that we were able to order from the tableside tablet.  Everything is pretty good but can get pretty pricey.  I think the place is cool for a chill girls dinner date but I would never take my man here I would rather go to an AYCE sushi place.

rTkEYSLpEQ8pvTFfpP3qMg.text: Wow this place is legit!!! The sushi here is super fresh and all the plates are 2.50. Not what I expected for such a good price. The fish was amazing especially the Japanese Mackerel the Toro and the super white Tuna unreal so good!!!!!

j-IMeKi7OZAv_CO2NJBUzg.text: Amazing! Go during happy hour and it's only $1.50 a roll! We only paid $22 for a ton of sushi! The waitress was really funny and a great help too!

WUNkcckrnoqa0lWIGLxBpg.text: As this is the first conveyor belt sushi place in town, I was skeptical. To my surprise, the fish was decently fresh for $2.50/plate and replenished with diligence through the night. The toro sushi was fantastic! Black Garlic ramen was tasty as well. The cooked ebi dish from the kitchen was overly salted, but I wasn't devastated over it. Would come every week if the wait weren't 40+ minutes long! Hope the wait time dies down so I can get my fast sushi fix here on the regular.

2kr65Cb0OU8QJIxQa_7Iog.text: Finally! Something similar to Hawaii's genki sushi! My family and I have been looking forward to coming here since it first opened and we finally did today! Pros - clean, neat, friendly staff. I love restaurants where the kitchen is visible so you know what goes on back there, and this is one of 'em. Everything on the conveyor belt is $2.50 and there are other varieties that you can order off the menu (iPad). Wanted to see what the hype was about with their black garlic ramen and the hype is real! Love it! Cons - with all the AYCE sushi restaurants in Las Vegas, coming here can be pricier (especially if you love sushi, like my family and I). Most of the nigiri plates on the belt mostly comes in twos. Their ama ebi & uni, which is always a must for me whenever I go to sushi restaurants, only came in one piece. Their fish to rice ratio is like many sushi spots. Our total came out to a little over $60 for three adults and a 5 y/o. Were we satisfied? Not really. Would I come here again? Maybe just for the black garlic ramen. I'd much rather go to an AYCE restaurant where I can get more for my buck.

p-CkQISUObbagRGFjWm2pw.text: It is a little on the expensive side but the sushi is very tasty and it comes on a train for you !! Seaweed salad is a must try!!

US4lwSGcFRx7eqek6tZxQA.text: 2nd time was better. They added more to the menu. Service was still nice. And food was perfect

swGyjOd8eDqeL4KiTdqT9Q.text: The idea is fantastic and the revolving sushi with robot delivery is definitely the star here!  The sushi quality is about average and orders from the iPad menu take a bit too long to come out,and it was a bit too long for us to get seated in the first place. The revolving sushi was decent, down side is some have been sitting out longer than others, you can tell by rice freshness, up side is assortment is great. Those little plates add up quickly beware! The service definitely leaves something to be desired, it is a struggle to get anything from the waiters like sauce and drinks, etc. Ambiance is amazing, idea is fantastic. No wifi, which is a bit of a shock given the hi tech nature of their delivery system.  All around, definitely check it out, and if they boost up the food and service quality it will be a go to spot for sure!

JyUZrnbs1ZFeGM4xqAaBeg.text: I go to Sapporo Revolving Sushi every once in a while and I do think that the food is good enough to make you come back. Plus, with all you can eat establishments everywhere in the area where Sapporo is located, this place is definitely a go-to when we don't feel like eating too much. They have plenty of selections when it comes to appetizers and (of course) sushi but they also have ramen too! I highly recommend their Black Garlic Ramen if you're in the mood for ramen.   The only issue I have with this establishment is customer service. Although most of the job is already being done by the revolving machine (to bring your food, since you can just grab most of the things that you want), it still takes a long time to get our drinks refilled or to find a server that would help us. I understand that there's a lot going on behind the scenes, but if you don't watch your customers attentively then you will surely deter them from possibly coming to your establishment again.  Negative experiences aside, if you would like to try this place, please do so! We don't have revolving sushi in Vegas, so this is definitely something that you should try.

K20XpmFqOt4msjs8-xnVdw.text: GREAT CONCEPT.. Food was good - prices were great and the place is clean. Super cool vibe! Well designed and modern. Fun lunch date we were in and out just before the crowd. I'd definetly recommend. I loved the sexy girl roll.

tifOr1U6HQWYXneaP0vRkA.text: A lot of my acquaintances were visiting this restaurant and I had to give it a try myself as this is one of the only revolving sushi restaurants in Vegas. I came at lunch time on a Monday so it wasn't entirely busy and I admired how attentive the servers were. They explained to us the process of ordering conveyor belt style and there was an iPad available at each table for you to order from. I ordered the shrimp tornado which was extremely flavorful as well as the garlic edamame. I realized that ordering from the iPad would give you the full size order of the rolls while grabbing items off the conveyor belt had smaller portions for $2.50, which was pretty nice. I took a popcorn lobster off the conveyor belt because I wanted to try it, but my review is 4 stars because of that. I loved the flavors they were trying to present but the lobster itself wasn't doing it for me. It seemed almost all batter in comparison to lobster meat. Nonetheless I do enjoy this place and I look forward to coming back because their quality seems fresh and I want to their speciality kitchen menu items. Overall, with the full shrimp tornado roll, garlic edamame, and mini popcorn lobster roll off the conveyor belt the price came out to be $15 which isn't too expensive at all! If I could give 4.5 stars instead of 4 I would.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Tornado roll with garlic edamame! Yum

ddY2uhviaAAm0RbBm1XmGw.text: Super mediocre sushi place but of course I had to try it since it was our first revolving sushi restaurant in Vegas. Maybe I just went on a bad day but who knows. The fish to rice ratio is a lot of rice with a little fish and I definitely do not like that. I also thought the fish was pretty dry as if it's been sitting out for a long while. The good thing about this place was that our waiter was very nice.

xb2NMBGGpHgRZOj4guVB5A.text: Great restaurant.  I am a vegetarian and they had a lot of great choices for me.

-F3lstbqmn-uX8oJz0EB_w.text: Revolving sushi is fun for what it is. I'm spoiled with revolving sushi in California where the selection is huge and they even have where you deposit your empty plates and it records and adds to your tab how many you've eaten instead of stacking up plates on the table. If Sapporo had both of those things, This restaurant would be solid. As far as service goes, the servers could probably pay a little more attention. I feel as if they think they don't have to check up on their tables as much because it's self serve for the most part but not really think about drink refills and special orders from the kitchen.

YXQm7RFaEV0jXZDRGR3LJg.text: Love it. Sushi is already prepared and ready for you to select as soon as you sit down. Very fresh and flavorful.

7NgDDEu58maBVENt41S5Ww.text: Interesting concept. Was a little skeptical about eating sashimi/nigiri from tiny little plates circulating around the room. However! Pleasantly surprised by the spicy tuna, eel, mini salmon tacos and lobster selected! Nothing was as delightfully silly as the Salmon Belly, though. Mmmm...!Menu items didn't disappoint either. I'd definitely go back.

VtYEbqr-XPpT4cfaSnqLbw.text: Absolute fun and great experience! Kids loved it! So did we. Definitely recommend trying all the dishes on the belt. Soups were on point too! Price was $2.50 any dishes on the belt.  Definitely worth the stop while in town.  Good times, thanks Sapporo staff!

Z8HzCIIWGuanSPnYfNv9IA.text: Tried this restaurant out on date night on a Friday night. Got there around 8pm and there was at least five parties ahead of us. The wait wasn't long. We were able to get a table in reasonable time. It was a nice experience. We mainly resorted to picking out from the conveyor belt...ordered a few appetizers from the iPad on the table, as well as a few drinks from the bar. The restaurant itself was crazy busy. One thing I do have to point out was the staff was very friendly. Also, one thing I like is seeing everything clean and everyone diligently working. The staff matched the pace of the restaurant traffic. Another thing I liked was the management was also very nice and was also helping the wait staff with tables and bussing. I have already recommended this place to a few friends. I enjoyed the food very much I could barely breathe! We took about 17 different plates. My favorites were: peppered tuna, lobster roll, their gyozas (cooked to my level of satisfaction). I didn't really like the drink I ordered the peach melon margarita because it was strong (but I'm a lightweight when it comes to alcohol) so I'm sure others will enjoy! Based on the service, cleanliness, and price I would have to say I would be coming here again soon and with others so they can try it too!

-8YAWRFGmJbdr3ILtn0_bA.text: Love love love. This is a must.  I can't wait to go back.  Great prices, quality sushi. Super fun, atmosphere excellent service.  Run don't walk.  Extra special ps don't leave without trying the green tea mousse cake.  That alone is worth the trip.

MqwIzMhCA48QADn3NwPy7g.text: Sapporo is great! Wonderful concept and fresh fish.  Continually putting out new plates. Love that you can order on touch screen if you want something not on the belt rather than having to wait. Ramen is fabulous too. Staff is friendly.

I wish I had pictures but I only took videos. =\ You won't be disappointed!

zr78o4WtVuPi8jBhwSwS7w.text: When it first opened the sushi tasted good. I think now the quality of sushi has gone down. However the concept is still cool but not sure if I will be back again since I can get fresher sushi elsewhere

QZ-iDKVYROyoCj_Vj5_QOw.text: Sushi could climb in quality but for the price you will be happy ! Some of the best UDON I've had. Kids love it with the robots and tram around the place. Great fun. I will be back

AgX9VCgvm_5bSpFIyipijg.text: Just went early this morning at like 12am lol it was for my fiance and his twinss birthday. We all had an amazing time and enjoyed all the sushi that cane our way. Our server was really nice and actually gave my fiance his beer for free :) I definitely will be coming back.

CRIN8eCVR8NHMEa-uD6r4A.text: The service was great . All the rolls were fresh and very tasty. The black garlic ramen was good as well. Our new favorite sushi place

1qIHXtR7XYRzJmqjsCmvqA.text: I love this place. I like the flat price point on all the dishes on the conveyor belt...cheap enough that you can try something new. Also the train thing that delivers your food from the kitchen is pretty awesome as well.

YAhcqTJz_RvCzcunBwpUDA.text: Sapporo Revolving Sushi excellent no problems with the food. The only issue is the prices $7.50 caterpillar roll come on. I left paying over $50 and for that I can go to Makino for $30 and all you eat buffet. Sapporo needs to something with prices.

bMTQsEQOy5fS8QReRPtEmw.text: Awesome, Fresh...nice hostesses, went on a Saturday afternoon wasn't too long of a wait even with one side being down...Will Return.

XMf_vrl7EGMYLVgv0vHleQ.text: After I saw a revolving sushi joint opened up in town I had to go. Moving from an ocean side town to the desert I'm usually skeptical on the freshness of sushi.  So when I went to this place I was curious how the fish would be.  Well....  It was great.  The sushi is awesome here and have since been back for lunch and dinner 4 times.  It seems every time I go there's a guy in the back right filleting fresh fish which is good to see.  The sushi is awesome and the staff are great!  Inbn reccomend the fried softshell crab its the best.

1BqseflnlC3nU1-sQO38lg.text: I was hesitant by the name. I pictured not so fresh or sushi that's been sitting around like at a buffet. That is not the case. I was surprised at the selection. It was fresher than fresh. I'll be back.

IhwMMp2BspTI9SEQdSORNA.text: It's an okay place. I do like the concept of it and i like the way they price their food but i don't feel like the food always taste fresh and i wasn't too into their ramen.

4TAVpLg3_TJ5HHLd4a-pHw.text: What's not to love about this place? Went two days ago with my husband and Irene gave us the best service we've ever had! Amazing fresh sushi for an awesome price. I'm so glad to have this place in town! They also have a delicious selection of noodles and fried shrimp!

pjOjhzMznaUZPisgV-Xhbg.text: For revolving sushi, this place had so many good selections to choose from! Very affordable! We came on a Thurs night, and there wasn't any wait. We got seated immediately and began eating right away. My favorite was the salmon tacos. Very unique and super good! I will definitely be back!

_4qpiyBY9mZJO3iioy5IMA.text: It was so great!! The food, atmosphere & customer service was exceptional! Had a great time & will definitely be back! Thank you for a great experience!

S5u43Er-5-GRWL562ss7Vw.text: Went here the first week it was opened then 3 more times since then. I absolutely love this place. Highly recommend. Tuna tar tar is to die for. Black garlic ramen is amazing. Actually I tried just about everything on the menu and I didn't hate anything. The owner is very attentive and the wait staff is awesome.

lzz_zsRy2kb-0HexRTXKiw.text: So happy to have revolving sushi in Las Vegas finally! I thought this place was great. Good selection, interesting items on the menu, loved the "robot" the delivers the custom orders. My only complaint is it is a bit pricey. For the price, I expected better quality and plating.

Sh-__UoP04PY9wnwaDJqMQ.text: Conveyor belt sushi finally hit Las Vegas! I've been itching to experience revolving sushi and I'm so thankful it finally arrived in the Valley!  The concept is pretty simple. There is a conveyor belt full of different kinds of sushi (with labels right before the plates) where you can pick up the food you desire. From what I've seen, most of the plates come with 1-4 pieces. Do also note that desserts are not available to pick up on the conveyor belts. I learned that the conveyor belt actually has sensors on it that will alert the staff if the sushi has been there for more than 30 minutes so it can be replaced with fresh sushi, which settles my original apprehension of the safety of the food revolving around the restaurant for hours. At the end of your meal, the servers count how many plates you have on your table and add it to your bill since it is not automatically counted. Since I had come a little later in the evening (around midnight on a Thursday), there wasn't much going around the conveyor belt. Because of this, we had to get our food through the ordering system on the tablet.  Each table gets a tablet with the menu to choose from. These items include nigiri sushi, specialty rolls, tempura, ramen, appetizers, and dessert. The menu is not extensive, but it surely is enough. Prices are pretty reasonable. It is $2.50 for two pieces of nigiri (1 piece for some choices such as toro, ama-ebi, and bluefin tuna), a little under $10 for speciality rolls, etc.  After selecting the items you want to order, you place your order and wait for the chefs to make your dishes. It took about 10 minutes for the chefs to complete each of my orders. You receive your order from the kitchen via an electronic track on top of the conveyor belt. A machine travels to your table, lights up and plays a prerecorded message signaling you to pick up your food, and returns back to the kitchen.  Sushi quality was pretty good and tasted fresh. It is comparable to most of AYCE sushi spots across town. I was also able to try the salmon tacos and enjoyed them. The crunchy wonton shells were a great contrast compared to the fish.  Service was very limited. I did not interact with any staff aside from getting seated, introducing us to the ordering system, the occasional drink refill/plate clean-up, and receiving the bill when prompted on the ordering system. However, the interactions I had were all positive.  Overall, the price is competitive to the AYCE sushi prices around town for a higher quality without the inherent pressure to stuff my face with food to get my money's worth. I would warn you to be cautious if you are a big eater, though. Prices can add up fast if you don't pay attention! For anyone who hasn't experienced conveyor belt sushi, I would recommend trying this place out! Being the only one of its kind in Las Vegas, this place will catch a lot of attention soon!

VO8BJzraYZUBcWcPceAVIQ.text: I'm not a huge fan of sushi but my friends wanted to go so I came along. I was surprised to see how many other non sushi items they had on the menu. I was still able to get the full experience by ordering many dishes including udon, edamame and gyoza (on the revolving belt). I was full! And it was still very inexpensive. I would come again!

X3FhFcY-_a2Q2PuqU4-TkA.text: revolving system can be gimmicky but this place does it well  good quality sushi for las vegas  $2.50/plate is a decent price, but gotta watch out or it adds up quick!!

EwJX4LKaaQX38bkrh7HU9A.text: The food is really really good I liked everything and I also liked how they add music in the background and that all of the waiters are fluent with is really good and they are also really really nice to everyone I loved the experience thank u guys

wikKUbe2xqnnYFeGvpuHEA.text: Cool experience, but I've had better quality sushi at other revolving sushi restaurants. Notably one in San Francisco that is in Japan town. Toro and scallops was super fishy. Highlights were the yellowtail, sea bass, and uni was good but was a small portion. We also ordered udon and ramen. Udon broth was too sweet and ramen broth was bland. I would skip going here next time and try ayce places.

5OehvEkZgNIO5SNf-CukaQ.text: Came here with my boyfriend. Sushi is pretty decent for a very reasonable price.   Service: 5 stars Giving this spot 5 stars because of the stellar service by CLIFF!! Best host in Las Vegas hands down!! Super friendly and always smiles. Made my dining experience top notch!!   Food: 4.5 stars  Good sushi for very reasonable price. Come here mon-Thur starting at 10pm til close for happy hour!!   Definitely would recommend this spot!

4o853UrI83Qddk7mIWBTJg.text: While visiting Las Vegas we were in the mood for sushi as a late night dinner after seeing a show on the strip. We went to Sapporo after checking out the reviews. We came during their late night happy hour that had several liquor specials as well as half off the sushi on the revolving belt.  We first started by the bar to grab some beer as we waited for our table to be set. The bartender was great and was nice enough to have us sample the beers offered before ordering. Once we were seated, the staff informed us how it worked. Mainly you grab the plates of sushi off the belt and keep the plates at the end for them to calculate the total. You can also order other dishes on the tablet, but they are not counted in the happy hour special. The special order items either are served by your server or comes out to your table on the robotic tray above the belt of moving sushi. The sushi selection on the belt was a mixture of special rolls and nigiri. The sushi was very fresh tasting. I thought that their special rolls were interesting in combination of flavors. What's also cool is you can see a slight view of the chefs making the food in the back.  Service was overall very good as the staff very very friendly and helpful.

h7Z8-HHP8zC9gg5NYw78cA.text: Omg! Please get the popcorn lobster . I normally don't like to order sushi for delivery because it doesn't seem fresh like as in prepared in front of you. But this didn't disappoint

Gj_pXAy7ZsqkM2BBugc5DA.text: If you're looking for something different and a fun experience (especially for kids), then check this place out but as far as the quality of food you probably won't be back again. The service here was fine. You honestly don't really see the waitstaff very often; drinks and taking certain dishes away or questions.  The overall experience is fun with the conveyor belts and ordering your items on the touchscreen. Our 6 year old thought it was so cool. Great opportunity for some fun photo/videos for your social media.   The actual sushi was the disappointment. Everything we had was just okay. My husband and I usually do AYCE sushi because we love sushi and have huge appetites. Our appetites are too big for a place like this and the quality of the sushi just wasn't there. We were still hungry and could have ate more but we honestly just didn't want anymore of what they had.   They need to fix their soda machine. Our sodas were super flat. I've read other reviews and it seems to be a consistent problem.   One more thing that I think the restaurant needs to work on is the menu. Any other sushi spot would tell you on the menu exactly what's in the sushi; inside has these ingredients, outside has these ingredients and we use this sauce. I have food allergies, so it's annoying not being able to see what's in my sushi and having to call a waiter over to ask.

uYfWXiazj4RhP9JbdCRFrQ.text: We went back to this wonderful place last night.  I have to say I'm even more impressed with it the second time around.  I've been to other places with the revolving belt sushi option and the concern was always that the sushi was not fresh.  That's definitely not the case with this place.  There are 3 total belts and several sushi chefs making sushi fresh every second.  Plus there is an iPad on your table that lets you order in an instant!  You want an appetizer just select it on the iPad and it gets sent back to the kitchen immediately.  The best part is a robot brings it out to you within minutes.  Yes a robot! It comes down the track above the sushi belt and stops at your table, the lights blink and a voice instructs you to take your dish.  When you grab it, the robot goes straight back to the kitchen where it came from.  Your kids will love it, your friends will love it,  you will love it.  The sushi is high grade and the service is stunning.  A must visit destination for sure.

ikNQCU0hJ0262_l26XQH3w.text: Finally! Revolving sushi in Las Vegas. I'm super happy it is finally here.  I know it seemed like a fading fad from the 90s but I assure you, where I am originally from, it never went out of style. Where I moved from, revolving sushi made a come back around 2013. But for some reason, it never made it to Vegas until now. And I understand why, when there's AYCE sushi almost everyone where in Vegas.  The layout for Sapporo is different from what I am accustomed to.  As my husband and I figured out a few minutes after being seated, there are three sections in the restaurant. Therefore, there are 3 conveyor belts.  They serve the same things, just on three different belts. So if your belt is running low on dishes, well, the other one is full. However, you can't just get up and reach over someone's table to get that one dish because that's just plain rude.  In the normal revolving sushi restaurant, the kitchen is in the middle of the restaurant and the belt goes all the way around the restaurant. In this way, the belt is always full.  Sapporo does have a nice system on each table where you can submit regular orders of sushi, order dessert, miso soup, three different ramen options, udon, and other items that are on the belt. In fact, the family that sat across from us had two little boys. The boys favorite dishes were the taco shrimp and taco yellow tail. The taco shell is made of deep fried won ton wraps. Because people were snatching up the tacos faster than it could get to us, the family submitted three separate orders of the tacos using the tablet. The tacos were electronically zipped over to the family right above the belt. It was so cool!  The items from the belt had your usual items like tuna, yellow tail, crunch, shrimp, tamago (egg), crab leg, philly rolls.  They also had something called sexy girl.  Depending on the roll, there is either 1 to 4 rolls to a plate. For example, the tamago had 2 items, the crab leg had only 1, the mexican roll had 3 items, while the philly and lobster crunch had four rolls. Each plate is reasonably priced $2.50/each. And I have to say, it was pretty good. My favorites, the tamago, lobster crunch and yellow tail taco. Damn! I just realized, they didn't have any gyoza! I always get gyoza! :(  My husband ordered the miso soup and the broth was really good.  My husband also ordered a bowl of tonkatsu ramen, which is a small bowl at $4.25. I thought the broth for the ramen was ok, but I would order it again. I do think the size and the price is really good.  The one thing it didn't have, desserts on the belt. :( You have to order from the tablet menu. And the desserts are slim pickings. There's no mochi ice cream, but there is tiramisu (which is Italian) and ice cream (pineapple sorbet, vanilla, pistachio and green tea). Tiramisu is $6.95 (yipes) and ice cream is $2.95/each.  And although garlic spicy edamame was on the belt, that was $3.50. The typical revolving sushi has different plate colors that determine the price of the dish. Sapporo has one dish color with a set price of $2.50/each. However, the edamame is in a bowl. I'm assuming that anything in a bowl on the belt is $3.50?? In any case, during this visit, the only thing on the belt in a bowl was the garlic edamame.  Get here early or get here really late as they close at 2 am. My husband and I got here around 5:30 when they opened up the last section. However, when we left at 6:45, there was a lot of people waiting.  The service was good. The restaurant is nice and clean with contemporary decor.   I definitely like the price. My average number of plates at revolving sushi is 5. For me, the price is right. However, if you have a husband like mines where he wants to try everything, then a dinner/lunch date is actually comparable to AYCE sushi.

9zielwKaaIDcEA3immFRWw.text: The place is quite new, located on Spring Mountain where a gun store used to be. The place is nice, airy and open, clean. It's called revolving because the sushi delivery system is 'revolving', just pick which ones you like. There is a tabletop ordering system too which shows different menu items like ramen, udon, oysters, etc. The wait staff is fast, friendly, and helpful. Each of the saucers on the revolving system are $2.50. Their prices are reasonable for the other menu items too. Sushi choices are the same as other places. Sushi tasted really fresh.  I like the novelty of it all and only time will tell if things stay as they are or change. I recommend it.

P9iQinHPDcX9MQfz-rzCvA.text: Fam, friends and I went to this place for lunch. I was amazed how nice it was in there plus how cool the revolving tray lines were. The best part is the robot tray server that brings your order above the tray lines. It was a good different.  I really enjoy the way we can easily pick our sushi off of the conveyor belt and the ease of ordering from the tablet menus. The servers are quick, courteous, friendly and fast with our order. The dish on the conveyor belt are all $2.50 a piece. You can also order a full roll, appetizers, ramens, and desserts. All reasonable priced.   We ordered everything to try, everything was delicious! Our favorite were the shrimp tacos, popcorn lobster roll, salmon skin hand roll, Sapporo salmon roll, crunchy roll, pork belly, and the various ramens.   I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who likes to try smaller serving of different sushi verses going to an all-you-can-sushi place where you have to eat it all or pay for it. This place gives you 3-4 pieces of sushi roll on the plate for $2.50 and of course they had nigiri. We try a lot of different sushi. We've already plan to go back again, it was that good, great experience!

yoDcL5UbBD_i5TWVOlHnBA.text: This is as good as it gets for a rotating sushi bar.  The sushi is pretty fresh, items come around often and prices are very good.  For anyone who hasn't gone to a rotating sushi bar, you don't realize how much fun it is until you come here.  You sit down and while you can order from a menu, sushi rotates around and you just pull plates off and eat what you want.  We have been here many times since our first visit and like something different each time.  Off the menu we love the yellowtail and shrimp tacos.  Off of the belt we enjoy the garlic tuna or cajun albacore.  We have had some fishy fish here which include the toro and scallop but you can't have it all at this place.  The cuts on the fish are a little smaller than you'd hope but then again for the price you can't beat it.  The place is very clean, service is very good and the sushi has high turnover which makes it the best to go to.  We've been to others but nothing compares to this place.  For sure 5 stars for the best rotating sushi but don't come here expecting the best sushi of your life.  This is the best for what it is and they do a  darn good job at it.

8QmBrNuJLZAJxsmzq0-G_Q.text: This time was our second time coming here. First time was our last trip to Las Vegas. We also ordered from the kitchen the shrimp and also vegetable tempura dishes. Both were done perfectly. It came out scalding hot and also wasn't greasy tasting like some places. The udon we ordered was alright, I've had really good and really bad udon and this sits comfortably in the middle, the noodles were perfectly cooked but the broth isn't what I'm accustomed to but still tasty. XDJxHka2xyDr4l6BrpKdeQ.text: I love conveyor belt sushi places. Who doesn't love a good raw fish merry-go-round? Unfortunately there's usually a bit of a trade off. Sure, it's fast, and even fun, but if we are being honest, sushi is meant to be eaten immediately upon preparation, not after it's travelled past your table 37 times.  That being said, Sopporo might have figured out how to do this right. All of the selections on the conveyor belt are well made and taste fresh. This isn't high end by any means, but it's pretty respectable, and every bit as good as you might get at many other comparably priced sushi places. Plus, by having the options of small plates you get to try more. Win-win people.  The most fun part is ordering freshly prepared items from the iPad style menu positioned at your table. Want something not on the belt?Order it  up. Once ready, a little robot tray glides past the other booths to you and personally delivers your order. It even speaks to you and tells you to pick it up. If I was 12 years old, I would think this was the greatest thing I had ever seen. Since I have the mentality of a 12 year old, I still think it's pretty great.  Look, this place is fun, fresh, clean, modern, unique and has excellent service. You can control how much you spend, as well as eat the perfect amount for your appetite at the time. If I lived in Las Vegas, I would stop by all the time.

STjD-Q042ytk_HkRVkwTfA.text: We learn about this place from a friend of ours as we always look for new places to eat each year we visit Las Vegas.   This place from outside looks typical sushi joint, the revolving sushi part is a smart design with booths that can fit 4-6, there are also single chairs on the other side. Dishes are $2.50 each it is very affordable but can also add up fast if you get too happy with ordering too much food. Some of the dishes were good like garlic tuna, red snapper, kampachi and kid's favorite cheesy tonkatsu.  Saba was a bit too strong of  vinegar taste, portions are petite size for some items like scallops. We did order items off the tablet menu, uni and ikura was A-ok hang rolls are pretty good size, the kitchen did forget our tuna tartare order, service was decent, good 3.5 stars with minor improvements can easily get up to a solid 4!

K1LSyGTYWF7LiIPr1tDYzg.text: One of my fav sushi spots in Vegas. Can't really complain about anything. There is a wait. The sushi was fresh and on point. Place gets pretty busy. Would recommend to others

DmrfW0MpFvTHDVrwLZLkTg.text: This place has really good and fresh sushi. The revolving sushi reminds me of a lot of sushi places that I've had in Japan when I lived there. We came here later at night for happy hour and were able to get a seat for 5 right away. The restaurant is clean and You pay based on the amount of dishes that you grab. You can even custom order dishes. They come out on a robot. They have all kinds of selections to choose from than just basic nigiri. The servers are super attentive and always checked on us and made sure to fill up our waters. I would recommend their flavored calpico type yogurt drinks. The downside of this place is if you sit on the wrong end of the belt, the dishes that everyone wants would get taken first.

GMi509_D0qu7e7KILsGr2w.text: Went with a friend for a quick lunch.. The sushi was bad The rice didn't stick to the fish every time that you take one it's break on you.. I got nigiri and I was find on it scales which was very gross... I guess they dosent have a real sushi chef in the restaurant other wise things like that not need to happen.. We end up paying 75$ without enjoy not even a bit..

FRddGzm4cdVLyXIo07ROtA.text: This is my second visit but the first for my 2 guests. We loved the place, all sleek and modern especially with the food delivery robots. They sit on tracks and stop right next to your table with food. Human service was great too, prompt with bringing us our soups.  Thier hot green tea was excellent, the best tea I've had in a japanese place in quite a while. The black garlic ramen was well balanced and not too overwhelming with the oil. Sushi was good- both the nigiri and the rolls. My personal favourite was the new zealand king salmon, it was so creamy I am still thinking about it now at home.  Ice cream was delicious too. Vanilla was ok but the green tea was out of this park, I had to share. Would definitely come back esp for that happy hour deal.

Dxvo8KlXBAcrb0f5Dz4_PQ.text: This time around I kept running list of our favorite dishes:  Nigiri: Toro Bluefin tuna Baby yellowtail Premium white or super white tuna Japanese mackerel  Rolls: Lobster roll Sapporo special salmon  Other: Black garlic ramen  Had a bunch of others. The only one we didn't actually like was the garlic tuna.   Came on a Saturday night, maybe a 2 min wait for party of two. Fast polite service, clean restaurant. Happy hour is at 10p weekday and 11p weekends and plates are $1.75 til closing. Otherwise they're $2.50 during regular hours. There's a big parking lot behind the store; the front lot is shared by a lot of other businesses and can get crowded.

GJwFkkZFH0dxAr3A6XtkBA.text: This place used my favorite revolving sushi restaurant, but after tonight I don't think I will be coming back anymore. My boyfriend and I usually come here after work to enjoy some good, inexpensive sushi without any disappointment. Tonight the food was good as it always is, but the reason I will not be back is because of the service. We ordered some food off the menu and waited almost 30 minutes for it. When we asked if we could cancel it off the bill so we could leave, the food suddenly came out and the waitress told us that we could not take it off the bill. The only thing they were able to take off the bill was the miso soup that never came. Also they barely checked up on us tonight and we never got our waters refilled. This is not the place it used to be.

9kME7EZoVkegW1VD_7nfRg.text: Me and my mom went back for a second time on new years eve. The services are quiet nice and the food are still awesome just like the first time. This is definitely one of my favorite sushi restaurant to go now. Oh, also they added strawberry shortcake which is worth trying. I have been recommending all my friends and family about this place. I love this place!!

BaPwtiU07O5SX3ZcMkPPCw.text: This might be our new favorite sushi spot! When we moved here from Hawaii 16 years ago we wondered why there were no rotary (or revolving) sushi places here - and now....there's one!! We were pretty excited to try it out. We went on a Monday afternoon & considering the reviews I read, I was surprised to see that it wasn't crowded (but maybe because it was a Monday). Anyhow, on to the review. The place was not too big and not too small.  We were greeted and seated as soon as we entered.  The host explained how everything worked - basically all the revolving plates were $2.50 and if you wanted something else from the menu then you ordered it via the iPad on your table. Then a little robotic thing comes out, stops at your table, beeps and tells you to remove your order and then you're done.  The variety for the $2.50 plates wasn't bad at all. The salmon and toro were good and I really liked that they didn't put so much rice with their sushi.  We also special ordered 4 pieces of uni ($2.50 per piece) and seared scallops with mango salsa ($7.95). Okay, so this is really the only thing we didn't care for. I know uni comes in different grades but this had to be the lowest grade. But I guess you get what you pay for.  And then the scallops....they looked beautiful on the plate but when we bit into it it was still very cold in the middle. The only thing worse would've been if the scallops were over cooked.  We just decided we wouldn't order those things again.  Overall, food was good, service was good and price was fair. Our bill came to $64 (including drinks).  I love that you don't have to wait for your food like you do with AYCE!

HUW1z7hk5ygvkJ1v3f-N-g.text: Nice place, very modern looking. The fish was good, better then most AYCE places. Definitely would recommend it to anyone especially if you've never experienced a conveyor style sushi restaurant. The prices are good at 2.50 for anything on the conveyor belt plus some various items at different price points you can order on a tablet. Your total dinner cost can add up quick though if you eat alot of the premium fish which only comes with 1 piece of nigiri per order.   We had a great time, but I knock off a star mainly because water, wasabi, ginger, and soy sauce plates should come either right before you are seated or right after. The great thing about conveyor style sushi restaurants like buffets is you can eat almost instantaneously. It took at least 5 minutes to get water and another 5+ after that for the wasabi, ginger and soy sauce plates. I also hope the tablet problem gets fixed, most of us were finished but my gf wanted green tea ice cream and the tablet just wasn't working. The same thing happened to the table across from us. The placement of the tablet and the secured stand make it very awkward to fix while someone is having dinner, luckily we just ordered the ice cream from the waitress. I trust they will fix these easily correctable issues in the future.

_U1duV-OMY8oD7vbFjMdNw.text: This might be my favorite spot to eat sushi, if your a sushi lover, super cheap and great sushi, awesome place to take a group of people. Friendly service and they have military discount if your in the military. Place gets super packed after 6pm.

UZhW2uDwRpULRh3-1IprqA.text: The sushi made to order tastes good, however, the sushi on the conveyor belt isn't as fresh as I would like (but that's obvious considering the food doesn't get replaced until someone takes a dish out). The sushi that is continually around the restaurant is not bad at all, but you could tell that the rice and fish has been out on the conveyor belt for some time.

vl4e1S1qc_Ib3LSkgCf_1w.text: Great experience, great food, great prices, it was pretty crowded but worth the wait.  The black garlic Ramen is amazing!  My kids get a big kick out of watching the sushi arrive on the little robots that deliver your custom orders.  We have been back several times and it is consistently great.

Ulb_Zz60ceUQZqgORBLtyw.text: One of the better sushi places in Vegas. For the price and quality it can't be beat.  One of our go to places for sushi and to bring visitors, who have all raved about the place. The sushi train just allows for and experience to try different types of sushi, at a great price.

knWmZsmAFTsvUQwKEPJIEA.text: We enjoyed Sapporo Revolving Sushi when we were in Vegas. The concept is very cool and the food was good. They have sushi revolving (its timed so you know its fresh) on a conveyor belt, but you can also order off of a screen on your table (or from your Server) and have other items that come out to you directly from a robot on a track above the conveyor. I'd never seen anything like it and we enjoyed the novelty. The sushi was not the best we'd ever had but certainly good. We appreciated the efficiency and the fact that you could not over order. We will be back next time we are in Vegas.

GEedaF1noPddGDF3Ec5YDw.text: Fun fun fun....great experience friends suggested this place an I am sooo glad I came. Food is very tasty staff is professional just a great environment...I WILL be back

OL-dbpwVdGEekEvOShvlyA.text: Very good...Could be 4.5 perhaps but, there s high traffic and taste is solid, so Im giving 5 stars for being very good at service, food and ambiance altogether on a weekend.

48tbGbTjJuddRB3pe-uRVw.text: I've been here a few times now and every time I come it is delicious! We finally made it in the other night for the happy hour special which is ridiculously amazing at $1.50 a plate! If you dont come during happy hour its only $2.50 a plate which still ends up being cheaper than AYCE at other places and you don't end up forcing yourself to eat something you don't like in order to not get charged extra. My favorite is the popcorn lobster roll and the Sapporo special roll. My fiance absolutely loves the Tonkotsu Ramen. I had never been to a belt sushi before but had always wanted to try one. It's always busy when I come but the wait is not too bad and they have a bar you can sit at and order drinks while you wait. The bartender is always friendly and even told us that the company that owns this place owns other restaurants too and now I must go try them!

A-gVzsQRoW15KALvGdYWtA.text: Very good food, great service, great place to eat, Will be returning, be taking my friends to eat there, if they like sushi.

LlLbYa5AOZJpsRisfgeY-g.text: This is the best place for those who can't eat a lot... I had a stomach surgery done and one roll would make me full... and at this place i can eat different things and don't get full in one order! I think this place is amazing and i would go every other day if it was near my house! The price is very fair, not expensive and i will be there every time!

YwOzBzhpHVL_lW--BwAtQw.text: Server Tony makes this experience worth it! The food is great and I love having the ability to order what I want thanks to the tablet at each table. Only 4 stars because sometime the sushi on the belt doesn't taste as fresh. Regardless, I love this place thanks to the amazing service from Tony and the food is good overall! The price is perfect.

isyISfOxGxU4opeVOtOEDA.text: Food was on PAR with the good sushi places in Las Vegas, but the atmosphere here was legit. A different twist for dining and was relatively inexpensive. Definitely a must try!

kA87MQ-1bWpNbwmvo_iC5Q.text: This place was modern and elegant. I have been waiting for a revolving sushi place to come to Vegas for at least 6 years, and it is finally here! I have mixed feelings about this place though but didn't want to give a low star rating because I understand they are new. I am just here to put in my two cents:  I think with AYCE places everywhere in Vegas, this place has a lot to compete with. The quality of sushi at AYCE places I frequent was actually better than the quality here. I am not saying the quality of the fish was terrible, just not as good. For $2.50 a plate, it sure adds up fast, and I was still hungry by the time I had spent what I could have spent at an AYCE place. On a side note, for $2.50 a piece, the toro was amazing!!   I was very impressed with how fast the iPad orders came out. I was not impressed that there was a bug crawling on my plate of toro when it came out though.   I would probably come back if I am just craving a few pieces of nigiri or toro...or if they  up the quality of the fish. If they added fresh scallop or conch to the menu, that would be even better. But perhaps this place is not for me.

OJv0jRh_4vTFpM5Ktl3nXg.text: I've been to revolving sushi bars and this one's too pricey for the experience that you get. The sushi quality however is higher than the rest of your typical sushi places in Las Vegas. But then again, I've only been here once when they opened, maybe I have to go check it out again and see how the place has improved.

WWCha8FBV4PUd0GYECtX9Q.text: Conveyor belt and little robotic trolleys?! I'm there!  This is Las Vegas' very first Conveyor Belt Sushi Restaurant. It's located in China Town in a little strip mall with ample parking. The restaurant itself is very modern looking, and appears to be clean and well kept.  What my family and I love about this place is the fact that you can come here with any sized appetite. If you wanna stuff your face, it's perfect! If you aren't that hungry and just wanna snack on a couple of things, also perfect! Since they charge by the plate, you can eat as much or as little as you want and you have a variety of dishes to choose from. Plus the prices are extremely reasonable, and the service is great.   A+ in my book!

2i8FINqcM88isrEe9VOClQ.text: Oh how i wish we have this restaurant in my area.  First time here and I was impressed.  Modern style revolving sushi restaurant with great food and good service.  Plates are $2.50 each. Special orders ranges from $5-$10.   Fish was fresh and the rolls and nigiri were made well just the right amount of rice.   Service was quick. When we placed special orders they were brought to our table by a robot. Human and robot were great service.   Definitely will try to go back whenever I'm at Vegas.  Also, they have plenty of alcohol drinks to choose from.

RUhaTCYsFheiEsE16TEhYQ.text: Price is fair for the quality of the food. Lots of choices available to choose from the belt and even more options on the menu for order. I had four plates off the belt, a separate item off the menu, and ice cream for dessert and the total came out to around $20.  Good atmosphere and great for all events from large groups to date nights.

_soq1S4VD0-aIwzUDainxg.text: Amazing, fun, and good service.   I will be frequenting.   The concept is not so unusual outside of Vegas, but, if I'm not mistaken, this is the first the valley has had. The revolving sushi setup with a clean, considerate look about it.   The fish quality is great. I pray this never changes. The menu items you can't find on the belt are excellent as well. Drinks are wonderful. Pomegranate margarita and sakatini were both awesome. Beer selection is decent also.   The carrot puree which garnishes some of the dishes is delicious. At least drop by to try it.   Prices are fair. It's  $2.50 per plate, which sounds harmless until you're 15 plates in.   It's definitely somewhere to drop by for the experience as well as the food.

Yp96RF_7XQp1Re_d0NTQ-A.text: AMAZING sushi! It was a fun place to go for dinner and I love that I can get my fave sushi delivered at home!

YXwU6gbMV25Fpe5zz8tU7w.text: I had a very bad day today. A very good friend of mine came to the rescue. We decided to go eat and we decided to come here. I love revolving sushi places. However, I was in for a treat. The wait to be seated was not long at all. The staff was very accommodating and made sure my glass of water and soda was never empty. The sushi just hit the spot. I wish they had uni, but that's ok. I saw three things that caught my eye. The trout was the first. Mmmmmmm!! Then I saw the tuna tacos and salmon tacos. I had to try....Oh my!!! Never had a Mj I tack that tasted like that before. I mean, it was so good I kept getting more and when they weren't on the rotation anymore, I ordered more. Those little tacos made my night!! I will definitely go back every time I'm in Las Vegas!! In fact, I'll go back before I leave on this trip. Mmmmm.....

OU7YRl04_jjFsr1Nnt8gUQ.text: Very pleased with the rotating sushi options. All options I chose where extremely fresh. I liked the salmon special roll most, added soft shell crab and hot tea to my order I was very surprised with the amount of food I ordered it came out to 40$ between three people.

-xNH0HxaSg2AqwlswMB3xw.text: Sapporo Revolving Sushi is definitely a cool place to check out in Vegas. The sushi constantly revolves around the restaurant, varying between 3 pieces of a roll or a set of nigiri. All of the plates cost 2.50 each as they roll on by. We also ordered a hand roll which I thought was extremely good. They had other food you could order off of an iPad as well such as ramen, appetizers and other rolls. I thought it was a pretty good value, but personally I prefer all you can eat options.

69BvKO2p55VAxTSJe1EKuw.text: LOVED this place! I visited a Friday at 6:30pm and was seated promptly. When I left around 7:30 I did see a lot of people waiting. I would advice coming a bit earlier if you do not want to wait.   I really liked the service and the food. I placed orders for a roll and an appetizer and the wait was very short. Both things came in under 10 minutes. The waiter was also very attentive and refreshed our drinks promptly.   Each plate is $2.50 and I think that for that price the portions are pretty good. Each sushi roll had about 4 pieces. They also had multiple options including inari, garlic edamame, desserts and sushi.   This is a place I def plan on visiting again.

KIZ4QQd8lWihmGk4RnQ7lQ.text: Pros: Food tastes good! Sushi on a conveyor is fun! Eat as little as you want! I'm so tired of all you can eat sushi where you stuff yourself and leave feeling unwell just to "get your money's worth" Usually no waiting to get seated. Friendly staff!  Cons: Parking seems a bit limited though I haven't had an issue yet. Can be easy to miss if you've never been there before.

hyZhiEoWhxQvJRBl5j8wLA.text: Came here on a late Wednesday night for dinner with my bf. When we got there, we found out that they had happy hour starting at 10 pm. So we waited 15 mins for happy hour to start. Once we got seated, we hurried and grabbed a lot of sushi on the conveyor belt. Each plate was $1.75. They had a variety of small bites of sushi. We ate 12 plates and were stuffed. Service was great.

QUPSXow1IswtHFXM4Tayrw.text: This place is great!!! my new favorite great fish and super reasonably priced sake bomb are great too!! Highly recommended place to grab sushi, revolving service makes it soo easy to order quickly

m-IMoUgnqIZwZ5c86219tw.text: Came here for dinner with my best friend & my boyfriend after a long drive from LA to Vegas, we were hungry! l5mbEOqmjPHVIjLNfwg1dA.text: Happy hour, $1.5/plate on the conveyor belt! I would definitely recommend this place.  This allows you to see the sushi and pick whatever you want. SzL-pcoietQNbHFD3aMmww.text: The only reason for my 4 stars is; they DONT have that many options for vegetarians, really. However, they have a great service and good sushi for a good price.

wAbXE-zQ_bDBqrR69b7DbQ.text: This is absolutely amazing!!! Revolving sushi on a conveyor belt! You can also order from the menu. The food is delicious! A big variety of sushi but they also have ramen/udon and deserts. I'm going to guarantee you'll love it

0aqI-S5GH4aJFxcYj7QGJw.text: First and foremost, thank you for always providing excellent service Ann Marie and Elina. You have made each visit a pleasurable one and we hope to see you upon our many returns.   The Sapporo Revolving Sushi experience is just so much fun. All the plates are on display like little food gems just waiting to be picked up by you. When you order from the iPad a little trolley robot chan comes to deliver your food. So cool, I need one now.   The quality of fish is great and the base price of $2.50 for everything on the rotary is more than reasonable. Most people I know find themselves full by the time they have eaten the equivalent of the price of an AYCE sushi dinner. You can find most of the popular Nigiri selections, half orders of special and classic rolls, side dishes, and desserts on rotation. Other selections and full rolls can be found on the iPad menu and will be delivered by the little trolley robot chan. Please remember to let her know that you are satisfied with her service by pressing the little button to return her to her home.   Dinners and lunch can get busy. I think it is worth the wait if you can afford the time. There is comfortable seating in the waiting area and a bar. The restaurant has always been clean each time I have visited and the food and service is always excellent. I'll be back to visit soon, like later today.

3n5uHAjPw7iLvLelJtxynQ.text: I'd been dying to try this place and it did not live up to my expectations. It was good, quality sushi, but boy you could sit there for hours and only see 1 or 2 new items show up on the conveyor belt. This is definitely a place to go if you're not starving and if you want to try new things!   The conveyor belt mostly just brought out plates with 2 pieces of nigiri, $2.50 a plate. My partner and I had 20 plates and costed us $27 a person, w/o tip. I could've ate all you could eat sushi with rolls and appetizers for that price. I probably won't return but I'm glad I experienced it!

B6GP7OFSkuH0xwqZvYNplg.text: Their fish tastes like it's been left out for way too long. The hot items on the conveyor belt are always cold and the servers were so rude. We were only sitting there for maybe 10 minutes and we were waiting for a roll we ordered and they asked if we wanted our bill. I just think this place has a lot to work on in terms of customer service and food quality. No one even explained anything when we were sat down.

9WMb6WaYdPLNcQrbPf_bxw.text: All things being relative for Shinkansen style sushi this is five stars. They have a wide variety, some inventive appetizers and everything is fresh. Located in the burgeoning "china town" of Las Vegas this reasonably priced sushi restaurant is a great place to go to get away from the strip and the high prices found there.  It can get busy at dinner time but after 10:00 pm prices drop to $1.50 a plate! Free Parking too! Highly recommend.

B924CVIfAQX72I49Lrrz8g.text: If you're the type of person who doesn't want to waste food from a traditional "All You Can Eat (AYCE)" restaurant, then Sapporo's conveyor belt sushi is the place for you.  Concept: The idea of a conveyor belt sushi originated only in the last century so it is a fairly new face to the diverse city of Vegas. They offer ramen, full-size sushi rolls, appetizers, and desserts when ordered from a tablet and unlike the the set price from the belt, these prices vary.   Pricing: For the quality you get, $2.50 per plate from the conveyor belt is fair! The food (especially fish) is fresh, the dishes are small yet not overwhelmingly undersized, and if you are active duty or a veteran they offer military discount.   They have happy hour everyday (say whaaat)! Plate prices on the conveyor belt are reduced to $1.50 per plate. Japanese draft beer is 50% off and large hot sake is also 50% off.  Happy Hour Operations: I have been to happy hour a couple of times and it does get pretty jam packed. Friendly reminder: military discount can not be activated during HH operations. Sunday-Thursday | 10pm - 12 am Friday & Saturday | 11pm - 2 am  Attentive customer service, cleanliness, and quality of food is the reason I keep coming back for more. Good news is that they are expanding to the Centennial (South Durango & 215) area and Town Square!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rainbow roll yaaaas:)
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inari :)
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Tea Matcha Cake =)

V9t2l8hX1zazh6TrW8Bcdg.text: One of the hardest decisions I've had to make in life is to decide whether I want to be Korean or Japanese.  I mean, Koreans have BTS, Kimchi, K-kop, mandatory 2 year military service, and a dear and glorious leader, but then Japanese people have weird-ass gameshows, Sushi, anime, and a deep-seated hatred for, not only Westerners, but all non-Japanese due to an old isolationist belief.  But I digress.  We're here to talk about sushi, and this place does sushi.    Revolving sushi on conveyor belts are nothing new.  Heck, they've been around long before Godzilla ever killed Mothra in Tokyo (but somehow they always rebuild).  They've just never made it to USA until recently.  The layout here is odd though.  People don't sit around 1 conveyor belt, but rather there are 3 small ones that split up the restaurant.    THE LAYOUT - Simple, easy.  Food comes around on 3 conveyor belts, and you pick what you want and just put it on your plate.  Each plate is $2.50, regardless of what's in it.  You can also order everything on the menu and more, including ramen, salads, ect. on the tablet at each table.  If it's a soup, the waiter brings it to you.  If not, the food comes out on a motorized cart attached to the belt to your table.  It beeps, you take off your food, press a button and it returns to the kitchen.  SO. COOL. After you're done, request a bill on the tablet and the waiter will total your plates with what you ordered from the tablet (if anything)  THE FOOD - They have a great variety of fish.  Some fish you've never seen.  They also have sea urchin @ $2.50 a pop, which is amazing.  The sushi is SO GOOD.  It's rather small though, but they are only charging $2.50 for 2 pieces so idc.  I thought the ramen would be wack, but it's amazing good for a place that doesn't specialize in it.  Even the pork slice that comes with it is slightly burnt and amazingly fatty.    Be careful though, these can add up,  Before you know it, you'd be shelling out big bucks because it's so good.  CHEERS!

pXUUoS_jd-mCPffmgjLFkg.text: Decided to try something new and so glad we did! Sapporo Revolving Sushi Sushi has a great vibe paired with fresh sushi. Grab your roll off the revolving belt or place an order and have the robot deliver it to you table!  Very clean with a fun atmosphere!
