KmAgoxVXNhvANaPcSiXstA.text: Ever since I went to a conveyor belt sushi spot in LA, I've been wondering when we'd get one here. Sapporo opened about 3 months ago, and I come here fairly regularly. They use a microchipped plate system to stay within health code regulations and ensure that product is not sitting out for very long, so everything is fresh.  I initially came in for their grand opening and was able to try several of their dishes and have since come back for birthdays, with visitors from out of town, and just as a general spot to catch up with friends at a new and interesting place. Management knows they are competing with AYCE pricing and having the variety of belt and higher-quality kitchen dishes makes them stand out. You'll probably spend about the same amount as AYCE, or a bit more.  The conveyor belt has apps, 3-piece rolls, nigiri, and the occasional dessert, with all plates priced at $2.50. The fish has been consistently fresh on my visits, and the belt allows you to grab a bite as soon as you sit down without waiting on service. I especially like their kitchen items, which are electronically delivered as well- they've consistently added to the menu over time, offering dishes that are similar to other spots in town (Yonaka's Sake Orengi, Pier 215's soft shell crab, etc.) but at a lower price point. I'll be trying their new Truffle Octopus dish next time.  Favorite items include the garlic tuna, orange salmon, scallops and branzino (cooked), the hand rolls, and the Valley of Fire roll (full size only). The guests I've taken have been especially excited about the sushi tacos, pork belly, and mini-ramen bowls (black garlic especially), but the novelty of the technology doesn't get old.   Service has always been attentive and helpful. Though staff is not actively coming by to take orders (you use the iPad), drink refills are consistently timely and everyone has been polite. Occasionally, orders will be delayed due to tech issues, but it's only happened once across several visits.  TIP: Check their social media for the occasional contest. This brand is opening a KBBQ conveyor belt business soon, too!

5HSw_3b5kBG7Axxzt351ug.text: Love this place!  Prices are good and the sushi is good.  You can also order from the table iPads.  Drinks are very reasonable.   Not only is this place interesting and fun, the prices will keep you coming back.  Also, dont worry about the labled parking spots....  Park anywhere.

M6gR-tpSNKRg0fJI3yy6dQ.text: Sadly this will likely be my last time here.  At least for quite a while.   Be aware when being seated the section on the right has a very limited selection of sushi revolving on the belt.   The food is still fresh and ok but if you're not seated in the main section there are much better places out there for the same price for what you get.   They recently raised their happy hour prices as well.   That wouldn't make much of a difference but when you see the same 5-7 options instead of 15-20 like on the main section,  it's just not great.     If you're going to Sapporo make sure you're seated in the main section not the one to the right.   If you want a unique experience with great staff this is still a great place to go but once you've tried it, feel free to explore the other options around town.   I will definitely be exploring other places.   Maybe some day down the line I'll be back but right now I doubt it.

-ejUkCS1Trzf7D5kB1dM3g.text: Sushi at it's best. You get to see everything before you enjoy. A short wait when we arrived but that just gave the wife and I time to start eyeing what we wanted to eat as items were being delivered to tables before our eyes.   We were seated and immediately got to see a wide variety of small plates displayed on the revolving belt. We chose a couple drinks and looked over the menu / iPad which is on each table. We ordered the Ginza Mule and Hana Sake which were both delicious 5/5. Plenty of great items to choose from, made fresh and placed on the belt for quick turn around or place an order on the iPad on each table and the item will either be sent via a robot who blinks and plays music at you or by the less conventional human being ;-). The server told us the items stay on the belt a maximum of 30 minutes.   We began grabbing plates off the belt including: sea bass, salmon, tuna, shrimp tacos, squid, white tuna, New Zealand salmon which is delicious, a couple rolls, seaweed salad, halibut. And before we knew it had devoured 18 plates worth of sushi! From the iPad we chose the hamachi carpaccio which was superb 5/5!  For dessert we shared a bowl of pistachio ice cream 5/5.   Overall this place was amazing! Can't wait to come back and update this review.  ***update a week later: We came back with the family this time and enjoyed more great sushi, some ramen noodles and popcorn lobster. For dessert I highly recommend the strawberry shortcake 5/5. The table for 6 was about a 15-20 minute wait but well worth it. The entire family enjoyed a great meal for lunch. We devoured 22 plates and about 8 items from the menu. Arigato Sapporo Revolving Sushi  Till we meet again my new found friend...

sfnqOE4vXwpf-Iwn5zMPyw.text: Finally down the river over the mountain, Spring Mountain Rd. I finally have arrived to my destination, Tokyo, Lol. Actually got a chance to try this super popular and trendy Japanese restaurant that is hard to missed with the crowds of foodies, baby boomers, conventioneers, tourists and everyone else drawn to see multiple conveyor belts filled with sushi. Including Nigiri, Gyoza, Seaweed Salad, 4 piece sushi rolls including some desserts like Match and Chocolates cake pieces. You can see and hear the aha, wow and umm from everyone!   This place gets really busy and plan ahead, especially the durning evening hours and weekend. However, we were seated within the 15min that was allotted to our party of 3. Upon being seated, our friendly server was helpful and attentive to the point our table was clean and water cups was consistently filled. Kathryn, our server explained the concept and made sure we were ok. We ordered a good amount of items through the touch screen tablet attached to the table. We personally like the concept especially if your feeling hungry.   A few delicious items that was impressive was the Salmon, Blue Fin Tuna, Super White Tuna and Toro. Every plate is micro-chipped that allows the kitchen to keep track how long each dish has been on the conveyor belt that assures you that everything is fresh. We also got a Sapporo Special roll, this was made just right with a consistent texture and balanced ingredients. We did notice that the Sushi Rolls we got wasn't over stuff with too much rice like other Sushi places. Ramen and Udon soup bowls were good in size and make a great meal combined with Sushi. For desserts, I really enjoyed their Strawberry Cake. Moist and balanced flavor with a good amount of strawberry flavoring. Even, Ms. Strawberry Shortcake herself would be proud of this dessert, lol.   I would come back and play pick and choose my favorite or if I need a quick bite to eat this would be on top of my list.   2018 Yelp Review #22

8cCyEK6s9WGrxmRO_cnM4w.text: Sapporo is surprisingly good. For about the same price as AYCE, you get better quality fish and ridiculously fast and friendly service. They are a well-oiled machine, and the low turnaround time was a welcome relief on a busy Sunday night.  When I go for sushi, I start off with miso soup and lots of nigiri. And I felt like Sapporo did a good job on them both. The miso soup was flavorful and the fish quality was fresh in terms of off-strip prices. We roughly ended up spending $25 a person for rolls, tempura, and lots of nigiri including more premium pieces (toro, ebi, and uni) to share.  Definitely recommend this place if you're super hungry, in the area, and craving sushi.

mSyEZA8EDhnLOqMk0PaWHQ.text: I yelped "revolving sushi" during our stay in Las Vegas and this place had the most stars and reviews so I thought I'd give it a try.  My family and I enjoyed it a lot.  The sushi was fresh and the ambiance was nice. I am a sucker for yellowtail, uni and red wine, and this place had it all. The wine was relatively inexpensive. I paid $5 for a glass of cabernet sauvignon. I also loved that you can order on an ipad aside from the conveyor belt and a little drone brings your special order to your table.   Our server, Elias and the rest of the staff were really nice and attentive. Everything on the conveyor belt is $2.50 a plate, not bad. They have a good variety. My husband ordered the tonkotsu ramen and he liked it. My kids had the miso soup with a side of rice and devoured it.  I ordered several plates of yellowtail, white yellowtail, bluefin tuna, and uni yummy!   Surprisingly, we spent $50 and left with happy tummies. This place was overall delicious!

Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qLcbQZ5kGM7xpmdHXZ3jyg.text: I went here last night with my family. It was amazing, one of the very few revolving sushi restaurants near me. I instantly fell in love with this place as soon as I walked in. The customer service is amazing and it's only $2.50 per plate. Prices are not too expensive and you have the opportunity to try different pieces of sushi w/ out hurting your wallet. 10/10 would recommend to a friend.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O_WC9Qr41qOzWpD45h0wDA.text: Good quality sushi if you don't mind waiting.  When I went there, only one side of the restaurant was open...not sure if it's like that all the time.  But the staff was great and made it a nice dining experience.

0IKLBZh3pZ4sTEe8eQ8Xjg.text: Holy shizzzz! Let's start with presentation. The place is immaculate and food looks so fresh. You sit next to the conveyor belt which makes you felt like a kid and your are waiting for your mom's permission to grab a plate. Everything is well labeled and well stocked. I never had to ask for an item to be restock. What? Want something other than the 30 or so amazing choices right next to you? That's just a touch away! There's a touch screen menu at your table where you can order ramen (I hear the black garlic ramen is great), udon, sashimi plates, and more. Once your special order is ready, it comes on this funny little train above you that tells your your is ready and starts singing and lights up.   You must, must try all the tacos, popcorn shrimp roll, and lobster roll. OMG!   I've lived around and this takes my top 5.

Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n00_SWTd58hX2sTiS3F5Ig.text: This is my first revolving sushi experience and it was amazing! It's nice to be able to grab items off the conveyor belt and also having items delivered by some kind of train thing.  My favorite was the super white tuna and you have to ask for yuzu sauce and sliced jalapenos!  Also the salmon skin handroll is the best in town and it's only $2.50!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hyc8-FGcBHs-OVtQcYyA1g.text: We've gone twice with family and friends and have loved the experience, food and service! Prices are very reasonable, food is fresh and the staff are really friendly. I asked the server which sushi roll was a favorite and he suggested the Popcorn Lobster Sushi so I ordered it. Omg, so delicious!!!! We've had Chef John cook on both occasions and he's such a great guy!! Located just a couple of blocks from my house so we'll be eating there often!

z0JeKhL-CYmJjKeRTa0Rqw.text: "Vegas' first revolving sushi restaurant has arrived!" is what I heard about Sapporo's opening.  This is a big deal!  Sushi on a conveyor belt?  How exciting, I must try!  However, it's not my first time seeing this concept and I had expectations going in.  I want to preface by first saying I've been to two amazing revolving sushi spots prior to my Sapporo visit: (1) in rural Fukuoka, Japan where most will eat sushi with their fingers, not chopsticks; and (2) Kula, a revolving sushi chain in SoCal and Texas.  Both of these were great and I thought nothing could be better, so I was carrying bias and was a little reluctant about Sapporo.  The food is fresh and nicely proportioned at $2.50 per plate.  If I wasn't very hungry this would be great place for a quick bite.  However, I suggest coming in for lunch like I did.  Prior to this lunch, I foolishly came starving for dinner on a Friday night and waited 30 minutes before leaving to eat somewhere else - Sapporo gets packed!  Knocked off at least one star for this: Sapporo's appeal is through its tech.  If it doesn't work properly, we don't get our food.  Aside from the belt, there's an iPad from which you can order additional items and on more than one instance, it would not take our order (see my attached photo).  When it does work, your order comes out on the top shelf, delivered to your table... but sometimes it goes to the wrong table like it did for one group next to us - they just watched their food go back and forth, passing them to another table.  At the end of the day, it's just another sushi spot.  This one just has the conveyor belt.  Game changer would be if this was AYCE.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Hnmqrv7kNLH3Se3amsbnZg.text: Vegas surprisingly has really good sushi. Now this definitely is not top-tier sushi quality. But I would say it's the best revolving sushi I've been to outside of Japan.   Certain nigiri were better than others. We came in for Happy hour, which is pretty unbeatable price-wise at $1.50 a plate. But we noticed most the sushi that is discounted (conveyer belt only, can't be ordered) is probably the leftover stuff from earlier in the day. Because of this, you can definitely tell it's not as fresh as it should be. You can sometimes eyeball to see if it looks dry, but other times you can't. Also, a lot of the more premium sushi (like toro or sweet shrimp) won't be going around. So the conveyer belt sushi was a hit or miss.   The additional items were all really good , including the pork belly, some hand rolls, and the sashimi tacos.   If I'm looking for quantity over quality, I'd come here. You're paying just as much as you would at some AYCE places , with slightly better quality in my opinion, but less side options.

kFcqaxt-SQ5iaLpZhgSRbQ.text: I can't believe I never knew about this place! It has a real conveyer belt where the sushi rides on! I love that there's also a tablet at the table in case I want to order anything that isn't on the belt! There's even a cute little robot that comes out to give you certain items you order from the tablet! This place is a nice feeling of Japan and I'm in love with it!!

RgKNkyGbu6hw8oXIUxehNQ.text: Great FAST sushi at a very reasonable price. Draft beer was also really good and reasonable. This should be the go-to sushi place for all Las Vegas visitors and residents!!

5GYlMMD3GZfSgxQBR8yV2w.text: Well, I can't argue with the price point. As others have stated $2.50 for a pair of nigiri is extremely fair, however quality of sushi is comparable to AYCE. I ordered the Orange Salmon which is an original at my personal favorite sushi spot. I would have gladly paid the few dollars more as Sapporo's orange supreme still included the orange membranes which made the experience less enjoyable. The black garlic ramen surprisingly was decent but don't hope for a generous portion of chashu. The bowl is about a half size and also half the price($4.25).  The place is clean, well decorated and aptly lit. The service was thorough and friendly. The novelty is the main attraction here and especially for Vegas, who doesn't enjoy little robots delivering your food? I know my toddler sure did.

oapJO5xyScyu9fUvwtPo8w.text: Awesome sushi place! The revolving sushi belt reminds me of my time in Japan. The cost per plate is very reasonable. Most menu items are already on the revolving belt so observe the belt before ordering. This is one of the best sushi restaurants in Las Vegas. I highly recommend Sapporo Revolving Sushi to all locals and visitors.

zDGDmnL2vlEy-g-P6gwYlA.text: Food was good. But service was bad.  This is my third time going to this same place within a week and today's service Was the worst of the three maybe because they were busy and do not care about quality service. The past 2 visits was great maybe because it was not their busy times. Prepare to wait for about 30 mins to an hour during busy times.

Ocec4PFtnSqzPlPBXuxeRg.text: So I've only given this restaurant 4 stars because I didn't get to try as many diverse items as possible. I ordered a couple apps, and tried a few specialty rolls.  The sushi was really good, you have the choice of picking it up from the conveyer belt or having it delivered to your table from ordering on the tablet. I noticed that when I ordered from the tablet my food was a lot warmer. Nonetheless, the plates on the conveyer belt are kept for 30 minutes and then new plates are placed afterward. Also, not every single item from the menu will be on the revolver, it was mostly nigiri and a few specialty rolls and appetizers. The most memorable appetizer I got was the shrimp taco, pictured, it was so delicious!  I'm making this my #1 for sushi, and reason being, 1. The food was great compared to other AYCE spots, 2. The prices are cheap, and 3. It's easier to keep track of how much you're eating so that you don't get too full or can't finish what you've ordered. The ambience is great for different occasions. The booths are quiet spacious, making it welcoming for large groups. The service was punctual, my waitress would always come by if I looked confused with the menu or tablet ordering. I will definitely return

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YPLnas3rwnCbAEjqFwA7DA.text: Just have to say the food is good. Service is awesome. Our server Jay is awesome. Love it when we meet people from home. I would recommend friends and family to try it out.

435yUMuRT2ucXvw7nZquug.text: If I could give this place zero stars I would. First off the service was terrivld. I admit I accidentally took someone else's entree but the tray had no indication who's table ot was serving too because both lights were on leaving me confused and when the waiter came she was really rude even though i explained I would pay for it. Not only that the staff is really incompetent because when I asked for water they walked away not giving me service, I even asked if they sell tea and I got no responses and I felt ignored. This is a joke of a Japanese restaurant and a disgraced to all sushi resturaunts . the food was not bad but its definitely not worth the price or even with the shitty service your staff displayed. Ps. Tell your waiters to cut their nails because I got scratched by one of them which is really disgusting

senGYK_VFPdgMJB76m1luA.text: Sapporo has some of THE MOST friendly and attentive staff my husband and I have encountered in many years.       They were more than happy to explain not only the conveyor system but how to operate the tablet ordering system.      Now that I've raved about the staff let me praise the delicious food. After sampling just about everything the conveyor belt brought our way we never once had a single item that was anything but fresh and flavorful.      Vegas has many MANY sushi restaurants, and I have been to my fair share, but Sapporo deserves a place at the top. It combines the fun of the conveyor belt and the friendliness of eating at a dear friend's house.  ** HIGHLY RECOMMEND **

s_mGwfxkguZl_viXAAd2rQ.text: This is now my favorite sushi place . Great service , great food , no waiting for your food , and most important , very affordable . I can't wait to go back for the happy hour .

sm0NKq0WTs6TZKUJRBHgrg.text: Sushi is not the best quality and as it was pretty hot in the restaurant when we went I wonder if they're not getting less and less fresh as they rotate around the conveyor belt.  Because we saw a few dishes during our 40 min there that weren't picked up so who knows how long they've been revolving.   But overall a fun experience and the set up is really well done.  I'd definitely go again if I'm craving casual sushi; I'd just order it off the express train.  Good times!

RTYauHmAAKBSzSdzPQqVyg.text: This place is so amazing and cool!! There is a little bit of a wait time but trust me it's worth it. The sushi is delicious, the price is fair, and it's so fast.  The workers are very nice and hard working especially the chefs. I highly recommend this place! I will definitely be back!

zHBZVsA33y1B5uol26FfPg.text: Affordable and Nice Place! We found our new to-go-to sushi restaurant. Sapporo is a revolving sushi bar by Spring Mountain/Decatur. Any order placed off the menu is served by a robot so less on manpower. Great food, I did not have to deal with 8 pcs of rolls per order -  an issue I always have with AYCE since I don't eat much. They have a wide array of sushi selection, plus different kind of ramen and desserts. Most of all,  the place is nice, clientele is mostly 20s-40s, lively music

eB_W-VAROINufUuJ0N2Gqw.text: best place for sushi by the plate in town!!! check out happy hour for great beer and food deals.. ill be back for sure!!  :)

9fSdU9OVdA4N8SpWcXwkIg.text: 1st Revolving Sushi in Las Vegas. Price is fair for the quality of the food. Table turn over rate is high. Will go back again.

GZg2SzHjZ0-BzDlOICQvNQ.text: My new go to sushi place on Spring Mt.  Fun concept, good prices.

1LHbzschd6LJ-4RO5kM_9g.text: A few friends had tried this spot, and said nothing but good things about it! So I thought I'd give it a try, because Revolving sushi sounds pretty rad!   I arrive on a weekday around 6:30pm - we were seated right away which was great, and the server was great! Very nice, and attentive. After he finishes explaining how it works, we dig in.   Come to find out my friends love this spot because they only eat the fried dishes. I, on the other hand enjoy certain fresh fishes! As the food revolved I noticed the quality wasn't very great. So to play it safe i order tempura, and a ramen. I wanted to avoid getting sick.   I personally wouldn't recommend this place due to the the quality of food. However, the service was great.

x4IyHN51-NptxOVL4F0fRA.text: Everything was perfect since the moment we stepped in. Got seated fast and our server (Ann) was amazing. It was the closest thing to a restaurant from home (Genki's in hawaii) and to my surprise even better.   It was our first time and Ann was really on top of her game - always coming around to make sure we were fine as well as giving her feedback on the food. She really did take care and she offered her best service.  Thanks Ann, you were amazing. Definitely coming back!

K1IBzNpYd3zajLwxCyaqvw.text: This place was freaking awesome! Everything was so fresh and delicious. Our server Jason definitely made our experience the best. He was very attentive, professional, kept our waters full, and checked on us frequently. A+ service!   The concept is so cute, fresh sushi that's taken off every 30 minutes to ensure freshness. All of the rolls and nigiri was delicious; even the uni! The shrimp tempura was so good too. The stuff ordered on the tablet came out so quickly. Everything was extremely inexpensive as well which is a plus. I will definitely be coming back to check out the other hot dishes, ramen, and dessert! Such a amazing place.

lXbvx7aojJr5qzURq8CNQw.text: Oh my gosh this place has amazing sushi!!!! Ahhh I'm in love with the fillet Minion nigiri with a balsamic vinegar glaze ! I could eat 6 orders of it! The plates that revolve are all $2.50!!! They have like 4 types of salmon, smoked, king, regular and belly! They have 3 pieces of of special sushi rolls! Everything I ate was amazing!!! They have Beautiful crafted alcoholic beverages and a bar you can sit at while waiting for your table! I seriously don't know why I didn't come here sooner! The sushi is fresh and innovative! They also have many other items on the menu that do not revolve around on the belt. Like made to order ramen and udon! Not just basic ramen but a bowl of black garlic ramen like you could find at minta or something. And it's only $4.25! And one things that I am sooo super excited about is that they have misoyaki butterfish!!!!! Also know as black cod marinated in miso. Wow! I am addicted and will come here always! I ordered a complete take out order that mirrored exactly what I ate while dining is! Sushi so good I wanted it for tomorrow too! I sipped on a ginza mule which consists of sake, vodka, fresh mint and ginger beer! Sooo refreshing and yummy!!!! It was only $8.00! The prices are amazing! Almost as if you are eating an all you can eat but way more quality and selection and funnnn!!!! Love it here! 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Digital menu
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Revolving sushi, also may order on iPad and order comes out on a train on top of belt
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ginza mule

ugtEp9EAE9RZFgZc9h1KLg.text: I was pretty excited to hear of a revolving sushi here in Vegas.  My first experience was in Hawaii and I did enjoy it.  I had high expectations for this place, expecting a variety in appetizers and rolls.  I was expecting a few rolls similar to places where I get AYCE sushi.    It'll probably wow first timers.  I think this place is for only people who do not eat a lot of sushi or that does not do AYCE.   The waitress kindly explained how this all worked.  She even explained to us how after a plate has been on the conveyor belt for 30 minutes, it gets discarded and replaced which I think is good.   We had technical difficulties on the tablet a few minutes after using it.  I wished the tablet was swivel capable.  That way it can be turned to either side of the table.  They should include paper menu as well so that they are able to see what ingredients are in their sushi rolls instead of trying to read from afar and having the person closer to the tablet read it for you (I find it bothersome, especially when you're trying to eat).  With menus conveniently in front of you, you can figure out your order and have the person closest input the order instead of having that person scroll through each submenu to see what exist.  Coming from the islands, we know what fresh, good quality fish looks like and this place did not meet those standards.  Things that we tried: Hamachi & Salmon Tacos - I thought they were so cute. Popcorn Lobster Roll - I enjoyed it.  I like it because of the sauce they use on it.  I like spicy mayo. Gyoza - They were okay.  No different than any other place. Cheese Tonkatsu - To me, it was okay.  Its got chicken (at least I think it was chicken, could have been pork) mixed with cheese and then deep fried.   Lobster Roll - This was okay.  Probably taste the same as any other place.  I just wonder if they use real lobster.  Kind of looked like imitation crab on top. Surf and Turf - For me, it was okay.  Spicy for my liking.   Sexy Girl - I liked it, but I wish there wasn't any jalapenos in it.    ****That is one thing that you can't do on the tablet which is substitute/remove an ingredient from your roll**** (unless there is and the waiter just didn't tell us)  And that was about it.  This was sharing amongst 3 people.  We didn't have much.  Our bill was a little over $50.    So with that being said, Happy Eating's!

5XMukQyJjrRxMF00kaMu-Q.text: This is literally my favorite restaurant in Vegas ! I'm making it a tradition to stop here every time I make a trip to Vegas and so far it has been 2/2.   Food- super delicious and fresh, a good variety of cooked food as well a rolls/sushi. They keep the sushi stocked on the belt  Price- super affordable , especially for sushi. $2.50/plate . The hand rolls are also 2.50 and the bowls of ramen is only $4 and SUPER flavorful. My favorite is the black garlic ramen.   Service- every time I have went the waiters/waitress have been super nice and helpful. Service was amazing.   100% recommend

iFjo9P3zOrnkkQVIlpJuZw.text: This place is so gimmicky but I couldn't help but enjoy the FRESH sushi and prices. The music was great as well, Top 40, old and new tunes. Parking is very tight though! And the lighting outside IS NOT the best, use the buddy system!

gkp2DRc0kgejMXZp7OzHiw.text: Food: sushi on a conveyor belt and also option to order on iPad delivered directly to you on another conveyer belt. This is a similar set up to Kula Revolving Sushi Bar in Cupertino, CA but minus the super cute anime and reward system - no toys here :(   The fish is fresh, however it lacks in options. Many have fried shrimp tempura or california roll (fake crab/mayonnaise) incorporated in them.  This concept is great to introduce someone to sushi or get them excited about it, like your kid, but otherwise the novelty is gone after one visit.  Service: friendly and efficient. You don't really need a waiter other than for drinks since you grab your own food.  Ambiance: casual and clean  Location: convenient parking. Located across the street from Ronald's Donuts (yum).  Don't plan to return, but might have to because my kid already wants to go back. Darn.

HpsspwEUHKNu4-e1OsEwkg.text: Great quality for a conveyer belt sushi spot. Taste was good, and fish was fresh. For a low key spot I was actually pretty impressed. Parking situation was a bit harrowing, but not terrible. Prices are average-moderate (depending on how hungry you are.) Fun environment and service was good.

BV13DApzR-AKUycAPW4ORw.text: This place is AMAZING. Came right as they opened, the sushi is so fresh and such a great selection, and it's such a great idea to have all the plates cost the same amount. Didn't order any custom food from their menu but loved seeing it delivered on its musical train. Will be back, 10/10!

6hH-0hAPjWRHGd6Ev_9-9A.text: If you are looking for sushi. Just stop! Get in the car and come here. First time tonight and we won't be searching for another sushi place in the near future.  Tremendous value

aSMZplmmzWB7VnE0CJTZ5A.text: Best revolving sushi restaurant I've been to so far in the US. Lots of options and variety! Everything was also fresh. I would definitely come back again.

uMSCV-G41jZgHhcI7ahMeQ.text: One of my happy hour go to places. You can't beat these happy hour prices it'll make you take a nap or stay up for it. I always bring family and friends that come to town. It's an all around great experience.

XYDaKXv0IgDCZfGNiF5zEQ.text: Good concept I'm happy to see that Las Vegas finally caught on to conveyer Belt sushi. I have to say the quality isn't great. The nigiri was warm imagine warm raw fish in your mouth *yuck!  I had to switch spots with my husband to keep an eye on the fresh sushi plates the chef in the kitchen are putting on the belt to avoid grabbing a piece that's been sitting on the conveyer for a while. They need to put Sushi on a chilled plate to keep the temperature control. This is important esp knowing how hot our summers are here & people can get sick eating warm raw seafood. This should be fixed IMMEDIATELY!!  Service was excellent everyone was friendly with a happy smile on their face.  Fish quality- i would give a C+ but for $2.50 a plate I didn't expect Nobu Or Raku quality. I'm also not a fan of AYCE due to the lack of quality.  Please use chilled plates or else i see trouble with food poisoning claims in the near future. All in all I would come again with friends for the experience but I wouldn't recommend this for someone that's craving great quality sushi!

P6mRNX9hawMwQ6VKARIYqQ.text: The first revolving sushi place in Las Vegas. Reminds me of the Pokemon Stadium game for Nintendo 64.  The prices are good. Each plate that goes through the revolving belt is $2.50 and it ranges from 2-3 pieces of sushi per plate. The fish is very fresh.  There is also a train that brings other items that you order from and iPad. The items on the iPad range from different prices depending on what you get. The train belt is above the regular revolving belt. Try the shrimp tacos and the popcorn lobster roll! They are both so good! Sapporo has green tea and pistachio ice cream for $1.50 for a scoop each.  The ambience is nice and clean. The staff is very helpful and informative.

rbqxXw89AynwXySW8R45jA.text: Nice, affordable, good sushi place! Love the concept! We didn't wait that long to be seated but we went on a Sunday night at 6 pm so not many people. Love that each plate has like 3 pieces of a roll so you can sample more items. Their lychee margarita was amazing as well!

dBhPkN_8ulmoLPorOm85cw.text: This place rocks!! It's such a fun experience. I love that you can try so many different things since each plate is just a few pieces of something, and if you find something you really like you can just order a full roll. $2.50 per plate is pretty reasonable, and I definitely plan to try their happy hour where everything is $1.50 per plate. I was actually impressed with the quality of the fish, especially the salmon- they had 3 different kinds! I really like this place and can't wait to come back!

-147jfjx783arCySEFCO6A.text: I was so so excited to try this place and it lived up to my expectations! The fish here is super fresh and nothing stays on the conveyer belt longer than 30 min. Everything on the belt is $2.50 and you can order more items through a tablet which arrives on a motorized tray to your table.

WRgw6H6B7j2UcvKdlxci9w.text: All I can say is this place is OUTSTANDING! The food, the service, and how quick you receive your food is amazing! I rated this a five-star because it truly stands up to being Superior. All the sushi places I've been to,  this one far exceeds all of them! I definitely will continue to keep going back often! They also have daily specials that is extremely reasonable!!!! Love the $5 ramen bowl along with the $2.50 sushi plates.

Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4JIgxi8oR-_nRp7E0Lz2wg.text: I went during Happy Hour and everything was half price. It was packed but we only had to wait like 10 minutes. I love that we don't have to wait for the food and most items were very fresh. What I would recommend for newbies of revolving sushi is to sit closer to the kitchen where the belt starts so that you get first pick. We sat at the very end and we ate some where the rice was a little dry and we had to wait until the Sapporo roll would come back around to us. I think everyone loves white tuna and Sapporo roll because they were scarce. Overall, I'll definitely go back with friends because it was new and enjoyable dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

stYTid1yEGdRpdAN5zL6dQ.text: This place was awesome!  The prices are very reasonable and the food was great!  The plates on the belt are the same price per unit as the main plates so it allows you to try a lot of different rolls. The Mexican roll, sapporo salmon roll, lobster roll, and the popcorn lobster roll are must gets.  We would also get the sexy girl and the kanto were delicious. Definitely will come back.

cg04buRNwoaJi8-CmBL3nQ.text: Yummy! Excellent service! Pay per plate...   Absolutely one of the best conveyor belt sushi places I've been to and will definitely go back! They have a full menu and the belt. You can do one or the other or both. All items are super fresh and well presented.  Whether you're on a date or goin' casual with a friend/family, this place welcomes all! Super clean and trendy, I recommend first-timers and avid sushi goers: this is the place to go.

hcxJbasnZWkn4kTAHA_HYA.text: Amazing quality of sushi at a reasonable price. I'm big on sushi places and when I go to an AYCE place I usually get disturbed with the quality of food that comes out. This place is definitely bang for your buck, about $25-30 per person will fill you up!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nTfhWP03VwhVKoL4YtVeVQ.text: Love the conveyor belt! I got my sushi quicker then regular sushi places, but very dangerous cause they don't do ayce. Each plate in the belt is 2.50 so I ended up spending more then I would when I eat ayce for less. The quality of the fish was good! I do suggest you go when it's busy so they put out fresh sushi and not have the same ones going around and around.

MNPq8LTzZNgwI1RXXOwnjg.text: We are locals and have been here several times. Yesterday was the worst. We were crowded into the small lobby waiting and waiting while staring at a whole section of empty tables. Many people left before being seated. They finally started using the empty tables after many customers expressing dismay at being kept waiting for so long.  The food was okay but not great. The novelty has worn off we won't be going back.

fBzQIP8HMs3-ED7E1WcHqQ.text: Yuuuuuum. First timers, Love this spot. Customer service is on point! Very clean, food was actually really good. Everything tasted fresh. Yaaaay we'll be back for sure.

p5gsL66nPyLIeqvrHOofkQ.text: My fiance and I came here on a Saturday night expecting it was going to be busy. Turns out there was no wait so we were seated right away. Living in Hawaii we were already used to the conveyor belt system, since we were so obsessed with Genki Sushi in Oahu, so it wasn't as amusing for us. It's nice to have one here in Vegas though.   As we walked in, the restaurant looked very clean and interior decorations were nice. I wasn't craving sushi at all that night and not being able to eat raw food, I didn't enjoy the food as much as my fiance did. He ordered most of the plates that were very popular on yelp like the orange salmon, uni, sashimi, toro, blue fin tuna, etc, which were pretty high quality, fresh and so tasty he said. I ordered the ramen which was great for the price, and very flavorful. The rolls were decent like any other sushi place. One thing I really liked is how they have smaller portions of the rolls in the conveyor belt rather than paying $7-$12 for the full roll. Which I think was very clever of them.   I'm giving 4 stars because as for service, the first waitress we had didn't bring us water, she seemed too busy walking around chatting with other workers. We had to ask another waiter to bring us glass of water and to ask to take our plates because it was getting a little cramped. Our first waitress finally came around our table but didn't even check up on us, she only came by to take some of our plates and wipe down the table next to us.  Since I didn't eat much and my fiance ate like we were at an AYCE, we did pay a little bit more than expected. My only advice is, do not take your other half here if she/he is very very VERY hungry! Or You'll be paying more than an All You Can Eat bill. Other than that, it was a nice experience.

VMDVFgE1Ukh63uxJw1K8vg.text: One of my new favorite sushi places!  If there isn't anything on the conveyor belt, that fancies your eye.  You can place an order on the iPad and this cool little motorized tray on top of the conveyer belt delivers your special orders.  The service & food was on point!  I really enjoyed the salmon tacos (basically salmon poke stuffed in crispy wonton shells), soft shell crab app, seared garlic tuna, ikura, and scallop!  Give this onolicious (delicious) spot a try!!!  Support your locals!  Eat local!

WvpTqd0E5G79GE8_gQ610Q.text: I am so glad that revolving sushi is now available in Vegas and this place is not a letdown. Their fish are fresh and tasty. Keep an eye out for the black garlic tuna because that is one you want to keep having on your table. You grab a plate from the belt and your bill totals to however many plate you have on the table. You can also order on their digitalized menu, which gives you pictures for the dishes as well as the sushi on the belt. Highly recommend the black garlic ramen. I swear, that bowl alone can open it's own ramen house. Once you order from the menu, a "robot" zips on top of the belt and stops at your table to serve it. Really great, really cute. The servers are also very attentive to every table. I deducted one star from it because of the sushi to rice ratio, which I feel is important with sushi places. While not horrible, the fish slices were a little smaller and thinner than I would like. Also, the place is not really great for large parties. If you're a party of more than 6, be prepared to sit on opposite sides of the restaurant. That being said though, I would definitely come back.

TJG7P8YJqigvGX6akwQgVg.text: This was my first time at a revolving sushi restaurant.  At the time this is the only revolving sushi joint in Vegas and it's alright.

yfA2AZC2eC-1Tiy9WmFtWg.text: This place rocks! Jae the manager is on his game! First class treatment and fun food. If u want fantastic customer service, a very cool selection and reasonably priced sushi inLas Vegas check this place out. It is off the strip so take an Uber. Open late. Yum

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BxgTWrJ2z8KQw1-PXeeljw.text: It's a great place, away from the strip in a more ethnic area of town. Great way to sample a variety of sushi. VERY reasonably priced. The lovely woman who seated us was very attentive and polite.

s4HZCk6_Pez_hIyvsfWQ-w.text: This was my first time trying one of these conveyer belt sushi restaurants, and while it sounded like a fun concept I have to admit I was a little bit concerned about freshness and quality coming in.  Well, I was happy to find both of those concerns unfounded!  Everything we tried was fresh and the variety of what they put out was surprisingly good.  There were a few items, like Japanese mackerel, that you'd be hard pressed to find at most other restaurants.  Plus, I loved the fact that you can just eat as little or as much as you want for a reasonable price, instead of doing the "all you can eat" thing.  Looking forward going back and taking my kids, since there even some great options for them and I'm sure they will looove the novelty of it all.

j9rKQGVzPISF__YqC4r_IA.text: I was drawn in to try this place out since they have the revolving belt with the sushi. It's neat if you don't know what you want since you can pick a plate off the belt and try different sushi.   The quality of the sushi taste amazing! They have a good amount of variety on the belt. You'll find some specialty rolls to nigiri and some desserts! If you want to order a entire roll let's say for a dragon roll, you can place the order on the iPad that is on the table. While on it you can order which ever sushi you crave for or something different. I also ordered their tonkotsu ramen. Their ramen is served in a small bowl and it's simple. You got your broth, ramen, a slice of Chasu, and some bamboo shoot.   Careful with eating off the revolving belt since it's $2.50 a plate and it adds up pretty quick haha. Their service there is fast, keeping up with how fast I'll be stacking the lids of the plate!

y_BbiLAPLEWz3V6-8efXbg.text: This is kind of late review! I went there with my daughters in December, not long after they opened. I have been waiting for revolving sushi restaurant coming to Vegas and it's finally here, so excited! The server was nice, we told her we never been there before and she explained how things work. We tried several different kind of sushi from the revolving belt, all so yummy! Our favorite was popcorn lobster. We didn't order anything from the menu but will do it next time. I will be back!

RKm_Vph1dncGbJOrzE6s5w.text: I've been to Sapporo quite a few times and just now getting around to leaving a review. First off, this is a really cool place for sushi lovers to try as it is the first conveyor belt sushi restaurant in Las Vegas! Aside from all of the AYCE sushi places in town, I come here when I want a quick bite of sushi for an affordable price. You can also order nigiri, sushi rolls, and other small entrees off of the iPad menu as well. Once it is ordered, a robotic trolley delivers your food. One of my favorite dishes is the Tuna Tartar and surprisingly their garlic ramen is very delicious as well! I've never had a problem as customer service is great, and the waiters are very nice. This is definitely a must try place.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. tuna tartar

Lr2U8axNl0LMUIICHulQ5A.text: I usually have a rule of threes. If I've visited a place three times, I leave a review! However, I've slacked and have actually been to Sapporo at least a dozen times since I've moved here half a year ago. Oops! Sapporo is definitely a "bang for your buck" type of place. It's also a very fun place to bring people who have never had revolving sushi before! At $2.50 a plate, you really couldn't ask for a better price. I have had some phenomenal fish here, and some good fish here, it depends on your preference I guess.  This place can get really, really busy, but the longest I have had to wait was 30 minutes I believe. That was during their late night happy hour (10-11 PM depending on the day of the week) where their plates are reduced to $1.50 a plate! I had always seen their happy hour but assumed it was reduced prices because they were just cycling through what was left.  Boy, was I wrong! It's like a whole different session of them preparing for a second dinner rush it seems. Having only been here a little while, they have managed to gain notoriety for their incredible happy hour and people will specifically line up out the door for their happy hour prices. Sapporo is great because as soon as you sit down, you can (pretty much) start eating once your server brings out the wasabi and ginger. I have managed to sit down, start eating, and be done in about 15 minutes when I was in a hurry but needed to eat. The wonders of revolving, self-service sushi! They also have an iPad for things you want to order, whether it be because someone keeps snapping up ALL the red snapper with yuzu and fresh wasabi (guilty) or because you want to order something that doesn't actually come on the belt! My boyfriend has ordered their ramen and their black garlic oil ramen is to die for. They have a standalone ramen location, but it's too far from where we live- so $4 for a bowl of ramen at our favorite sushi place is unreal! Unreally awesome. Also, parking here is tough because they have a pretty full shopping center, but once those businesses are closed, there's nobody that is going to be the tow police and tell on you- but also just don't be afraid to park anywhere- no matter the time of day. If you want a new experience at an affordable price, come to Sapporo for delicious sushi!

GT_Rvh5XoGw1r85XFt2lDA.text: I brought members of the Meetup groups, "Fun Vegas Foodies" and "Sushi and More" here.  The service that we received was very attentive, friendly and responsive.  They went above and beyond and provided an excellent evening meal for us.    The decor is modern and fresh.  One of our members wanted to get some of the wall decorations for his home.  :)  There are conveyor belts full of sushi.  There are chips in the dishes so they know how long the sushi has been sitting on the belt.  There are little robot trays that sends your special orders to you.  You order your specialty items from the iPads.  There is a bar near the entrance where we ordered hot sake as we waited for our table.  The sushi was fresh and excellent.  Take it from us, we eat sushi every week without fail.  I especially liked the salmon belly, o toro, and uni.  The black garlic ramen was phenomenal according to several of our members.  As a matter of fact, all of the special orders like the tuna tartare were above par.

mVG6jy1WDmnWrcACkoY6cA.text: This is a great experience and the food was fresh and pricing perfect.  If you have never tried revolvong sushi you really need to try this place.  If sushi isn't for you the menu offerings are great.  you can order right from a tablet at your table so there is no delay in service.  Those orders will roll out on a separate cart system so everything is super efficient.

LiRWhCzmJtyxGUuPuOcwRQ.text: Amazing place, Sushi was fantastic, service very friendly, the transporter bar to deliver your food is the coolest thing ever!

tSpw2kTPKIrRT1jdUhSGrA.text: first time here and will definitely be coming back. concept is great. food was excellent and service from jessica was as well. she was on point. i enjoyed the many choices available to sample from.   mike k

pG0Q5f8ELGrJ1kaiMgfqOA.text: Loved it!  Good pricing & the sushi was wonderful! The conveyor goes through the kitchen where the chefs are preparing the rolls and new items are constantly popping by you!   Pick a spot next to the kitchen where the conveyor is coming out if you are eatting solely off the conveyor so you get first choice!

_HpifXpjk0HSciComwclxA.text: It was okay. Just go without massive expectations and you'll be fine. It's clean and the prices are justifiable. For the price, I do not recommend the orange salmon but the uni is well worth it. Order less of orange salmon and more of uni and you'll definitely thank me.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orange Salmon

sHsIe_JYqJ5WisQS8JwOHw.text: This was my first time at Sapporo! It was delicious. You can either brag the conveyor belt sushi or order stuff off the menu. The menu is on a screen and easy to use. The service is fast and efficient. The only down fall is everyone in your party must be present to be seated.

fGxf6NfL2DDKUDd0CKLz7w.text: After having gone to several sushi places in Vegas, I've been on a kick lately and went here on a coworker's recommendation and was VERY disappointed. Not only was the fish not fresh at all (the yellowtail actually tasted really old, and their staff did nothing but not charge for that plate and kept the others in rotation... real safe) but the plates cost varying amounts which can be very expensive very quickly.  The selection was okay, which is really the only positive I can say. Fish was 'okay' at best, staff was inattentive and rude, and our bill was costly with far inferior quality compared to other places right in the same area. Konbea is ayce but terrible selection, and Kura is way bigger selection, high quality and very nice staff.  Skip this place unless you want possible food poisoning. First revolving sushi in Vegas, but sometimes older isn't better.

UBZa8XBkxXTvZr6dwxlXPg.text: Came here on Saturday for the first time and wanted to try it out for the novelty of the conveyor belt. Normally I prefer AYCE when getting sushi, but made an exception. The format is fun and makes for great Instagram posts. Gotta do it for the Gram! The rolls on the conveyor belt were okay, but I preferred the rolls ordered from the tablet and delivered on the tram. I also wish there were more roll options, as there weren't any baked rolls (only rolls with certain ingredients that were baked). The nigiri on the belts were excellent. The sushi is a good value, with most plates having three pieces of sushi or two pieces of nigiri. At $2.50 a plate, it works out to $7.50 per roll. Since it isn't AYCE, I was able to enjoy the sushi at a good price without having to push myself to eat my money's worth. I still prefer a great AYCE spot over Sapporo, but if I want sushi at a good price and don't want AYCE, I would definitely come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour prices

AiQZxKK6YZiCO46gAtQemA.text: This place was a fun experience. Sat at the bar for a drink while we waited to be seated. There was a variety of sushi rolls going around. It was nice to just pick and choose a roll, rather than gorging at an all you can eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zDJK6VP9q3t27UchV3rOTg.text: Great food , the flavors are all different from your average sushi restaurants and awesome atmosphere

WLuD3H2vRCczJDYU0WMsjA.text: 1st experience:  We walked in as a group of 6.  There wasn't much seating for large groups, so we had to wait (They asked if we would be ok sitting at separate tables near each other which was kinda funny, but I guess it's cool to have an option). Another group of 6 walked in about 10min after us and after waiting 30min, they were seated before us.  Frustrating.  We showed the employees our name on the list and they apologized for the mistake.  Food was great, 5-star quality.   Wanting to try the place again, my wife said she'd be down for the late night happy hour if they have it on the weekends.  Website is not functioning after months of being open and restaurant didn't answer their phones despite calling multiple times.  No way for me to find out about happy hour.  Very annoying.  Decided not to go  Food is 5-stars.  Waitress wasn't very good, hosts made mistakes and were MIA for some time when we first arrived, website is down, didn't answer phone after several attempts to call over a 30min period.  An unfortunate experience with multiple problems despite the food being very good.

YIOMzGfhHReaBlT-TZbCZg.text: Great food, great service in a clean place. Nothing more you can ask for. Quality of fish is surprisingly fresh for a revolving sushi place. Been here few times already and plan to come back often. Only thing I would change is prob the eel sauce they use...it's a little too sweet for my taste. Other than that everything else is on point.

AEz07qrK49DzGlqj-F5FMQ.text: Who doesn't love sushi?! There are a lot of good sushi spots in Vegas, most have AYCE but I've never seen one with a conveyer belt here until Sapporo. Everything was bomb!  Plates are only $2.50 each, and yeah that can add up but it's definitely worth it! First of all, you don't have to wait for your food to come because it comes to you. From California rolls to salmon to shrimp tacos to specialty rolls, there's rolls for days! The sushi tasted good and I love how fresh the raw fish tasted! You can also order full rolls ($7.50 each) and other entrees (ramen, sides, desserts) on the touchscreen and a robot tray will bring it out to you in about 15 minutes.   Definitely recommend this spot if you're craving some sushi. Really good place for groups. The only reason this place didn't get a full 5 stars is because of the dirty look one of the waitresses gave. We gave a decent tip so I don't understand why. She literally didn't even do much because we grabbed the food ourselves; all she did was bring out the drinks and gave us the check so she should just be glad she got something. Other than that, this place was dope!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ready to eat all the carbs
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. King Salmon!
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Tuna!

U9FHgfaJZQVqgkQswXdcUw.text: I brought my dad here one evening after work for a fun, interactive dinner. My dad loves sushi and this place did not disappoint. They DO NOT have AYCE but I think that it made the experience better.   When we sit at our table, our server asked us if we had ever been there before. Since we hadn't, he explained how things worked. The plates traveling around on the conveyor belt are all $2.50 a piece. There is also a touch screen tablet on the table with the full menu. You can order anything from the tablet and it will be delivered to you via another conveyor belt. That part was the coolest! We kept ordering from the touch screen just so we could keep getting the little car sent to us. :)  The food, AMAZING! The quality of the fish was LEGIT, probably since its not an AYCE place and they can afford better fish but omgosh! We stuck with mostly nigiri that night with my favorite being the New Zealand King Salmon! I had like 5 orders of that fish! There were so many pretty items that looked delicious to choose from it was hard to settle on what we did.  I definitely want to come back here with my dad, partner, son, friends, family, cousins, lol I don't care with who, I am just going back. I highly highly recommend this place. I couldn't even take pictures cause I was too busy stuffing my face. :)

LGZeEbyqIi0lPXizcnDJCg.text: Came with a group of 6 on a Saturday around 4pm and was seated immediately. The restaurant looks and feels very modern and elegant.   The conveyor belt sushi was delicious. Everything we had was super fresh and tasted great. There were no complaints amongst us about the food. We even ordered from the little machines they have at the tables for other items like hand rolls, soups, and desserts. They all came out in a timely manner and tasted great! I would highly recommend the salmon belly, the lobster roll, and the rainbow roll from the conveyor belt. Also, the udon noodles and the creme brulees when you order from the machine!  Our server was very kind and checked up on us during our meal. She even came and asked us if we haven't received items we ordered from the little machine on the tables so that she could check in the kitchen for us about its progress! Overall a really great experience, would definitely come back if I was ever in Vegas again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. udon noodle soup
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon sushi

C3QjdF8AchcpBIp4sOXt4A.text: For a revolving sushi restaurant, the quality is very high. My family and I went here on a random weekday night after getting off the plane. It was open late for happy hour. I had never been so happy to see quick and fresh food.   When we got there, they were still setting up rows of booths and waiting for people to determine which ones to open up. It was about a ten minute wait.   For happy hour, all the dishes on the conveyor belt and some alcohol was discounted. If you order from the the screen, then you will pay full price for those items. Most of the special rolls on the belt were delicious. I don't remember their names, but it wasn't your typical dragon roll.  The staff was super attentive and quick. I was very impressed. We could flag someone down easily.  This restaurant is stylish; the food is delicious; the staff are wonderful. I love this place. Do yourself a favor and take a uber/lyft off the strip here.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KufAPKypJ4atJ6iXAsY_ow.text: Very cool place. It was actually fun ordering your food off the menu at this place. They have these cool iPads you order off of and the sushi comes on a belt to your tables. I was very impressed with the flavor of everything we had. Highly recommend this place.

2jm6jICbiWJJFll1gfU_5Q.text: I love this place! Reminded me of Tokyo. Service is great, clean facilities and the food is great.   Had no complaints. They had a pretty good selection of nigiri too.   My husband had the ramen and loved it as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour menu
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Right side of restaurant

hhbH8yeXV6wIFF5xIyZNaA.text: This restaurant is my favorite in Vegas! Love their sushi! I just wish they are a buffet so I can eat all I want lol. Kidding aside, the place is really affordable and for the price you're paying its actually worth every cents of it! Its really yummy!   I dont eat raw so all my orders are cooked sushi. I love the shrimp taco sushi its soooo good. I also love the  ramen! Everything is delish! Service is really great! 5/5 for me!!! Will come back and bring more friends!   Highly recommended

li6pIHnMxeNDw3tzdncVqQ.text: I am in love with this sushi joint!  Service is great.. and their food?  Better quality than most in this price point. $2 for all the nigiri and sushi rolls that are riding on the conveyor.  We must have tried all of them and they all tasted so good.  There are also other selections to choose from from the tablet menu.  One of our favorites were the soft shell crab, black garlic ramen and seared scallops. Oh my... This is sushi heaven!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna taco
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black garlic ramen - wow
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared scallops - so yummy

E7UK2f-aerXwMUHXkWyGZA.text: Went last Friday and it was awesome.. You get a plate of sushi that's on the belt and just eat it. It's super cheap and they always refill the plates going around. I have this place marked down as one of my favorite places

JKSK1AHRthzHzk4QNqtJBA.text: Best revolving sushi in Vegas. Don't even bother going to the other 2 in Chinatown. The quality here is amazing considering the price. The place is also very clean, service is very fast, and the sushi is always restocked pretty quickly. The other 2 revolving sushis in Vegas BOTH have TERRIBLE sushi quality and service. I regretted even trying the other 2. Don't waste your time anywhere else, only go to Sapporo

awTNzhxgkdePPO104qG36g.text: I stopped by Sapporo on a Saturday late afternoon for a quick lunch. The wait was about 10 minutes. Two revolving belts were open. Seating is primarily near the belts in a booth set up. Each table has a screen where you can order food, but sushi is also offered on the belt. The replenishment of sushi on the belt was rather slow, so I had to order most of my food.   While food appeared to be fresh, it did not taste as great as it should. My Philly roll just seemed to be off, I could not really point my finger what was wrong with it, but I did not enjoy it as much as I normally do.  The atmosphere at the restaurant was not really pleasant either. It had a diner-type feel, which is different from a lounge setting that you'd normally see in a sushi restaurant. Service was pleasant and relatively fast, and the checkout process painless. Overall, not sure that I would be back because of the atmosphere and food.

1Dj0KFNfHk-t_h3mELTliw.text: Loved it! Went for happy hour. 10p-mn on weekdays. $1.75 a plate but the selection was a bit light. Still had more than enough to satisfy my craving for a great price though! Nigiri was awesome! Favorite definitely included salmon, yellowtail, baby yellowtail, tuna, bluefin tuna, and a mix of rolls to choose from including bbq eel on the rotation. Also had a la cart for $2.50 too. Draft beer $2.50. Wished the revolving part had more choices. Got 1 piece a la cart uni which wasn't that great and was kind of old, and also had a bit of sand or sea urchin shell in it or something. Overall a great experience. Owned by the same group that owns a few other places including master Kim's kbbq which is also awesome and they're definitely getting this casual-upscale asian dining cuisine down to a science.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Other restaurants owned by the same group
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour

13FiTtrQLq1ZvZt5yH80dA.text: Hubby and I have come here a few times now and wow! It's a fun atmosphere where you can literally pick sushi off a revolver. Definitely coming back.

NmRoQsmXuUrUtS0fkQ49fA.text: Service, food quality, and cleanliness are top notch. Server was super attentive and always came to check on us no matter how autonomous the restaurant is. These guys hit the revolving sushi concept well.  The kicker here is that black garlic ramen. It was honestly amazing and shits on jinyas tonkatsu Black if you're familiar. Like all the other reviews I'm coming back just for this.  Regular and special roll quality are good and portioned well fish to rice wise. Seared garlic tuna and sexy mama were my usual plates I kept grabbing. With hand rolls at $2.95 you can't help but indulging in a stuffed spicy crab or even salmon skin roll to make sure you get your gluttony fix on.

xUXQDdX-TraM-6KfA4yicg.text: A revolving sushi finally in Vegas??!! Oh yes! Came here for dinner & it was amazing.   Atmosphere & dinning area was very modern and clean. It was spacious & had lots of seating. Employees had great customer service & made sure we were ok.   Food - AMAZING. They offer different varieties of sushi, ramen & other cooked items. This place is very affordable ($2.50) for items on the belt. But they also had other items $2.50& up but was totally worth it. The fish was fresh & the ramen was so big and delicious for ($4.50). I HIGHLY recommend the orange salmon. It was so gooooood! I had the black garlic & tonkatsu ramen and they were almost as good as monta ramen! But with lesser toppings.  I would recommend this place if you want cheap sushi or if you can't choose between sushi or ramen! I'll be coming back for more orange salmon!!

jOdasOL7oHj9ue9DElV81g.text: Finally we got one in Vegas!!   Concept is fun and cool! Got several different sushi's off the belt. Toro was pretty good but I felt like the blue fin was a miss today.   I ordered salmon from the tablet and I also got salmon from the belt. I'd say that it is probably better to have it ordered versus taken off the belt. The fish was fresh.   ORANGE SALMON!!! Get it!! Do not regret this dish. My absolute favorite. BOMB!! Get like two of these!!!  This was just the soft opening. It's pretty ok and service was not bad. Just when we got to checks it took a while because we had a party of 7 and then spilt check 4 ways.   2.50 per plate isn't a bad price either. But I think we ate about the same price as AYCE.   Uni was deliciouuuuusssss!!! That nice orange color and yumminess.   Overall, I'd come back if I wasn't too hungry. I believe that it is fairly priced and I love the concept but hopefully the freshness doesn't go away because most revolving sushi I've had eventually ends up gross but so far so good!

Mp0C25Hh0mC6zb5pYVt5PA.text: Las Vegas finally has their on revolving sushi restaurant, Sapporo! It's a relatively new place when this blog is posted.  My first conveyor belt sushi experience took place in Japan. The restaurant I went to was called '(/Kaiten Sushi)'; '(/Kaiten)' means 'rotation' so 'Rotation Sushi'.  Sushi are placed on top of a conveyor belt and it moves through the restaurant while the customers can just easily take whatever they fancy. Unlike Japan, all the plates on the conveyor belt are $2.50. You can use the screens they have at each table to order a specific order and those prices varies.  The Sushi was fresh and had a good amount portion of fish. Salmon is my go to fish and it was delicious! I enjoyed the sushi. They have some special rolls in either two to four pieces, then if you want an actual full roll you can special order it on the touch pad.   My friend and I each got full from 7 conveyor belt plates and the price was $18.94 which is a pretty good price for us since it's similar amount to an ayce sushi restaurant.  One thing, I checked their yelp for their address, but it lead me to a different location then the actually restaurant. Luckily, it was close by to where the yelp address lead me. Sapporo is on Spring Mountain, past Arville, but before you hit the Decatur's traffic light. It is located right next to Hotai Furniture, so I recommend looking up Hotai Furniture to make it more easier to locate Sapporo.

rQPx2TILX3dcLRimE4riyw.text: This place is the first of its kind in Vegas!  I've had revolving sushi in San Francisco, so i was super excited to try this place out.    Inside there 3 different conveyor belts that have sushi going around.  There's a little label that tells you what sushi is coming up.    The best sushi here is the Toro & the popcorn lobster.  The Toro is super fatty and buttery and melts in your mouth!  The popcorn lobster is tempura fried lobster on top of a Cali roll and with spicy mayo.  The owner gave us their garlic ramen on the house and that was really good as well.  The best part about this place is that you can still order off of the tablet located at each table.  A little electronic cart that comes out to your table.  You pay based off of how many plates you pull of the conveyor belt.  $2.50 each plate that consist of either 1 or 2 pieces of nigiri or 3/4 pieces of a roll.  The orders you place through the tablet are a little more pricier because they are full rolls/hand rolls/dishes.  Check this place out it's a cool experience for sure & the food isn't bad!

8KajHzdsymwxCX9QE7ZqHQ.text: This was a really fun experience. I'm looking forward to coming back soon!  Our party of 2 came in for late night happy hour. Happy Hour is everyday. The late night one runs Sunday-Thursday 10pm to Close and Friday-Saturday 11pm to Close.  We came on a Monday night right at 10pm. There was plenty of parking at that time. There is a clipboard at the front and we signed ourselves in. A lot of parties started to come and sign in right behind us. We were seated within 10 minutes.  There were a good amount of options on the conveyer belt. Some of my favorites I picked off the line were the garlic tuna, pepper tuna and Sexy Girl. There is also a tablet on the table where you can order off the menu. A little robot brings it to your table on top of the conveyer belt. I ordered the Black Garlic Ramen and it was amazing!! The broth was velvety and it had lots of garlic for all of you garlic lovers.  I thought the service was great. Our drinks were never empty. Our water was always refilled. The server comes by when you're finished to tally up your plates so they can bring you your bill (I believe you can ask for you check via the tablet and the server then will come by). I liked that I didn't have to be bothered by a server unless I really needed them. There's minimal human interaction here which I really liked.

t6GbxmPKZRKK5h6XsKFzmA.text: Omg! Please get the popcorn lobster . I normally don't like to order sushi for delivery because it doesn't seem fresh like as in prepared in front of you. But this didn't disappoint

O3Dm4zIvu6b3aqkQO1RPeg.text: Horrible wait time!!! This is the 2nd time in one month. I was very patient couple weeks ago but this time it's very annoying because they have a lot of seats available and they make you wait. The sesame garlic ramen is my favorite though.

nP6N7R2Mo349H4nOUrGP8Q.text: Finally a revolving sushi restaurant in Vegas! I've been to several of them in other states so I was excited to finally get one out here. We went in on a late Friday evening. The wait wasn't too long, less than 20 minutes.   Each plate on the conveyor belt is $2.50 and you can order other items from the tablet at your table. I took several items off the belt and also ordered from the tablet.   Conveyor belt items - Snow crab nigiri - crab was sweet and tasted fresh Popcorn lobster roll - covered in mayo/sauce, heavily breaded Lobster roll - doused in a sweet sauce, couldn't taste anything else Seaweed salad - refreshing, good quality and flavor California roll - had a generous amount of crab Gyoza - greasy and soggy, flavor was good Shrimp taco - shrimp was in a tart mayo/sauce?, wasn't into it Tuna taco - like poke in a tortilla chip shell, delicious, would eat a whole tray of them  Tablet items -  Udon soup - broth was really sweet for some reason, wouldn't order it again Vanilla ice cream - this was a big "womp, womp" for us. We put in the order for the ice cream on our tablet. Then the waiting game began. 5, 10, 15 minutes went by. Someone finally stopped at our table and asked if we ordered vanilla ice cream. I said yes, but we hadn't gotten it yet. Another few minutes went by until we finally got our bowl of ice cream. Strangely, the person brought it to us from the front of the house so I'm not really sure where they store their ice cream. My kiddo was kind of bummed it didn't come out on the automated tray that runs above the conveyor belt. C'est la vie.   The service was pretty good for a busy Friday evening. Staff was attentive and we didn't feel rushed even though there was still a line of people waiting to be seated. This experience was a little rough but I'd give it another shot. There are tons of items we didn't get to try so we'll be back again.

UMGT6goNShGzB8UCBsUhVQ.text: Las Vegas' FIRST conveyor belt sushi restaurant!   Came here tonight with some friends and my husband. It was their soft pre-opening or something? Apparently they were opened the last two nights as well but it was invite only. I'm super jealous that some people got invited!   I saw on Facebook that they were opened for a limited time on Dec. 2nd for dinner 5:00 pm - 10:00 pm. When I saw that, I immediately showed it to my friends and husband, planned for an early dinner at 5:00 pm. The parking situation is a little weird because they had a lot of parking spots but a lot of them had names of other establishments or they had the word "reserved" on them. Except there's a sign in front of Sapporo saying that you can park anywhere. Sooooo not really sure how that really goes.  We got there a bit early and got seated right away. They told us already that the food won't come out until 5:00 pm and we were fine with that. They have an iPad system on all the tables where you can order things if you don't want to grab it from the conveyor belt. The iPad also keeps a tally of all the things you ordered, which is great.   As you can probably tell by now, they have a conveyor belt with different types of nigiri. They even have signs before them so you know what you're grabbing. What I did notice is that the sushi starts in the middle of the room before making it to the other side, which kind of sucks because if there was something we wanted ... but everyone else also wanted, we wouldn't be able to get it. We could order it .. but we also noticed that the fish isn't consistent. Some pieces would be fattier and other pieces would be more lean. There wasn't enough salmon on the conveyor belt for us so we had to order two more orders but they came out quite lean. We like our fatty salmon belly pieces! Booo!   Also, for the ordering system, they have a custom cart that stops right in front of your table with your order when it's ready. It also tells you, "Your order is here. Please take your order." Super cool. It reminds me of some of the sushi places in Japan that does that.   Onto the sushi! We focused mainly on the nigiris. They have rolls too. Each plate on the conveyor belt is $2.50. They have hand rolls too but you have to order them. They weren't on the belt. They are also $2.50. They have udon and ramen to order. The nigiri are mostly two pieces to a plate unless you get the premium items: toro, king crab, uni. Those are one piece per plate for $2.50. Honestly, toro for that price is a STEAL. Most establishments charge $8-10 for one piece of toro. The sushi is quite fresh. I think the only thing I didn't care for is the rice. It was good but it was missing something. They also packed it a lot where it doesn't feel as soft -- felt a bit more hard and squished.   Don't worry about the fish staying out too long. Their conveyor belt has senors whenever a plate gets put on there. They have a timer for it so if a plate has been on the belt for 30 minutes and hasn't been eaten, it will be trashed!  You keep the plates at your table so at the end of your meal, they can tally it up and give you your total. Service was great -- they were willing to split our check in anyway we want!   TIP: If you're a huge eater, this may not be the place for you. These things can add up fast. I would suggest you do AYCE if you eat a ton. Haha.   This place brings back memories of when I used to have the boat sushi back in San Francisco with my mom and grandma.   Overall, decent quality. Good service. I would come back :) And would suggest people give it a try.

u_jtw2ms7k0Os7_kevEAJQ.text: Amazing! So tasty, good prices and a great concept of dining that really works. I personally loved that when you ordered a dish that came directly from the kitchen, a robot would bring it to you. So fun! The place was very busy when we got there and we didn't have a reservation as they said they couldn't take anymore of them but to show up and they could seat us, so we did. Granted it was late evening on Valentine's Day and we went on a whim but they had a great little bar with a variety of drinks to keep us busy while we waited and the staff were so friendly and helpful, allowing us to sample sakes to make sure we bought our favourite. Will definitely return!
