zq9eflkaaT0FGNv9rPEjVg.text: Had a Great experience. From waiting in line watching the slideshow of the food items we knew what to order upon sitting. It took us 25 minutes to wait for our seat and 20 minutes to finish eating  not too pricey either

3QlJKR1lrS7qwkG2mpTcKA.text: Great little gem in Las Vegas. Found them on yelp and decided to go here because of the revolving service. Your plates of food are directly brought to you on the belt from the kitchen. Quick service and food is made quickly. Low prices for quality food. Definitely worth a try for happy hour.   The unagi is excellent. Also try the soft shell crab. It's service with a really smooth and sweet carrot puree. Ordered ramen but I wasn't all that intruiged. Noodles were a little hard and not very much meat. Broth was good though.

D1hwclrbmtItt1_162uxEA.text: Easily one of the best sushi places in town. Huge selection and even a happy hour special- 1.50 per conveyor plate so you can basically get ayce amounts of food for low prices . While there is a huge variety of sushi on the belt, it is limited to just that. If you want a different kind of roll, some kind of soup, etc. youll have to order from their main menu however it's all brought to you by tram by the belt so it's still a win.

us22YsDAXgW-jLgGK8eofw.text: Fun place! Sushi was very good! Clean restaurant! The waitresses were a little slow! We were new to this restaurant and weren't sure how to go about! They didn't explain things when we were seated and we waited awhile for waters! But other than that it was good!

VL5zuN2loO69A-RMhg5lqw.text: I enjoyed the experience along with the food. The ahi tacos are a must try! In fact, try everything, I did, lol. They charge per plate, and it's super reasonable.

n6EZF5wNP1aMHat-_nacVw.text: Thank you for bringing revolving sushi to Vegas. We had to wait quite a while to get a seat, the place is a hot item right now.  $2.50 a plate of the conveyor  There is a menu you can order from off the ipad mounted on the inside of the booth, when it is not rebooting that is. When you order something on the ipad don't forget to send it, we had selected some things and they just sit there until you confirm. Black garlic ramen was very flavorful Special sushi order come out on a separate track on top of the conveyor and you get excited even when you haven't ordered anything :D The softshell crab is so delicious. We ordered a lot off the menu, not the belt.  We were seated on the right side, which has its own conveyor, so less variety and stuff hangs out a lot longer. Somebody said that it gets kicked off after 30 minutes, I can tell you it doesn't, there was a bunch of sad looking items that just kept going round and round for the whole time we were there.  The sushi tasted clean and you can order a whole roll when you don't see what you are waiting for running around.  The bill caused me to have some chest pains.  The nigiri on the conveyor is an extremely thin slice of fish on rice. the two pieces you get might equate to one piece at a regular sushi place and then it would still be small.  You get a varied number of slices of rolls per plate depending on what you pick. These were also really small, AYCE sized, not I ordered a roll at a sit down sushi place sized.  So..  decor, nothing really. price, seems inexpensive but it is not for the portion size. service, ordered items show up pretty quickly, fun to get the little tram to deliver you some food. taste, fresh tasting sushi, flavorful ramen

6lIR4Nlj6j7ktwZxcd5g8A.text: The sushi is OK.  I like the instant gratification, but it ends up being expensive if you want to get full.   If you are looking for a light snack, move it up to four stars.  For a meal, there are better deals with just as good or better fish elsewhere.

g4ZHkuOuuRg1GHa-LUowig.text: Bring your as here!!! Especially during happy hour. Came with pals!!! Awesome place to start sushi

Eihl8X73MGoMuzYQa9Niyw.text: We were in a group and ordered a bunch of items to sample, and all were great.  Don't have a ton to say, other than I enjoyed myself, and thought the food was of high quality and enjoyable.

gOBJB8AYdlw8v8PL5PJ8Jg.text: Great place. I like the setup, you get the Tray's come by for $2.50 and if you order something an electric tray comes by and deliveres your order with music ... Very nice people, nice music, very clean ... Will definitely go there again.

pEJObo-NFDcgfKiSjr4C-A.text: Real clean and modern place. The sushi was good, but honestly you can find better tasting sushi elsewhere but we went there to experience the conveyer belt.

brMSdJuCGjMqGfxmdGlNkg.text: The place is really nice and clean! Staff were super helpful and informative about the menu. You could order items off the menu (that's on an iPad). Other than that, plates taken from the conveyor belt is $2.50 each. This was my first time going to a revolving sushi place. It was rather interesting to watch sushi go on the conveyor belt. I'll be honest, it was a bit pricey for me since the portions are small but the food was great overall.

rJyY5SkNPb3Lgl_jrL8loA.text: First visit here came for early dinner. The location is easy to find and plenty of parking. We were seated immediately and our server came right away for drink orders. All the sushi is placed on the rotating conveyer and is named properly. You can also order from the electronic menu for specialty items. We were happy with our selections avail from the revolving device. The sushi is very fresh and we didn't have to wait long for items to be added. Our bill was very reasonable for 3 people, around $60. We also shared green tea ice cream for dessert. Everything we had was excellent. We will return when we come back to Vegas.

jC0SNSwkH7BfPLPpgjAcUQ.text: Great experience. A bit slow on the service from seating to checking out. Special orders take a lot longer than taking from the belt but fresher of course. We had to wait about 45 minutes to get seated. Overall great experience and fresh food aside from being slow in checking out.

ycfveqBTwk7le_0n-35xhQ.text: This place is amazing! It's a but far from the Vegas strip but soooo worth it. Great priced sushi and great quality. The staff and atmosphere was awesome. Try the sushi tacos!!

zIID60ns9lmyZ2QTlVwSaQ.text: This place is awesome it's a mix of sushi train and really nice LOOKING restaurant. They put a few different rolls on a belt and after 10 or 15 minutes they toss them if not eaten. So unless your there at a busy time they don't put the good stuff on the belt. You have to order full rolls. I like the plate idea 2.50 per plate with one to four rolls on each depending on what it is. Also depending on what you order a robot like tray brings your food out or the server. They have desert but I feel they need mochi. I only gave four stars because during the day they aren't busy so you don't get as many specialty rolls to try and it's boring stuff on the belt. Try the popcorn lobster it's delicious.

qeHvp8pZrW_YFC_dn6JnVw.text: Coming from Hawaii, it's place known for its variety of sushi, poke and seafood. My husband and I have been to many sushi restaurants so our expectations were very high and boy did this place deliver!!! Amazing!!  Ahi was very fresh and the quality was very good. I'll say it would contend with some of the best in Hawaii. Prices are super affordable, each plate on the conveyor belt are $2.50. They have daily Happy Hours that start at 10pm-closing, where ALL plates are $1.50 and japanese draft beers are half off.  They also have a menu where you could order rolls and other dishes, which range from $4-$9.   The fact that they have lids on their plates and they have sensors beneath it, so after 30 minutes they're removed from the conveyor belt..is absolutely genius. You never have to worry if dishes were sitting out too long.   Great ambiance and very friendly staff. Definitely a place we'll come back to everytime we're in Vegas!!! Mahalo Sapporo!

XKbP7Ln0XrwtVdTVJEyluw.text: I love this place! The food is great. Very clean and you can't go wrong with the fun atmosphere of the conveyer belt with food. If you're not an ayce person I would definitely come here.

1478C2DY9F6KXXyE6Gsqig.text: Yay, the first revolving sushi in Las Vegas! I came here for the experience which did not disappoint. However, knowing who our server is was a little confusing due to the fact no one really introduced themselves. We had five different people serve us. All the plates on the conveyer belt were 2.50 each which in my opinion a little expensive. Each plate had about two sushi each. They had other special items that were pretty good. Overall it was a great experience, I'll probably go again :)

n_oYnqTgL1LyInVcs2oROQ.text: We went on their soft opening week, and while there were still a few glitches, it is well executed for the most part. The selection was quite limited, perhaps due to the time of day; we were there at 11pm, so that may explain the lack of options on the belt. We were offered a menu to order from, but what fun is it to order from the menu when you are at a sushi conveyor restaurant?

-O2JTtDoVcpzmPypUosQhA.text: This place is fantastic. The only major problem I had while here is I hurt from how much I ate. I'm not sure I'll make it to my car... but if I do, I will recover and then return.

r1QmxxaSqvDkiOQNYBM0JQ.text: Great sushi, lot of variety, glad Vegas finally has a revolving sushi joint. Loved the shrimp tacos and ramen, too. Plus it's just fun ordering off the iPad and getting your appetizers delivered on the automated tray.

RAxBQ0EP8U7niFWfs2NVVw.text: Price point  is very good and quality is above its value! Definitely recommend to friends and family

kdrsT2LZw9Sgc0ESGaJ7IA.text: What an amazing experience!! My girlfriend took me there for my birthday and I was perfect! Not only is the atmosphere nice, but the freshness of their food is out of this world! We will definitely be back!!!

AohbWi58z5kHGlYJaIImJg.text: Wow! Only good things to say about this place. My girlfriend and I went on Saturday night and it was surprisingly not packed at all. When we sat down the server explained how it all worked. We went during happy hour too, so the prices were great! There were a ton of items on the revolving belt to choose from, and new items would randomly pop up. The have an Ipad menu of things you can order from the kitchen. We didn't try those this time, but from the great experience we had, we will for sure be back to try them. The ramen and udon bowls were very well priced. I look forward to making this a weekly spot for sure!

MTJ2_gGy7y7pOy7_FzecCA.text: For what it is, this place is pretty awesome. You can't go in there expecting exotic fishes of course. It is a convenient restaurant. You sit down and in less than a second you can have a piece of tasty bite size sashimi taco in your mouth. Small bowl of garlic ramen is perfect and not too heavy. Their dishes from the kitchen, such as cod and branzino were quite tasty!  Try the pork belly also.

fyWjgvq7C_zIxL-jDC4gmA.text: Have never had this done before. Went to sopporo for lunch and while we were waiting to be seated . Encountered some less than professional behavior and some very rude actions from i beleive his name was cliff. So as we were being seated i shot a short note on yelp to the owner . The gentelman was standing beside my table within 5 minutes asking how he could help. He was passing by in his car and got the dm from yelp and stoped to help us  We eat here about 3 times a month food is great fresh and can easly get what ever you ask for.But that very effective appprach he took will have our whole family's buisness. Im sorry i did not catch your name sir but more people in this country need to take notice. Thank you for takeing such good care of us. Must try mango creamed soda

QTk5MpGTIKazYDNbaTXNZw.text: This place is super fun with great service and delicious food. Loved everything we tried!

ccY6nn6c9tCMCVomjsV1Jg.text: Vegas has a new edition to the food scene that you need to check out! This hidden gem and the first of its kind in town is a revolving sushi bar!   Located in Chinatown, Sapporro sushi is central for most parts of the valley. Upson walking up they are well lit with a huge neon sign advertising their spot.   Inside is a smaller lobby that opens into the dining and bar area. On a side note, the architecture art wall is so cool to stop and look at. Solid wood octagons are hand carved and manipulated to give a 3D effect.   Once seated you have two options for getting sushi. 1.) Using the iPad at your table to order special rolls, apatizers or kitchen selections. Or 2.) The best way, grab sushi as it come around on the conveyer belt! Handmade fresh sushi rolls and nigiri are plated and sent around the restraint in covered plates. Each white plate is only $2.50.   The food is phenomenal, savory and wide selected. The service is spot on, we were checked on by all the servers in our section. No one is left unattended. At the end they add up your white plates and multiply that by $2.50. Easy!!

TcpgXjro_EDHIN4eQx6-0w.text: Finally! Our very own revolving sushi place here in Las Vegas. Park anywhere in the plaza, don't worry about the store-branded slots. My family and I dined here on Thursday - seated at 12:30pm, and left the restaurant at 1:33pm. Great turnaround time! Our server was beyond graceful, and incredibly courteous. She seated us, offered high chairs for my toddler, and even brought trainers for my kids' chopsticks (such a nice touch). Then came her quick tutorial on conveyor belt 101 and how-to. She was so attentive, and checked on us with just the right amount of distance so we can enjoy our time. The electronic menu and ordering system is superb, and I can't wait to dine here again!

bBN9HFH6KnyWCxgUXlG0og.text: Las Vegas has a surprisingly large amount of sushi restaurants, for a city no where near the ocean, they serve some of freshest fish, Sapporo Revolving Sushi is no exception.   One of our favorites in Hawaii back in the day was very much like this place, a moving conveyor belt of freshly made sushi moving past your table. You picked what you wanted and price was based on the color of the plate. Sapporo differs slightly, all plates off the belt are $2.50, but the smartly added bonus, a computer pad at the table, allowing you to order everything from specific sushi rolls, ramen, tempura, to dessert.   One thing to note, when you order, a small robotic tray comes on top of the conveyor belt to deliver your order, it stops in front of your table announcing that your order is being delivered. Our first time, had no idea and took the plate only to discover it wasn't ours. The robotic delivery tray will flash yellow and announce your order, it's a little confusing the first time.   All the sushi was fresh and very good, new favorite for me will be the pepper ahi!

s2kYdfhjjIc-hKQXBJOXog.text: I'll start with the good: the service was very good, friendly and professional. The toro piece was solid. Some of the other pieces that I had were enjoyable if not particularly remarkable, including the tobiko and the sweet shrimp.  The so-so: the sea urchin was not particularly good. I passed up some salmon items because some of the salmon did not look to be of a good quality--clearly farm raised fish.  This is better than the revolving sushi place I went to in Atlanta, but I would still say that it is still a place better enjoyed with a group more interested in a fun experience than particularly high quality sushi.

H1EkcbvVx3FmwfQDhOabsA.text: What I love about this place is that you're served instantly with the conveyor belt. Every dish that was pulled off the belt tasted good and was surprisingly fresh. Now don't expect super high quality fish. C'mon it's only $2.50 per dish so you get what you pay for. But, if you want a dish freshly made or don't see it on the belt you have the option to order it on the ipad. It will then be shortly delivered to your table by a robot. You'll know it's yours because it will stop in front of you and will blink yellow. There are many other dishes on the ipad so be sure to peruse all items. A few dishes that tickled my palate were the yellowtail & tuna tacos, peppered tuna sushi, & the steak. As for the space, it's chic, modern, and spacious serviced by friendly waiters. Btw, there's a call button on the ipad if you need to holler at one.

13VX_WXnDybwWdmL_-pxnA.text: Writing this primarily as a WARNING: During my dinner here on a Wednesday night 7-8PM, my car window was smashed and the inside contents stolen. Do NOT park away from the lighted area directly in front of the restaurant. Do NOT leave anything visible in your car. Parking is tight so if you have to park further away in the lot where it is dark, beware that there are thieves waiting to separate you from your hard earned possessions. No fault of the restaurant but if the management was wise, they would do something to stop this activity affecting their patrons.

7AXUK0q96YmruNFDTBJxxA.text: Really a 4 for normal hours, 5 for happy hour.  Happy hour here is pretty late night, 10pm Sunday-Thursday and 11pm Fri/Saturday until close, but at $1.50 a plate is the perfect late night snack that isn't terrible for you. While it only applies to the conveyor belt items, that's good enough. Beer and other options are really cheap too, making it hard not to order at least one.  When we first went here near opening day, they were having trouble keeping up but now they generally keep the belts well stocked. That's obviously a big deal since sometimes you can be waiting a while for what you want to come around. Of course you can order from the kitchen, but that isn't included in the Happy Hour.  I'd say the fish is better than average quality. Compared to AYCE, it's certainly better than those options.  Service is generally prompt. Most of the time, you don't need one since this is a conveyor belt and delivery robot restaurant!

pYwp94-ZCxH04T_tcYaTkQ.text: I had the Hold' Em Roll and Tempera Lobster roll, which were both great. I will return here with my family again.

6XBsq9PudazP8cpKHjLppg.text: This is actually fast food sushi. Well, as long as you can avoid the waits just to get seated during peak hours.  I heard about Sapporo Revolving Sushi through the grapevine and almost had a chance to try a soft opening, but that fell through. Fortunately, after mentioning this restaurant to a friend, he suggested that we try it out this weekend. We showed up at about 5:45 on Friday night and only had to wait upwards of 10 minutes for a seat, which was fantastic in light of the crowd that had materialized by meal's end.  The server strangely asked whether we'd eaten at a revolving sushi restaurant before, and my friend said yes (although I hadn't), which ended up in us skipping the tutorial. That kinda added a wait for me as I naively blundered my way through the tablet-based ordering system (note: press the "i" with a circle around it for hi-res photos of a food item) until my friend's gf pointed out that I had to press "Place Order" to send my list to the kitchen, so let me help out other newbies and say this: don't forget to press "Place Order" when you're sure of what you want to order.  That said, the tablet orders took about 2-3 minutes to come out, which is insanely fast for any restaurant anywhere. Most of them arrived on the top "rail" of the conveyor belt system, via a machine that travels to the appropriate spot, lights up to signal the correct table, and plays prerecorded messages prompting you to grab your order then press the button to return the bot to the kitchen. Occasionally, a server would bring out your order. Not much interaction with employees aside from that, ordering drinks, removing lids, and finalizing checks.  Oh, that's right, lids. So the potentially faster way to get food is by grabbing it off the lower level of the conveyor belt, which constantly runs clockwise with signs naming foods followed by a small number of plates containing said foods. Small appetizers, nigiri, and half-rolls all makes appearances, and each plate is $2.50 (tallied up by hand-counting plates at meal's end). No different colored plates or anything in this restaurant's belt system.  Now, when I said potentially faster, I mean that some items weren't always available, such as various "taco" appetizers, premium nigiri (1 piece per order, not 2 pieces), and hand rolls (don't know that they even a belt item despite pricing). Fortunately, you can order everything for delivery via tablet, so use/abuse that as needed.  I think I've waxed poetic on the concept enough. I can and should probably say a lot about the food too, and I usually talk about each individual type of fish, but I can summarize it this time by noting that every single piece of seafood which I tasted was fresh. I'm talking about upwards of over 20 bites, with over 10 different varieties. Nothing was absolutely the best quality you can find in town, but almost everything at least matches if not exceeds expectations for "entry-level" sushi.  Highlights for me included the toro ($2.50/1 pc), orange salmon ($7.95 for a more affordable yet surprisingly comparable version of "sake orenji"), mackerel ($2.50/2 pc), and Branzino with Carrot Puree ($4.95, not too huge but moist and tender w/ crispy skin; caution that puree may be too sweet for some).  Assuming that they can maintain that consistent quality, Sapporo Revolving Sushi offers a very solid balance between value and price. I just found myself wanting more in the value department after seeing my final check. I wasn't starving, but I was quite hungry, so the sizing of the nigiri reminded me of all-you-can-eat sushi experiences all over town, which would have cost less for a potentially gluttonous feast with relatively marginal decreases in quality. I'll probably save future trips here for when I'm craving particular foods and/or only moderately hungry.

ZdX3yRJLvhJ5GOQExDAWXw.text: This place popped up on my yelp as hot and new so course I had to give it a try revolving sushi why not!!!!!   Me and a friend came in around 2pm supposedly they close at 3pm for a few hours which is a little strange lol specially when people are still walking in at 2:50.... there was a little wait since one of the revolving machines wasn't working but wasn't long    I ordered a mule it was yummy and very refreshing   Sushi on the belt are 2.50$ which is a great price but there is also a tablet to order other items as well which are a little higher but it's definitely not expensive at all  I ordered the toro oysters orange salmon I have definitely had better toro but for 2.50 I can't complain about the price the orange salmon was yummy it was 7.50$ the oysters were yummy and fresh .... my friend got stuff which they seemed to enjoy I didn't try any of there's   The bills for two of us was maybe 50$ it was definitely worth the price plus the experience was great  I would say check this place out I will be coming back

Yvfdtv7t33JPKEDjtOxreA.text: Came here on the first night of their invite only "soft opening" after the manager surprisingly invited me and my guests for a gastronomic experience. Freddy, the manager of this very first revolving sushi restaurant in Vegas, gave us a warm welcome upon our arrival. Walking inside the entrance, we were seated at a booth right next to the open kitchen areas where the executive chef and sushi chefs did their magic.   The conveyer belts of sushi are split in the middle of each booth. It's really appetizing to see each belt filled up with actual sushi and no empty plates or huge gaps in between. On a cleanliness level, so far so good! Plus the concept of a sushi-go-round restaurant is always entertaining while grubbing on your favorite roll of sushi or nigiri. You are also able to place special orders (nigiri, special rolls, appetizers, side dishes, gourmet orders, desserts) via tablet, in which each dish speeds towards your table atop the conveyor belt like a Roomba but instead of cleaning, it serves you food!    Several servers would always stop by to take our trays and larger gourmet plates so that it wouldn't stack the table space. Our main server, Jeremy, was very attentive and provided us with outstanding hospitality. He definitely made sure that nothing was amiss and our glasses would always be filled. Since it was their first day and management is still working out the kinks, even when the conveyor belt system had an internet slowdown, Jeremy was able to make sure we had our orders readily by jotting them down specifically on a notepad until the system came back online.   To start with, the cocktails we ordered are: sapporo sour (matcha on light alcohol without so much of the bitterness), tokyo summer (definitely my fave as there is yuzu flavor and hints of citrusy elderflower in it), peach saketini (this is pretty strong in the alcohol department, i would go for this only if i'm ready to paint the town red), and lychee margarita (also somewhat strong, but it creeps up on you later on).  They have $2.50 TORO!! Super, duper fresh. Didn't even need much soy sauce to soak most of the nigiris and rolls in and they were plenty tasteful. I also do believe that they have salmon belly nigiri. It was juicy and satisfying with every bite, and strangely filling. I didn't have to over order this one at all.The sushi appetizer, orange salmon, is extremely similar to a local restaurant's sake orenji (but without the yuzu tobiko and thinly mini jalapeno slices) which is a huge plus in my book. It's also affordable so at any possibility, I would come by every week just for this dish as it's my favorite out of the rest! Fresh and juicy but not an overdose of yuzu! It was just right, especially with the portions to share among 4 people.   Gourmet dishes that we ordered but not limited to: ribeye (medium rare; juicy and of decent portion), pork belly (warm in cute cube form, also juicy), black cod (light and buttery soft), and shrimp (loved that they deshelled the center to make it easier for customers to eat - it means that the chefs put careful consideration on how they prepare their meals for us). I feel that each surprisingly nicely presented dish had an array of flavor however I would like to see a slight improvement on the black cod because it's so mushy.   Because their solid desserts weren't available at the time, we opted to try each of their ice cream flavors: vanilla, pineapple, pistachio, and green tea. The vanilla was surprisingly not lusterless or plain at all, very creamy in texture, and when you mix it with the pineapple its like eating dole whip! The pineapple honestly reminded me of a yuzu sorbet-- citrusy and I would love to order this in between sushi dishes to clean my palate. Pistachio was definitely nutty but did not overpower my tastebuds at all. Green tea didn't have a bitter aftertaste at all so it was easy to eat with every scoop.   Ultimately, I would definitely come back here again for their salmon belly nigiri, orange salmon, and the rest of their dessert selections when it becomes available!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

94su1t5vvw033HeDDlAKUA.text: Fresh. To. Death.   I've been eating sushi all my life, which unfortunately means that I'm picky as hell when it comes to my fish. I first experienced kaiten zushi, or conveyor belt sushi, when I was studying abroad in Japan ten years ago, and had always been a fan. I mean, it's really a millennial's dream - the instant gratification of grabbing food and immediately being able to eat it, the inexpensive price, and wide selection of choices.   My friends and I beat the dinner crowd by arriving around 5:45pm on a weekday, and boy were we glad. We were seated fairly quickly but when we left an hour or so later, the place was swarming for a weekday.   Top three rolls to try (all available on the conveyor belt):  1. Mexican Roll (spicy crab and shrimp, topped with avocado, sriracha, and a white/sweet sauce) 2. Popcorn Lobster Roll (deep fried lobster chunks on top of a California roll with yum yum sauce, eel sauce, and chipotle mayo) 3. Sexy Mama (spicy scallop and avocado roll topped with salmon)  Each plate is $2.50, and each person ended up spending around $30. There's a tablet at each table where you can order an item (if it's not available on the conveyor belt) and it's delivered to you either by a little train over the conveyor belt or by the waiter/waitress. I ordered a piece of uni that was priced at $2.50 for a single piece. I got a scoop of ice cream and they were all around $3 per serving. It's very comparable to AYCE joints, as others have pointed out, but I do feel like the experience is more fun/engaging than AYCE.   Bonus points for having a great ambiance (not too loud, tables weren't too crowded/close to each other) and great service. I can't wait to come back.

QdBrNiHn3ZFRRbou8LDuLg.text: High technology for restaurant.  Very cool concept, clean and wait isn't too bad.    Negatives- order from iPad and supposedly you can call server, but not once we pushed the button the server came.  Several Menu options including ramen and udon.  I would recommend going during happy hour where dishes are $1.50 vs $2.50 each.

O2OghQNt5DsCnoAkomM-qQ.text: Las Vegas finally has a revolving sushi spot of its own!  Granted the quality you get at any revolving spot is usually mediocre at best, but that's where Sapporo stands out from the rest. The quality for all the fish was excellent, extremely fresh, and priced decently at only 2.50 per white revolving plate.  Their ordering system works good as well and is very user friendly and easy to figure out; allowing you the options to order, remove orders, pictures, and even an info section that informs you of what is included in certain specialty rolls.  I'm not particularly a big sushi roll eater because most places seem to over sauce their concoctions but at Sapporo they figured out how to perfect the amount of sushi to yum yum/eel sauce ratio. Trust me on this one, nothing is worse than an overly sauced drowned out roll.  You can also order items from the kitchen that comes out via a plate on a track that comes presented to your table side. Items on this menu can range anywhere from 6-10+ dollars. My favorite from this section was the orange salmon. It's almost identical to a similar favorite dish of mine at another restaurant here in Vegas but cheaper ($7). It's citrusy, fresh, and spot on so good it'll make you wanna "slap yo mama."  The experience is both fun and entertaining to order and allows you to get just the right amount of food you want without over eating. The only dish I don't think I was over fond of was the baked cod and soft shell crab. The crab was a little salty while the presentation was beautifully done, and for the baked cod it came out in this sort of mushy texture which was sort of strange despite the flavor still being pretty good.  Aside from these minor details though, the over all experience was amazing and I would definitely come back to try their scallops, ramen, or just stop by for some fresh sushi.  Staff were both informative and polite upon the moment we entered to the second we left, and the owner (Freddy) was extremely kind to our party and generous to us. We definitely plan to come back again in the near future for some more!

CfJuN2NO83rzPIH9P2VQQQ.text: I've been here twice since they opened. After the first visit, it was already 5 stars. But I waited till after the second visit for the review :)  Freddy is very friendly and makes you so feel so welcome. Learned a lot from just talking to him both visits, like why Vegas hadn't had a revolving sushi yet and some info about their conveyor belts and how it all works. He gave us a nice little tour around the restaurant the first night to explain how everything works. Very passionate about this industry and all of his restaurants.   Food is delish, and even the single dessert that they had available. Can't wait for them to add more flavors for it, like strawberry. There was different looking toro first and second visit for me so one of the chefs explained how they're actually 2 different kinds of toro and so we will probably request that next time :)  Overall I love the vibe and the atmosphere. Everyone is super friendly and nice, and they are pretty attentive to your needs. I will be back many times over and look forward to their infinite amount of new ideas to be implemented.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy tuna roll with green tea roll cake
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon and Yellowtail tacos $2.50 each
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiger Roll (shrimp tempura inside with spicy tuna, avocado on top)

eozMDslozjVtfiXuOsv11Q.text: This is not an all you can eat sushi restaurant.   It's a pay by the plate place.   I'm actually more used to this concept as we have a lot where I'm from in Hawaii.   The quality of the sushi is pretty great.   REALLY fresh.   We actually thought it was the best tasting super white and spicy tuna we've had in quite some time.   They have an iPad at every table so you can place orders of items that don't pass you on the conveyor belt.   You can also hail your server through it as well.   Although this wasn't really necessary for us because the server and the bussers were always around and checking on us.   We weren't that hungry so all we just got a few rolls and nigiri but I'm actually quite excited to come back and try some of their hot items appetizers.   It's also super fun the get the items you ordered from the iPad as it comes in a little train thing.   So fun!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Conveyor  (a little empty because it&#39;s almost midnight)
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Train thingy above conveyor

QjHFw5_Wl5qkEERlw6BPCw.text: I try and give this location a chance, but every time I come I get fucked. Big lack of service, food is never fresh, if you complain they just argue with you, and they take forever to bring food out. They don't even come around to refill your water, and my table was asked to separate their own check. They were cleaning the ceilings and air vents while cooking the food... I felt that was very unsanitary, and they should be doing that when they have closed their kitchen. I just felt very uncomfortable here. The staff is either extremely friendly or extremely rude. I don't get an in-between. Never coming back, sad to say.

2oWmj-_e8nil3NlTVTwTrQ.text: Small amount of sushi options on the revolver. Half empty and completely empty and one point during out visit. The waitress was short and unsatisfactory. When it came to the check it took a very long time and they made us do the math ourselves to split the check. Overall it was not a good experience.

qFCGpiHi3UEWvRFnjaQ-Hg.text: Everyone loves revolving sushi, especially when that sushi is dirt cheap and has easy-to-understand pricing. Most revolving sushi bars I've been to have a way of identifying the pricing tiers of their plates, but Sapporo made it simple, and just reduces the quantity on the plates for more expensive rolls. It's a really well-designed experience.   And the sushi itself - so good! I do wish there were more vegetarian options, but you can't have everything you'd like everywhere you go. They even have ramen under $5 a bowl, and most of their apps and full rolls are very affordable too.   We came during the late night happy hour times where everything is just $1.75 each. There were 6 parties ahead of us but we didn't have to wait long once 11pm hit. They had already planned for the happy hour rush.

JkIdYiCrAkWup_D-ZwKRzg.text: I want to give it 10 STARS!!!  The sushi here is absolutely delicious, to not have to wait virtually at all, but have the option to order full plates on an iPad at the table is so fun and different, we were entertained and ate so well, I want to go back every trip to Vegas in the future!   We arrived and had a short wait for a table, but once we sat down we were grabbing rolls off the revolving belt and ordered edamame, goyza and a lobster roll from the menu, which came on the fun robot cart. We loved every single roll we tried, so I don't even have one to say was the best, try everything for $2.50 a plate. We skipped drinking aside from water, but they had a full bar for drinks.   I will never get sushi on the strip again, this was better, faster and more reasonably priced without a doubt!

fAlBsh3Blo7pwIPG3x2b2Q.text: I love me some revolving belt sushi. Have this place a try due to it having good reviews. But I must say, the portions of their nigiri sushi is pretty tiny. I mean it is only $2.50 but at least make it a bit bigger for portion wise.   And their options are pretty limited for the nigiri. But their rolls are pretty good. We got the caterpillar and rainbow roll. That cost like $7. It was pretty worth the price.   Their service was okay too.   Totally give this place a shot if you're around the area.

OqmU2iU1HsfnuWj0b3SoRA.text: New favorite sushi spot right here! Oh boy, I couldn't believe how busy this place could be at 9pm but it was worth every minute I had to wait.  The portions that are on the revolver are absolutely perfect in leu of any AYCE price. Each plate from the revolver was just 2.50 - we went so fast I didn't even take any pictures. And most of the plates have 3-4 pieces so you don't fill up on one roll so fast. I really enjoyed the variety of rolls on the revolver though. They had everything from inari, yellowtail and basic Cali and Philly rolls. Although we did order the for the halibut roll from the menu and ramen, we we're absolutely stuffed from 8 plates. I don't think I will ever be as happy at another sushi spot in town from now on.(Sorry Hiroba)

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oI7cxGQ_1aG1-TG-1FcErg.text: My go-to for Conveyor Belts Sushi in Vegas.  --  ... to me. Honestly - because I haven't been to any other Conveyor Belt Sushi locations in Vegas. I really like this location because it's a bit newer and the service is great. I haven't had any issues with our services the past couple visits.  The most recent visit, in particular, wasn't the best. For some reason, I thought they would have a wide variety of rolls to choose from, but they didn't. For the past couple times, we have been going to AYCE sushi, and they have SO MANY specialty rolls that I expected Sapporo would have the same thing! I guess it's been I minute since I've been here. The most special they got with their rolls here was what looked like torched Kraft American Cheese on a Salmon Nigiri. LOL  To put things into perspective, we pretty much had one of everything and it nearly came out the same as if you were to pay $30 a head for AYCE sushi.   I would come here again if they had eel sauce on their dragon rolls. (Yes, for some reason, they didn't the night we visited.)

NoXez-Jqqq_zj6D-xJfS9Q.text: 3.5-4 stars. This was my first experience with this type of sushi place and it was fun, but the sushi wasn't exceptional and earns 3 stars at best for me.  Pretty much all rolls with tempura were cold and the avocado would be out so long that it was starting to oxidize. Two specialty rolls kept going around and around with nobody touching them; might be time to get those off the "belt" and put out something different. I also wasn't a fan of how many of the rolls had cream cheese. The rolls I did sample were decent. The "sexy mama" was my favorite and the garlic tuna was an unexpected gem. The garlic edamame were the superstars! Slightly spicy, savory, and balanced but present garlic.   In all fairness, if I had ordered a full roll with hot elements, I'd hope it would come out nice and fresh, but I think that's more suited for larger groups. As a twosome, the sampling plates made more sense to try a variety of options. The experience is a lot of fun and it's definitely more my style than "traditional AYCE"; I would definitely go back and make a point to try a full roll (mainly because I want the futuristic tray server to come to my table!)

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi conveyer belt!
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AQN58kJ_tocd4IvM2GlX7A.text: I have been to Sapporo a couple of times and it is a good revolving sushi restaurant. I have been to revolving sushi places like this for quite some time but in other cities and countries, so when Sapporo opened in Vegas I was grateful.  Yes it is fun as different sushi and sashimi's go by and you can take what you want. One thing that I have liked about this concept is if you are hungry you can eat right away, just reach over and grab a plate. Also this is great if you just want a couple bite and do not want to order a full roll.  There are other items that you can order from a touch screen at your table. Some of the items come to you by a little trolley with flashing lights or the server comes and delivers it. Like the ramen or udon, you do not want that coming your way on the motorized trolley!  The prices are good too and are one price for the conveyer belt sushi. I have been to ones that are priced differently depending on the plate colors. You pretty much know what you are paying for!  This is a fun and nice option for sushi in Vegas and the prices are great for any budget!

Z2wjmvwd3HnuTe3b5VktTw.text: Awesome experience! The hand rolls are huge and the sashimi is great.   They charge by the plate plus whatever extras that you order using a tablet at the table, then a robot delivers the order

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4oqMx2aj4XDYBby2ZLpSbA.text: This sushi place is goOoOooOd (&cheap!). Came here right after it opened on a Tuesday and didn't really have any expectations since it is a revolving sushi place. The variety of sushi rolls, fish, soups, tempura & even desserts is way better than some places in CA and Hawaii! And the coolest high tech part about this place is that you order off of an iPad and your order comes out on an individual device-thing that travels above the normal conveyor belt and stops right where your booth is! In addition, there are also signs on the conveyor belt that lets you know what you're about to pick up which is really helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MIWV7FhUUW3jdDw7pWOhoQ.text: This place is unique itself. The first rotary sushi in Vegas!  When it first opened it was pretty popular, which I can say till this day, it still is. It's definitely not AYCE but the prices aren't that bad either. It's the concept that makes it.   It's a beautiful restaurant with wide booths that can't fit quite a large party. There's 2 rotary sides on each restaurant, that circle through the kitchen. And also they have a little train that delivers food to your table above the rotary, when you order from the iPad on the table.   They do have happy hour which is awesome, sushi included!   The sushi is fresh and since it was busy today I wasn't hesitant to grab what was on the rotary.   Service was good. I mean, it's technically self serve but they come by to refill your water and check on you.   For the first time today I tried their soft shell which was delicious! It had a squash paste sauce beneath it that just topped it off!  I also tried their I love yellowtail roll which was beautifully presented but tasted just as good!   Their desserts are good as well.   I definitely enjoy coming to this place without being rushed on an AYCE type of deal and where I can actually breathe after eating a good amount of sushi!

S_k-qlapHH8EOsp87YvICQ.text: Basically, they have a lot of salmon options in terms of sushi. My favorite one was probably the sexy mama. The sushi seemed pretty fresh and new with every rotation so that was nice. They also had other options other than sushi, like hot noodles or rice bowls to order if you're there for company but don't like sushi!   I enjoyed the experience here. If you're looking for a revolving sushi place to try out I definitely recommend it!  The servers were really friendly and helpful.

Mq1yJFa8qiMEy9xOiD_RFA.text: I absolutely loved this place. The sushi was simple and fresh it reminded me of sushi in Japan. We are not from Vegas but we came for trade show and stop by this place one day and had 2 come back again two days later.   We really enjoyed it and besides that how cool is that a robot brings you the other sushi you order.   We had a couple different sushi, we even tried their ramen which the broth taste really good but the pork was a tiny piece but for the price I guess the taste was worth it.   It's a must try when you are in Vegas it's of the strip but worth the drive.

oyFyHTU8uMd4-YmaXbRjbg.text: This might actually be my favorite cheap sushi spot in Vegas. It's not AYCE so be prepared for that when you get in. It's decently priced though. It's $2.50 a plate off the conveyor belt and they have an iPad system that allows you to order anything off the belt, and each is priced accordingly.  I ordered the black garlic ramen, shishito peppers, garlic tuna, king salmon, unagi nigiri and tuna tacos.  I loved the shishito peppers! I don't know what kind of sauce they put on these grilled peppers, but the sauce they drizzle on top paired with the bonito flakes complements the dish completely. The nigiri had a great fish to rice ratio. Nice balance of rice and fish, and the fish was cold and thickly sliced, but not overwhelming. Now for the ramen, not the best tonkotsu broth, but it was still very good for a sushi restaurant and I would definitely order it again. The tuna tacos were pretty good too. I just wish that I wasn't too full to be able to eat the other salmon and yellowtail tacos too! But I shall save that for my next visit.  Don't be afraid of the sushi Roomba and give this place a try and take a step in the conveyor belt sushi culture!

hX4MgfdNp9U-gO6QMRncCg.text: Cool concept! A good way to try a lot of different sushi at only $2 a plate.    The plates move along a conveyor belt and you just choose the ones you want!  Each plate has 2 pieces of nigiri or 3 pieces of a cut roll.  Another cool feature is the tablet menu at each table. This is where you can order a variety of cooked food like appetizers, ramen, dessert, and other sushi not on the conveyor belt.  I loved the black garlic ramen. Full of flavor. Smaller than a regular bowl of ramen, but good sized and only about $4ish.  Appetizers were good, we tried shishito peppers, jalapeno bomb, tuna tacos, salmon tacos.  Did not have dessert this time, but menu did look appetizing for matcha and yuzu desserts!

zWIBC2nGiO_V5tIDqc8SUg.text: This is SUCH a fun place for sushi! All the booths are accessible to the rotating sushi bar so there isn't any stress getting a good table. You can order from an iPad at the table for specialty rolls that arrive to your table by little trolley car! SUPER clean space and bathroom. The only issue we had was we had to constantly flag down a server over and over again for drink, sauces and wasabi. We will definitely come back here with family for a good time!

o2deMMLgBYENU0LwGEwT3Q.text: This place always has a 15 minute wait but it's totally worth it! My boyfriend and I went twice this summer. It's super fast, which is what we needed. A fast bite before going out for the night. The fish is fresh and you can even order al a cart. I wish Miami had something similar.

POfm3zJ2AYB85jxwcfJqEw.text: Very nice place to have a date night, came here with my boyfriend around 9pm on a Sunday night. Wait wasn't so long, was sat down in about 3 mins. The whole experience reminded me of japan except better! More spacious, and cheaper! Japan was amazing but the quality here was pretty good as the one in Japan. There are revolving sushi and you also have a choice to order from the computer menu which will come out to you above all the revolving sushi it's pretty cool! I recommend it even just going for experience. Nigiri was delicious! I believe there is an option for all you can eat but we didn't choose that! Would definitely come back!  Ordered two rolls from the computer, spider roll (delicious) and I forgot the other roll! But I love the halibut  nigiri and Japanese mackerel nigiri! (Writing this makes me crave it!)

98x1Qc4PHnABmGMdZCKDDg.text: Came here after we deliberated which sushi restaurant we wanted to eat at tonight.  We were glad and super happy with the restaurant.  All plates on the conveyor belt was $2.50  and anything we ordered from the table monitor got to us quickly using a robotic waiter.    We tried over 30+ plates and I had the udon noodle soup to top it off.  Glad I did.    Highly recommended and will be back. This was a great experience for all of us and there are plenty of other plates I still want to try.  Good job Sapporo!

LiUwAVhQGIRJgGAj7p-QUw.text: I enjoyed the food, the place and the automated system!! You pay per plate and you choose what to eat. I would come back any time with no doubt! The happy hour seems promising to me, prize and food at 10 pm!

aJM-20VF924D4Aszl4tNbQ.text: I love this place! Very nice and convenient if you like to try a bunch of different sushi without spending a ton! Very affordable if you eat off of the conveyer belt and also their black garlic ramen is amazing!!

jLWCpjoLlnrAOUH3S9OcRQ.text: This place blew my expectations out of the water. I'm from Seattle where the sushi is always fresh and I had low expectations. This place was AMAZING. I wish they had one back home... The food was super fresh and the prices were reasonable. I have no complaints. The service was good too. Nothing extraordinary but they we attentive and polite which is all I ask for. My favorite was the firecracker jumbo shrimp (I think that's what it was called). Definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simply amazing!

chg9DW68yyoqF4BcsoggWg.text: What a great restaurant. Quality food and highly recommended.   Ask for the happy hour menu! You will not regret!

UGTx1jV9xwt8yz9l1Ms5nw.text: It's been open only  for 10 days, so I give them a break for IPad on the table is not really working and we had to order to Chris, who was wonderful!  1st in Las Vegas, first, I want congratulate this revolving Sushi Restaurant to make it real. We, foodie have been waiting for you!!!  Neta=raw fish pieces were fresh, relatively small which I like along with small portion of rice, because I can eat various kind at one meal. They have toro=fatty tuna, uni=sea urchin, salmon roe=ikura and mackerel=Saba. They are my favorites and I usually judge if they are good, they are good Restaurant and I will come back again.  I had black garlic ramen at the end which was surprisingly good. Portion was 1/2size of regular ramen. It was perfect size as Shime=closing of meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

weQwQRw3IK_NtJ30IuNzyA.text: I came here for the first time on a Thursday night with my boyfriend. We usually go to AYCE sushi spots but I've heard of some hype on this spot from friends so I decided to give it a try. We got sat immediately (it was not busy at and was greeted right away by a female server. She asked us what we wanted to drink and failed to ask if we were first timers..there were no explanation on how this revolving sushi/ conveyor works, or how the iPad screen worked, etc. I understand that "resolving sushi" is self explanatory..it's like the old school sushi boats. However, it would've been nice to know that you can order different items on the iPad at the table..OR if there were any off menu specials..OR that happy hour is at 10pm(literally we had no idea they have a HH--not that we cared).. but sadly no info was provided until we asked our server. She apologized and briefly explained that each plate was $2.50 and that if we ordered from the iPad, the food will from the kitchen.  We started grabbing sushi off the belt and got a few of our usual favorite nigiri: salmon belly, hamachi, trout, & super white tuna. Everything seemed to be good until i got to the hamachi. The hamachi nigiri was warm and extremely fishy smelling and tasting. I set the plate aside and washed the taste out with my drink and continued eating the other fish. After not seeing anything we wanted on the conveyor belt, we decided to order some things from the iPad. We ordered the pork belly, ramen, uni, and black tobiko nigiri. When our server came around to clean the table behind us, i told her about the foul hamachi that i experienced. She apologized and removed it from our table.   The pork belly the arrived next. My boyfriend tried a piece and said it was alright..not quite tender but it was flavorful. As i reach for a piece, i noticed a strand of hair short curly on the plate. I immediately asked for our server and told her about the strand of hair. She apologized and took the dish away, never to return again (literally never came back to check on us, a guy later stopped by to check on us and gave us our check.) the Ramen was plain and basic.. broth was below average. The uni was sad, there was literally one baby piece on the rice. I was happy to pay for it at regular/market price so I'm not sure if they did that for HH. The black tobiko was all very pathetic.. with just enough eggs to cover the rice.. it's kind of funny now that i picture how it looked when it came out.   The cherry on top of my experience at this restaurant is that not a single person/manager besides the female server (that disappeared later on) came by to apologize about the fishy hamachi or the questionable thick curly hair on the pork belly or offer a brand new dish.. instead they just took the items off our tab and called it a day. I think the best word to describe everything about this restaurant is disappointing. The hype was non existent. The service was disappointing. The food was mediocre. I would not recommend this place to anyone... there are plenty of sushi places, AYCE and al la cattle spots that will have better service and quality than this place. Save yourself from disappointment!

iUzdHvNMNldatgLxf5TW5w.text: Went here this past Friday night. Had a little bit of a wait but the sushi was great. Would've gave it five stars if they had one particular role that my wife really likes. But besides that we had a great time

MhBUQ5vtzC5PYvgb2o5s4w.text: First time being here and very clean and good vide! love my drink! ask for Chris he will make sure your drink is good!

QZe9Bd8Cubl72k49Gnzajg.text: Food was good. My kids loved the conveyor belt food arrival. Service was good and fast.  I do prefer the AYCE places over this. It does get a bit pricey as items are ala cart.

l1J-0W-l3fm_87Edw0URcA.text: Finally conveyor belt sushi in Vegas. It was a very clean and organized establishment. The servers were on point with refills. However the sushi selection was small,  but it was cheap $2.50 all items on belt.

m6zZaKgcHtEfAEwUbymfAg.text: This place was amazing! Maria was on it the whole time. Sushi was fresh. The tablet ordering system and the robotic delivery platform? Fuggetaboutit! The $2.50 conveyer? Sweet! We will be back!!!

V4QjTIfPAfcT9VFTusn-8Q.text: Something about the temperature of the revolving sushi it felt like it had been sitting for hours but it was ok

_PaOpPMXlP1_b21qb38SdA.text: Favorite sushi restaurant. Highly recommend black cod, deeply fried soft shell crab, green tea cake. Miso ramen noodle is also good, not too sweet

5A260SFteY-HXRtVaDnSaQ.text: Saporro Revolving Sushi is awesome! One of my fav places. The staff is quick and service is on point. Their sushi and rolls are good.  My fav is smoked salmon nigiri and of course for dessert the strawberry shortcake!!!! YUM!! What I love about SRS is that you can see and "pre-taste" what's on menu before ordering. Be careful because the plates off the conveyor belt although only $2.50 can easily add up... but then again HAPPY HOUR is the best time to go!

V-8gFIjpfquQtvQZI9o5tA.text: Staff is extremely friendly, fast, and attentive. The conveyer belt sushi is the best I've had. The other menu items that I have tried have not disappointed. If you like sushi and you like a fun environment this place is just for you.

StvbYvrs4ynLtrtpnwSfxg.text: We arrived with a party of 10. Spent less than $200. Decent sushi and nice atmosphere. Definitely a place to revisit.

2BFB2n1zN9TzgCvIKqL1zQ.text: This place is amazing! Bf and I went here for happy hour and had tons of sushi off the revolving bar, which was all tasty! They also let you order off of the menu and a robot brings you your food from the kitchen!   Definitely come during happy hour - all sushi is 1.50 on the revolving bar!

pLSOpvWF-0nSThvisFjdeQ.text: Interesting place as this is one of the first kaiten sushi restaurant in Vegas.  Electronic ordering is very efficient and fun. Food however is very average. Fish was ok, tako was chewy, salmon was fishy, ikura was the smallest nigiri sushi I have ever seen. I think the concept is fun, reminds me of Japan, but the quality is below average. Wouldnt recommend it if you are loking for good interesting food.

7XiUBIOoUEtglkJ8akZpXg.text: Amazing sushi, delicious variety of Japanese food! The uni,  and the new Zealand salmon are my favorites! ALL THE SERVERS ARE WONDERFUL HERE! My water glass was never empty! Will be back again and again!

MPkN5xe9cdn7ocBK2zBkJw.text: Food was amazing and staff was attentive! Great place for a date night. I will definitely be back to try some more rolls. I love their unique options and can't wait to come back!

quy9Cbe_8_HNghe7acf1jg.text: As close as we have come to our sushi-go-round in Portland, OR! Lots of fun and the best way to get variety and selection.

jG_yECcHvJU46fw3GRwLiA.text: What a fun place!! It ends up being a little more pricier than AYCE but offers more specialty fish not usually offered at other restaurants. It is definitely a fun experience and environment, great for kids and for people to be able to try a variety of things without committing to an entire roll/dish.

IuTfK3oJempF2nEApzjziw.text: one of the best revolving sushi restaurants. they have a full menu if you decided to go outside the belt. items looks decent priced, so can go higher but thats if you choose. all conveniently on the ipad at your table. if you do order from the menu, dishes will be delivered to you by a little divery tray on top of the belt right at your table as well. the $2.5 each plates on the belt were a great deal. the two of us for a midnight snack ended up having 10 plates for around 30 bucks included taxes. we had yellow tail, stripped bass, white tuna, tuna, scallop, and various rolls. they were all very good, the white tuna stood out fresh and nicely milky. as a revolving sushi restaurant, the fish cut had very good presentation and generous portions, taste is fresh altho some maybe on the drier side. over all very good quality!

3brmfbjsnFWv9hh7GCeb5Q.text: Unimpressed with literally everything I tried. My oyster wasn't cold, and neither was my sushi from the belt (surprise) my hot saki was the only thing I enjoyed. My server on the other hand was friendly. I won't go back.

0XIF0_vzHspkIK1jjgOr2g.text: The food was fresh and delicious. Service was very good and people were professional. Also the place looked very nice and clean. Robot was serving our food over the conveyor belt, it was a big fun to eat there.

eCdZHMIinNyhH-yJgmwLQA.text: We took our 9-year -old to lunch to celebrate school being out for the summer. Very busy at 12:30 on a Thursday, so had to wait a few minutes to be seated. Joshua greeted us warmly and told us it was only his 4th day, but we were impressed with his attentiveness and knowledge. He quickly walked us through the use of the tablet to order items not on the conveyor belt. My son enjoyed the visits from the robot server, above the regular conveyor, which brought special order items to your table we had garlic edamame, black garlic ramen (yumm!) and the larger Sexy Girl roll from the tablet menu.  From the conveyor at $2.50 each, we also enjoyed the small (2-4 pcs) Sushi and Nigiri such as Shrimp and Tuna Tacos, Popcorn Lobster roll, Spicy Tuna Roll and a few more, along with a saketini (with a light up ice cube) and a mango cream soda for my son. The only item which was not a hit was the squid, which was very, very rubbery. They also offer tempura and a few other non-sushi items like potstickers. 3 of us left, full and very happy for $54.  I would recommend this spot as a fun and novel dining experience, and a way to try smaller portions of sushi items you are not sure if you will like--after all, if you don't like the small portions, you are only out $2.50.

HMzNnkWkplyuIndKE7yjyQ.text: So glad they finally have this in Vegas! I tend to get full off of sushi fast so I love the fact that you can control the portion and not feel like I'm wasting the food. Customer service was great! They have a lot of workers there that are attentive. The restaurant is very clean and modern. I will definitely come back often and recommend to friends and family.

5UkcOznll9ZtENPeRZs3LQ.text: Out of this world good.  Fresh and crazy good quality.  Can't wait to go back!  Service was top notch.  Happy hour for sushi 1.50 a plate Sunday-Thursday after 10:00.  Unreal!  Got a pint draft for $2 too.  Make sure you grab a pepper tuna as it comes by.

6scaIdqcTAigAVKpCE6NiQ.text: Awesome atmosphere, even better vibes!!! We will now be making this our number one sushi spot!!!

442--hTTwIKcR6qJKWkMoQ.text: Perfect for date night. Friendly staff, very helpful. Atmosphere was welcoming and professional.

d_Hsk9WWG0YCFZi7uqhNBQ.text: This place is pretty neat. I haven't been to a revolving sushi restaurant outside of NYC, and this place can definitely stand up to some of the places there. The rotation isn't overwhelming with a large amount of food that may end up just sitting there for longer than one would want sushi to sit out for. Plus everything was fresh and tasty. You are able to order a la carte items as well as choosing from the great rotating dishes. The service is also great! In fact, I somehow got a splinter on my finger (maybe from trying to eat too fast and pressing down too hard on chopsticks), and the female manager must have noticed I was fusing with my finger and brought over these long tweezers to get the splinter out. Luckily I had already pulled the splinter out and saved myself any further embarrassment. This is a cool newer spot, check it out!

7oSChGAxXgBXkzp-h5_6_A.text: Came here with a large group and was warmly greeted by the host. The service was amazing - friendly staff that would frequent the table to refill our drinks and make space for the endless number of plates that would pile on the table. The food was delicious! Everything I had was tasty and fresh, I especially enjoyed the black garlic ramen, oysters, deep fried soft shell crab, and salmon and toro nigiri. Considering the plates are ~$2 each, this is a DEAL compared to what you'd find along the Strip. If you're looking for a place where you can indulge without breaking your wallet, this is where you want to be. Will definitely be back on my next trip!

ldHoyHZ2Cnsz-6Ejvc2ziA.text: Sapporo is AMAZING! Been here many times already, and each time is such an experience. Sushi is completely on point, always extremely fresh and COLD. Love ordering from the IPad and getting food delivered by the little robot above the belt. Service is always prompt and courteous. This visit, we actually had stopped by the 'other' conveyor sushi place in town and was so disappointed by the experience there we had to come to Sapporo to 'cleanse our palates' and get that other place out of our minds as soon as possible! If you're looking to try conveyor belt sushi, stop by the original - Sapporo! Looking forward to many more visits and more awesome sushi!

KEY0H-aTTOLESrCrh6wZhQ.text: service is really good!! manager on floor was the nicest guy ever, even if we were seated 15 minutes before closing. he was really attentive and helpful. sushi was also good.

FFFdQR71Wkd8PVTQpRmhYw.text: This was our first time at Sapporo and it was amazing! Everything was so fresh. Jessica was very attentive and answered all of our questions. The inside is tastefully decorated. It was an amazing experience and we will definitely be coming back, and I am letting all my friends know about Sapporo. Thank you Jessica!

eINl37Quh7ZWWyI9pjGWog.text: Can't wait to try it! One of the things I miss most about my time in Japan. Only thing missing is the video game plate disposal method. You drop your plates into a slot and there's and you earn points to win a prize! The more you play the better the prize! LOL! I love Japan.

M-DW2fTPmDtSJuN-bejOSg.text: Unfortunately I'm going to give this place 3 stars. The rating isn't because of the quality of the sushi. But more toward the management. My friend and I decided to go during their happy hour which means plates are $1.50 instead of $2.50. There was lack of communication with informing us about happy hour or how it works. We were seated at the happy hour time, so obviously we assumed that we could start eating. Through our 5th plate, we were told that those 5 plates will still be charged as $2.50. Noone told us that we had to WAIT to get a "happy hour plate?" They kept telling us how they just started doing happy hour so its a new thing, then they should of at least explained it to us better and even been more lenient if they wanted to keep customers coming back. Also note that its not all plates that are $1.50, I had ordered uni and toro on the ipad and it was still charged $2.50. I came to happy hour hoping to not spend a lot of money. My bill turned out to be the same price as if you went to AYCE somewhere else. Quite disappointed with what happened :/

sv9r5cePJAlPRJeCAjJeww.text: Love this place! Quality of sushi are better than a lot of other sushi restaurants I've been to.  Hubby and I drive across town just to eat here.  Our server was great! I think her name is Tiffany, she's been our server  3/4 times we've been there and she is just amazing.  My first time here we waited more than 45 mins for an iPad order which put me off, but she quickly turned it around by apologizing and ensuring the order got cancelled. If it wasn't for her, I probably wouldn't have came back ever. Now its one of my fave places to go.

Uu7qmHqzB-5NaMJkP3QaQg.text: My husband and I love this place!! Please open one in the southwest!! We come here as often as we can! Only thing missing is Mochi ice cream for dessert.

lw-D7O-3yOfjdC-FPuM0Og.text: The Sushi is awesome. Service is fast. Lots of choices. TNT roll is bomb. The dragon is good.

TkY2FZ1fluuYmT9Tn4uu1A.text: My favorites are the Uni and tonkatsu ramen! Delicious! The service is always exceptional and I bring all of my friends from out of town!  Perfect for family dinner or a night out with your friends!

VB6hHtr8OTviEFy1G9yegA.text: Hungry after work, but your go-to sushi spot got too popular with hoards of happy hour crowd? Fear that wait time no more and consider Sapporo Revolving Sushi instead. You might have to navigate the side streets of China Town to avoid rush hour traffic, but you will be happy once you make it here. Parking can be tricky as spots are assigned and not many are available right in front of the restaurant. However, Sapporo staff told me I could park anywhere, even in spots marked for patrons of other businesses. Once inside, you are promptly seated at the table by the sushi-belt. Snatch a plate or two or ten or order a-la carte if your heart desires. iPads with menu options - and "Request Water" tab - are at your finger tips at the head of each table. I just love the idea of getting a little bit of everything personally, so I watched the belt, read the upcoming sushi plaques and snatched a plate and three and twelve of them!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sexy Girl coming down the line ...
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Because Inari. What is Inary?

V-xDoJoE9sB2WylUfAhcFA.text: To start, I don't feel like I can say enough about this place! Such a cool atmosphere! Very classy restaurant! The staff went above and beyond! They were so friendly! Food was very reasonable especially considering the experience you get! Spent less than what we typically spend on sushi. You get to choose from a ton of different options that rotate on a conveyer belt. Then if you want anything else a robot brings out what you want for the kitchen! Will definitely be returning again and again! Thank you Sapporo for making dinner such an enjoyable experience!

XXkoduLco33Geyeq56pXCA.text: Sushi excellent, but $2.50 plate is not. If they would do all you can eat for $22 lunch and $27 dinner I might come back. Instead Sushi Koma, Makino, Goya Sushi, Sushi 21 is more reasonable

4XuWHilts4ictv597XbEtg.text: Unbelievable quality, reasonable prices...a new must go to spot. $2.50 Toro, great fresh rolls

pqKoTpf-mxQ4G5dxpgExNQ.text: This place is so good. Some of the best sushi ive had in a while.  Our waitress was super nice, and gave us great service. The place was clean and organized. I will tell others about this place

D1sXvX40_7iKYckPo_Alng.text: Yes. yes. Yes. Been searching for conveyor sushi since moving here from West Los Angeles. Great quality and friendly and attentive wait staff! We'll be back!

OTqdk_4lQsVblPvlONTD-g.text: Food was good and fresh. My kids loved the conveyer belt delivery. Service was great and everyone was nice. I loved the softshell crab.  We'll be back.

k3ZpmsG7plQ_tDyTfvQauw.text: Some of the best revolving sushi I have experienced. The reviews on here saying it's not as good as what you'd get in Japan are totally right. But this is Vegas not Japan, and that's ok. For what it is: inexpensive, large variety, no waiting to order and get your food, plus made to order sushi, and solid bar offerings... Sapporo checks all the boxes. Fish was all fresh and god quality. Fun unique rolls and options available with soups and other hot items to boot. Service was attentive without being overbearing. I will agree it gets busy and the parking is not ample enough for the demand. But all of that said this is my new go to spot for sushi in Vegas. It's satisfying and doesn't break the bank. Can't wait to go back!

3vwB4nCQSl5mMMlYGFpNkw.text: Great quality, great flavor, great price and a different way to dine. Well done on all fronts

rTJpfrn8qCMSXvh0gFudEw.text: Came with friends and it was fantastic. Very fresh, lots of variety and very reasonable prices. The restaurant is new and clean and trendy and we would come back in a heart beat. We loved the popcorn lobster roll.

lIYvy0ND4D4DCu3RVJXKpQ.text: Great place to just come and try different kinds of sushi. Loved the environment and the conveyer belt. Service was great and definitely would come again. The reason I wouldn't give 5 stars is because it wasn't AMAZING sushi but it was definitely good. We mainly ate from the conveyer belt and the sushi didn't taste completely fresh for obvious reasons.

3N7Iyd_Vslenp6-z5c_rug.text: 2.5 star to be accurate. Upon walking in, you'd think that the restaurant is very good with high end or contemporary decor and customers in the booths. However, there really aren't that many food options to choose from and the quality of the seafood isn't all that top notch. Compare Sapporo Revolving Sushi to Sushi Kaya, Kaya has way more food options to choose from such as: beef bowl, squid, skewers, etc. It's definitely not the worst, there's definitely room for improvement, but Sapporo Revolving Sushi is more for the younger generation.

z-7LziqNfBahKKNyBSw8sg.text: This was the cleanest, best tasting revolving sushi I have ever ate. The owner was very involved, and made sure we were completely satisfied. Will definitely be back!

VnIssclxBIgdYTrIaJfzXw.text: I went in when dinner time just started. The place filled up pretty quick that is a good sign for restaurant. Service is really nice and professional. It is so fancy and nice for local to have conveyor belt sushi place in town. But at the first bite of mine was just okay. Fish not fresh and tasteless. maybe just because that plate I took it sitting in the belt for awhile but shouldn't be, because dinner time just start.  I think then I should try something that order from the menu. I order orange salmon since I saw so many reviews talked about it. It's still just okay for me. Then my husband and I just decided to leave after we tried so many dishes but we are not satisfied at all. And with the bill came out around 50$ which we should be full but NO. We are still hungry. Come on guys! For this price you could do it better. Am I cheap here? This is Las Vegas so many AYCE to go and compare to other my experienced in Japan and San Diego. This place just OK. I gave stars for service.

Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Mg9c8Sl42lA088O90RbMzg.text: I've been to other conveyor belt sushi places in other states and countries.  They were really popular 15-20 years ago but this place has the added attraction of the little train which delivers items ordered from the menu.  Aside from the moving parts, the sushi is quite good.  We had toro, lobster roll, caterpillar roll, regular tuna, hamachi, clams, shrimp tacos, etc.  All were well made and fresh, both conveyor belt and made to order were well done.  Each revolving sushi item was $2.50 and made to order items ranged in price from $5 on up.

HDr6vNj5FHnVaae_rU1-iA.text: Cool concept moderately priced the sushi was ok loved the conveyor belt bringing our food found out the best seat was near the kitchen so you had first choice on the freshest selections. Wait staff was nice and helpful. Unique experience would come back just for the atmosphere and experience.

dcToSEiCinA8rbxSbsoz2w.text: This place is fun! It's pricey but definitely one of those you got to do it once kind of deals! Love the little robot trolley that zips out to bring you specific orders!

JRWbArNdVtAcxoCvaAlUbw.text: So Good! Our server Jeremy was so great! He was super sweet to my friend and i and made my first time there awesome! I didn't get the names of some people who worked there but all of the staff there is super sweet! We will 100% be back! Thank you guys again!

rnMdrvp8VrTdqrrLFViXuA.text: I'm going to give them a 4.5 (rounding up to 5) now.  The main reason is that they no longer have that 2 hour dead time between lunch and supper in which they're closed.  That caused a lot of problems as the evening rush started at 5:00.  Now those who want a late lunch or early supper can enjoy themselves and their meal.  And the last time I was there the robot delivered two of my orders.

Hpioji3X4E_A2pcMS8Xepw.text: First of all this place was fairly busy, average wait around peak dinner time was about 30 mins. Every table is on the line and able to grab things from the belt at any time. Each plate on the line is $2.50, which can add up quickly. Service was ok but not great.  The rolls come in 3, but you can try them before you decide to get a full roll. Not everything is on the revolving track but a lot of decent options. As for the food the best thing we had by far was the deep fried soft shell crab. All the rolls were pretty standard for a sushi place, definitely had better in other spots. Sexy girl, tiger roll, bonzai.  Some of the misses were the garlic edamame and miso soup which was too salty. Gyoza didn't have a a sauce.The popcorn lobster on the belt ended up being a little cold so be careful when getting hot dishes from the revolver.   They also DO NOT have fresh wasabi! Very surprised. If you've had fresh before you would never want the paste.   Overall the place was a very fun and unique dining experience. Unfortunately the food didn't back up its modern style. Don't think it's a repeat next time the sushi craving comes back around.  3.5 stars but I'll round up for the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Put in your own order, full menu
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried soft shell crab, most popular and delicious

i0oYJwSSiR0jIg738DdywQ.text: Everything is good, food, environment, except the oysters are not fresh. Not giving 5 stars bcz for toilet! Omg, there's toilet paper on the floor and dust on the sink. The dining area is so clean, can the toilet be cleaner? And the service so slow! I push the ring about 5mins they still not coming.   ,, ,,

_fiUsXSNbLbgRA-KLPjddg.text: Like Kura in the OC but less expensive and cooler decor. Happy Hour and After 10 special pricing make it unbeatable in Vegas. Open late too. My go to quick but good Vegas sushi spot. Even the Uni, Unagi, and Yellowtail Carpaccio with Ponzu sauce and jalapeno good.

AtM9zdkgHiDY57wDZyOjIQ.text: I have been to other revolving sushi restaurants in the past, but I found the custom order train separate from the conveyor belt a very amusing novelty. The restaurant has dark stone floors/tables giving off a very high-end vibe.  Service is attentive, though much can be done electronically via the tablet at your table.   Prices are reasonable, but if you order a lot, it is easy to quickly rack up a bill. The sushi itself was of decent quality, and some of the small dishes offered are fairly unique and fusion-y.  Definitely a fun place to bring friends!

jTl1zhv9f9ilzGcj2Vu64w.text: There are so many things I could tell you about this place but the most important one would be; Go, Go now, Go often.   The food is fresh and delicious. The revolving conveyor belt is a great concept and fun.   The service is top notch!   I love this place and will not eat sushi in the valley from anywhere else.
