3xtis0rCGK4bbt6DjrNNgg.text: This place is awesome.  I was hesitant at first, because I wasn't feeling sushi, but I'm glad I came.  I was thinking the sushi would be old from revolving around with no one to pick it up, but it was as fresh as I could hope for.  Everything was amazing.  From the food off the conveyor belt, to the food from the robots, and to the food the humans brought.  The scallops and aka ebi were my favorite main entree items.  And the salmon and blue fin tuna were my favorite from the belt.  My lady liked the clams and garlic tuna sushi.  The lady who, I think owned the place, was so surprised at how much I ate, she offered me free ice cream. That's love.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Your menu kinda revolves around you

SoNuuG6iIbGl7DgV-In_vA.text: I finally got to experience revolving sushi thanks to my wonderful clients! The concept is fun and the novelty masks any shortcomings a normal sushi bar would never get away with like dry fish or cold tempura. Conveyor belt offerings are usual sushi menu items like garlic tuna, dragon roll, yellow tail and all items are $2.50 each plate. They count your plates to determine your bill. You can also order items directly from the kitchen via your table tablet and have it sent out by a sushi roomba that plays an old cell phone ringer tune. There is an option to call for help in case you might need something like your water glass refilled--but that feature was broken since no one/roomba ever came. Honestly, I felt like I was eating pre-made sushi from the deli section of the market. You don't really know how many trips around the items have made (kind of like lost luggage at the airport carousel). The novelty of an automated restaurant is intriguing but I'd still prefer having sushi prepared fresh as I order. It's worth checking out just to say you've tried it.

q8s4aNVsibxflgWzbO4F_Q.text: First time ever eating at a revolving sushi place! I have traveled all over the United States and this is by far the freshest sushi I've ever had! I love the Cajun Albacore! I've brought friends from out of town here twice and they love it! Their happy hour sushi deal is amazing but that won't stop me from coming in during non happy hour times! Non happy hour is still VERY reasonably priced!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Tacos- so delicious and unique concept!
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus appetizer

jttZcMPsVMLauFDvBgvdDA.text: 4 stars for the experience, really. Here it is, if you are looking to get full on a budget, perhaps you got a big stomache...don't come here! Bring your money to an AYCE. You aren't going to get fancy shmancy rolls jizzed with 3 different type of sauces and a partidge in a pear tree. You aren't going to get a novel of a menu either. Walk....out...now.  If going to an AYCE isn't worthed because you don't got that big of a stomach, but you pay the AYCE price anyway because it makes more sense to or you're not really maximizing your money at an AYCE...then walk...in...now.  I love the layout, the spaciousness, and that there are 3 different conveyor belts for each area of seating. The revolving sushi I've been accustomed to...literally revolves. You'd have to pray no one takes the plates that have been put out...which means you're better off just ordering the dang thing. Their system here with different belts running, perfect. They have a sensor so that if the plate has been revolving around for 30 mins, it gets pulled off ensuring we get the freshest quality.   At 2.50 per plate...it was pretty worthed. Think of it as happy hour pricing if you need a brain-psych. The hubs and I have kinda been off the AYCE train for a bit as we prefer to just ala carte when we  have sushi. This place is perfect for us! My favorite is their garlic tuna nigiri! My hubs has pretty much had all the nigiris they have to offer, and he said they all tasted as fresh as this desert can offer, no chewy pieces, and nothing flooded in sauce! They also offer oysters, however, at 2.50...tis only plated with 1 oyster. Eek.  There are other things available through their iPad ordering system where you will find items that are NOT 2.50. Through this, I have ordered their spicy tuna and salmon skin rolls, veggie tempura, and ramen. I purposely ordered the spicy tuna and salmon skin on each visit to gauge it properly, and both times I thought it needed work.   For one, my salmon skin was soggy each time. Ugh. I was literally playing tug of war when biting into it that it kinda pulled my handroll open and when I looked in it...it was pretty skimpy. They do that illusion trick where they stick the salmon skin out of the wrapmaking you think it's pretty filled when really...whatever peeking out is literally it. My spicy tuna, while spicy...was bland. Most likely will never order those handrolls again. I'm sure they fry it in advance to be efficient...but in that situation, I don't mind a wait. Though I can't speak for the thousands of other people who do.   My vegetable tempura was visibly oily as the plating told me so. I ate it anyway chasing it down over hot green tea. Lol. Despite the plate showing evidence of it not draining long enough...thankfully, my tempura was not soggy and even more thankfully they didn't plate me with vegetables I wanted to throw under the table. Hi mom! I also had the black garlic ramen offered, and sadly...that was bland. Edible...but bland. But I'm here for nigiris! The quality of my nigiris did not fail.  One thing I highly suggest, they should consider giving a menu to large groups. It could just be a laminated menu for people that have noooo way of getting to the iPad to conveniently browse through as the tablet is fixed at the end of the table closest to the belt. With that said, if it's your first time in and you're rolling in deep...you're shorting yourself of the full experience so I suggest coming back with just another person or 2. When you're at the end of the table, you have to make your other friend at the belt go fishing for you. Boring. I'd like to sit where I can scroll through the menu and nab my own plate of choice daghang salamat (thank you very much)  Service has never been neglectful, always attentive without being overly about it, and it was my birthday the last visit....and got my waiter and the manager to sing to me over ice cream! I thought that was fantastic as I knew the waiter was not so willing which I'm sure was out of embarrassment...but after some encouragement from his manager and me asking where's my song...he did!!! Which sounds very diva of me...but if you know my humor and all the little things that led up to that moment...You'd get it. Loosen up a bit will yah. Lol. I really really appreciated It! That was awesome of them. Made my night.  Perfect place to go when you wanna quickly grab some nigiri/sushi. If money isn't on the mind, by all means. I've been waiting for  revolving sushi since I've moved here (2004). While I certainly have had better...Sapporo is definitely a winning option for me and the hubs. I'd say it's even perfect for those with kids who have a small stomach.   You could get away with a stroller in here so no need to fret if the baby is sleeping...roll on in.   It's definitely worth the try or to check off your list especially if going to an AYCE is too much for you.  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetable tempura
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The hubs order from the iPad. Tuna, salmon, blue tuna, uni, and hamachi? Forgot. Lol
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oysters and a salmon skin roll

8c-q_9iCZID_KJoKfWmBvw.text: This place is fun! A variety of sushi plates rotate on a conveyer belt and anything you order from the iPad on the table is delivered by a robot. Well, sometimes by a human. The food is good. It's a bit better than an AYCE sushi place. This place doesn't have AYCE btw. Everything on the belt is $2.50. I like how they kept it simple.   Service was good. Our water and sodas were always kept full. The food comes out fast after you order it from the ipad. The grilled black cod ($10.95) was really good.  The space is clean and modern. Parking was a bit confusing. But basically just park anywhere and ignore the signs.

kJ_12gWBeM9xtDEwlpRMpg.text: I'm more of an AYCE sushi fanatic. But I wanted to take my sister here for her birthday, since she doesn't eat a lot of sushi so the price should be less if we were to eat AYCE. I know revolving sushi is a gimmick, but the restaurant looks like it has great quality fish. I like that revolving plates are one set price at $2.50 a plate. The best thing about Sapporo is their King Salmon! That really is the best salmon I ever had. But it was the only thing I enjoyed at Sapporo. They even had Blue Fin Toro, but most of the fish tasted like they've been sitting out. Similar to something you'd eat at a buffet or Makinos. That made me sad, I want to like this place. Our bill came to be exactly the same as going to AYCE! I think I'll only come for happy hour when I'm craving salmon.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uni
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bluefin Tuna
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super white tuna

mRTdaS5AnZI6aLe3iGaIjw.text: As indicated by the other reviews, I was very pleased with my visit this afternoon, and highly recommend it... the sushi was great, the server was helpful, the prices outstanding. And, it appears every aspect of the delivery and service has been thought out well in advance, and is being executed well.  Wasn't aware of their late night happy hour, but now that I am, look forward to it!  Great place, well done!

Q0qqkObw52yE9RwMmlngnA.text: The sushi wasn't all that impressive or fresh either. The squid nigiri was actually bad though. Didn't have that wow factor you expect with fresh fish. After reading all the reviews I came in with my expectations a little too high perhaps. The miso ramen was pretty good however. I'd recommend that. But although the food was okay-ish, all around it was a fun experience. They had a good selection of sushi revolving and it was fun ordering and having the little robot bring out your food on the belt.

jUDk_YwzucZ_iOlAdkoJXw.text: Sushi at your reach when you want it! Living in the Northwest before moving to Vegas, I've had the convenience of eating sushi at conveyor belt sushi restaurants such as Blue C Sushi and Sushi Land. I was happy to find a sushi conveyor belt restaurant in Vegas at Sapporo Revolving Sushi. They have sushi, a few small warm dishes, Japanese desserts (cake or ice cream) and ramen or udon soup. It is a fun experience to bring friends or family to because at each booth (I believe each booth takes 6 people comfortably or 8 tight), you can grab small plates of sushi ($2.50/plate of 2 or 1). You can also order from the table's tablet (each dish $2.50-$10 and $15-30 for sashimi), which comes to your booth via machine unless it is soup). I only found it hard to tell if it was your table's order or the table on the other side of you.  I do wish they had more non-spicy sushi roll options since my boyfriend doesn't do spice. The spicy rolls that I ordered weren't too spicy to my taste. It seemed that about 75% of the sushi menu contained spice of some sort. I'm sure you can call the waiter to your table to make adjustments to an order, but it would be nice to have an option to do so on your table's tablet.  The ramen ($4.95/Bowl) that we ordered was delicious and enough for two people if also eating other dishes. The Bonzino fish was soft and flavorful inside and crisp on the outside.  I'd say compared to other sushi places, the Nigiri choices that come in 2 at Sapporo are a tiny bit smaller.  They have a bar while you wait to be seated or you can order from your table. It was a 1st experience for my boyfriend, but certainly not his last!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4wBAyh0rgU-4Cjiy7aPs6Q.text: Been wanting to try the first conveyor belt sushi place in Vegas and finally stopped by this place last Friday. My friend and I got there around 6:30 and were promptly seated. The place was nicely decorated and being new, looked really clean. I noticed that almost all the tables were taken and by the time we left, there was a line, so this place is quite popular. It seems like parking is quite limited as a lot of spots have signs reserved for certain stores/businesses. Just to be safe, I ended up parking all the way in the end by Joyful House.  The food was really disappointing though. We tried their salmon carpaccio, which came in 4 pieces. The salmon was good, but the sauce was too overpowering. For nigiri, we tried salmon belly, uni, and chu-toro (we only tried three because after we tried the first one, we knew we didn't want to order more). The fish on the nigiri all tasted ok, except for the salmon belly which tasted a bit fishy to me. The worst thing about the nigiri was the sushi rice. The rice was soft, but packed super tight when they shaped it. It tasted like a mushy rice ball. All the fish are also cut way too thin. With the packed mushy rice and too thin of fish, the nigiri are just bad.   We also tried their ramen. I had the black garlic ramen and my friend had the tonkatsu ramen. We agreed that both ramen were the best dishes we had there and we only ordered them so we wouldn't still be too hungry after dinner LOL.   If you don't see the sushi items you want at the conveyor belt, you can use the ipad on the table to order from the menu. Once the items you order are ready, the kitchen will send them through the conveyor belt (for sushi) or the waitress will bring them out for you (for ramen, appetizers, etc.).   Price for each plate is $2.50. You get 2 pieces for salmon belly and 1 piece for uni and for chu-toro. The ramen was $4.95 for a small bowl and the carpaccio was $7.95. We also ordered hot tea, which was $2. Our total bill came to almost $40 for only that much food. For another 10 bucks, we could've eaten at an AYCE, had better sushi with varieties of appetizers and desserts, and actually be full after dinner.  For only being open for a few weeks, the service was great though. Our waitress was very polite and kept checking on our table. She also made sure our hot tea is never empty for too long.  I don't recommend this place, unless you really just want to check out what the conveyor belt is about. If you're looking for delicious sushi, look elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu on iPad

oGx_qbz9Y6uGHLk4spuisA.text: Fun place with interesting flavors -- they have much more than the standard sushi offerings -- but you visit for the price, not the quality.  It probably didn't help that we had ultra premium sushi at Yui Sushi Edomae just a few hours prior to eating here with friends.  From the 4.5 star Yelp reviews I had overly high expectations that were not met by the quality.  Most of what we ordered was from the conveyor belt, with a few add ons.   Prices are a very reasonable $2.50 per plate except for items ordered from the iPad at your table.   Some of our more memorable dishes:  * Black garlic ramen:  while it looked good, the broth had no depth or richness of flavor.  3/5  * Cheese tonkatsu:  ordered this out of curiousity.  Interesting fried cheese bits -- worth trying once but a bit dry.  3.5/5  * Gyoza:  Very standard, could be a little crispier.  3.5/5  * Black pepper tuna:  one of the more interesting nigiri.  Almost tasted like jerky.  3.5/5  * Hamachi tacos:  nice crispness from the taco but the fish flavor was a bit muted.  3.5/5  Our biggest gripe was that each piece of fish was consistently flavorless --  barely any of the lush fresh fish flavor from decent quality sushi.  We will not be back.

gowJrKqcQpIuC5D2Sbh8lw.text: Solid 4.5 stars.   After 5 visits here, I can confidently recommend this place to others. One of the best compliments I can give is that their service is always friendly, attentive, and courteous. Expect to wait at least 30 minutes for a table when going during peak hours. It's worth the wait.   The sushi is always good. The rice has been hit or miss. I'm picky about the rice, though. Their selection of fish is great. They have something for just about everyone. I can't speak about the rolls since I don't partake in those but rolls are rolls so I'm sure they're fine. The food from the kitchen is also good. The ramen is probably my favorite hot food item. The broth is so tasty, the noodles cooked perfectly, and it's always piping hot.   The conveyor belt action is definitely a fun way to have sushi. I really like that you can also order directly to your table if you don't feel like waiting for the conveyor belt to come around again or if you want a fresh dish made just for you.   I really like Sapporo Revolving Sushi. They're planning to open one in the northwest and at town square soon. Looking forward to having one near my house!

FhBTBrGtTxX6tBuJshL2mg.text: We went for the experience and came out pleasantly surprised. The conveyor belt provides many sushi options, "tacos," and appetizers. If you want any specialized rolls, those are delivered my these cute little robot vehicles that sit on top of the conveyor belt. They also have ramen and udon,  these are delivered by the servers. The prices are great but it does get really busy.

dqCNj-d-lEkuZlCMp7rJgw.text: My 13yr old wanted revolving sushi and I found this place on yelp. OMG you have got to make a stop here if you are in town and want some sushi!   Sushi is fresh and there isn't much on the conveyor belt but whatever you may want you can order from the tablet on your table. Then it gets delivered on this shuttle tray cart that stops right next to your table. Which was pretty neat. We've heard about these things from a friend that visited Japan but didn't realize there was one here in Vegas. But yet again it is Vegas. There are plenty of rolls here and their very fresh, we even came back the next day for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu is on this screen

ZLkRXwubTstpSFKgLgSd-g.text: The hype man took the wheel with this one.   30 minute wait for robotic gimmicks and below average sushi. Sure it's a fun idea, but the majority of sushi offered were not great, if not questionable. I think Ayce sushi offers better quality than this place. I was also shocked that the yellowtail was covered in brown sauce and tasted fishy. I knew right then that my stomach was in for a long & painful night. Oh and do not get the sauteed softshell crab, it tasted foul like it wasn't cleaned properly and was filled with poop in the center of the body. It was truly a disaster.   On a positive note, I did enjoy the mini black garlic ramen and the handrolls were filled proportionally so it wasn't all rice. If I had to recommend something, get the salmon skin handroll, spider handroll & salmon crispy tacos.  $2.50 per plate from the conveyor belt seems like a good value, but that shit adds up quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini garlic ramen
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini garlic ramen
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spider hand rolls

X1Joq0iNtaMNOj4oCuZZjQ.text: What a fun way to eat!  Honestly, it's perfect for the solo sushi-eater. I selected 8 plates - which ranged from one piece of the more expensive stuff (toro) to three or four pieces of some rolls (dragon & California, respectively).  All told, I paid $20 for about the same amount that I usually eat at the AYCE places - AND got to try more things!  If you don't like what's on the conveyor belt, you can order from the menu. Prices are about the same, considering that you get a larger serving with an "order".   Be aware that if you're with a group, the people sitting closest to the sushi parade are going to be doing a lot of plate-passing.   Sit so that the belt is moving toward you for the best view!

1p7yJx0pQ2bV7Rzt366zpQ.text: Amazing concept for a sushi restaurant!   We came into this restaurant VERY hungry. My normal response with sushi is that it will take a minute and I will be hungry for a minute upon sitting down at sushi. The conveyor belt is going as soon as you sit down and you can grab something ASAP.   All of the sushi was really good. All of the plates are on the belt and come around with anywhere from 1-3 pieces on them which is the perfect amount to not get sick of one type of sushi. You take the plates and they are usually $2.50 per plate but we got to the restaurant late and so we were in happy hour pricing , $1.75 per plate. You can eat a lot of sushi and still come out of there paying less than all you can eat which is amazing.   The service is average but I believe it is difficult to maintain a high service level when you don't have to take orders or do any of the normal service basics.   In all this was a great place and I love the concept. I will definitely be returning here :)

xUCvU9RTRbr2qaI4XYnVAg.text: Basic sushi but I loved it.   Nice selection and you can special order other items.   Also they have draft Kirin bonus  Great value

8GMHXfIBMI3x5EFzyZqqPw.text: This is definitely one of the better conveyor belt sushi restaurants I've been to. My boyfriend and I go here all the time whenever we visit Vegas. Brought some friends here a couple months ago and they loved it. We were going to night swim after and had planned to eat lightly, but we ended up devouring 50 plates !  4 girls, 50 plates, about $30 pp. Price is good for a conveyor belt sushi place, but it can easily add up depending on what you get and become comparable to an AYCE sushi place.  Happy hour plates are only $1.75 each! Reg price $2.50 Sun-Thurs 10pm-12am Fri & Sat 11 PM-2AM   PS, you can also take some TO-GO, it's a great snack to munch on in the middle of the night or the next morning since Vegas hotels only have fridges and no microwaves!  PPS, Sapporo pls come to LA. Thank you.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taking some to-go!

IotPhFOr6-CDpk2vZqwI-A.text: I really like this concept. Had to write down name and info at hostess desk. We were seated ASAP. Plates are $2.50 each unless you order from the tablet, which is super cool as a robot brings that out on a fast track. Variety on the track was not impressive, rolls were all very similar. Not bad tho. The gyoza was not that good, soggy. You're better off to order those fresh from the tablet. Affordable, fast and fun. But don't expect high quality, it's more about the concept.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hours
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

U919oQOl_MkxX7e-p1Xksg.text: We always like exploring restaurants that are away from the strip when we're in Vegas and we were in the mood for sushi. We were recommended this revolving sushi restaurant. I've always wanted to try one.   It was a fun experience. Perfect for my wife and I who like eating different sized portions like trying a variety of things. You just grab a plate of what you want as it passes by. Portion sizes range from 2-3 pieces a plate. Each plate was $2.50. If you want premium items or something else besides sushi, there's a menu you can order from also.  Downsides, service wasn't the best. I guess they're used to people serving themselves so when you need something it's not a priority. And the iced tea and hot tea we're awful. I'll just order a soda next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyoza. One of my favs!
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail taco sushi. Yummy!
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Revolving carousel of sushi &amp; appetizer options strolling by your table. Just grab a plate when you see something you want.

7bhtA-Lmx1I53esT3U57jw.text: Such a fun experience with friendly service. Upon arriving you can sign in for a table. I noticed happy hour specials and $1.50 a roll for late night sushi!   A conveyor belt will bring around so many kinds of sushi and you can order fresh rolls, buns, ramen and (the most delicious) tacos that are delivered on a little electric car to your table! Wine was only $5 a glass!  There were some really delish rolls (Harijuku roll) and some really odd ones (salmon and cheese). There was something for every taste! The yellowfin tacos were a favorite of the table. Perfect amount of crunch, perfect texture and such good flavor! The pork bun had a huge chunk of pork - worth the money for sure! My only problem was that the revolving sushi was a bit warmer than I would have liked. In comparison to what we ordered in the kitchen, the rolls/fish was room temperature.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 Piece Octopus
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Harijuku roll
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 piece 2 Piece Yellowtail Taco

zJoaCuyWgXVhW-cHepFoNg.text: We decided to go to this location on a whim! We had not been to a revolving sushi place since we lived in San Diego; in fact it was our first date..so we felt what's a more fitting night out than to try a local revolving sushi restaurant! We arrived around 530pm on a Monday, welcomed and seated right away! It was not very busy, but an hour later they had opened up the far side of the restaurant and had people in every booth! Ninna was our waitress and was the sweetest, she kept checking on us and making sure we were okay. We were definitely okay! Everything was delicious! We will be going back!

Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. crispy brussels (ordered off the ipad)

I4xoJUBlACjNVwWsLV54LQ.text: Absolutely one of the best sushi places in the valley. They have a tremendous amount of sushi choices as well as noodles and bigger portions if ordered. The place itself is very clean and maintained. The stuff is very friendly and customer service is great! The sushi here revolves on a conveyor and you just choose the ones you want. Most plates have 3 pieces of sushi which is around $2.50 per plate. Some have two pieces which are mostly raw fish. You can order bigger portions on a touch screen located in each table in the restaurant. The sushi is is delicious and so are the soups! Highly recommend this place if you're around Chinatown in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front entrance
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Machine you can order larger portions
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. California roll.

7eZwgWwQRkhzhBKsQw8mig.text: There's really not a single thing I can say negatively about Sapporo. I've been here countless times because I'm just hooked.  Their sexy girl roll, the filet nigiri, Brussels sprouts app, the halibut roll, the gyoza, Yuzu tuna and the garlic tuna nigiri are all enough to keep me coming back. I haven't had a single thing on their revolving belt and menu that I have not been 100% happy with.   They have happy hour at certain hours where the revolving sushi price is a bit discounted, but even within normal hours, the price is suitable for the quality.   My favorite (as childish as it sounds) is the little "singing" robot that comes out when you order from the tablets on the table versus picking up plates off the belt. There's just something so fun about it!   It's great how their concept works, order at your leisure, and servers are around whenever you need a refill or have a special request.  I will definitely continue to consider this a staple for sushi cravings.

x9hauRPz0l5GdreOIRyXOQ.text: I was excited to try place but would probably not be coming back. We came during happy hour to try out the specials they had on the sushi, not too appetizing. They had maybe 1-2 "premium" roll pieces on the conveyor but they were almost always empty the entire time we were here. If you want someone good to each you have to order from the menu and pay full price. The experience was fun, always looking to try new places but then I'm disappointed. They have games good prices on beer for happy hour. The dessert was good, I'll give them that it was the French toast with ice cream, nice crunch on the outside of the bread paired with ice cream it was the best item we tried that night. If your craving a few sushi pieces by all means come here, but if your looking for a meal, I would skip and go to any ayce sushi place in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast desert

2lN-u4FCNCS550KEtxn-Xw.text: I love the concept of revolving sushi.  The pros - you get to try a variety of sushi at the low price of $2.50 per plate.  Each item comes to you in a covered dish and at the end of the meal they count your plates to determine the total. You can even compete with your friends for the highest stack. (joke. Don't do this unless you have an iron stomach and a deep wallet)  There are some tradeoffs.  You are limited to the sushi types they decide to send out unless you want to order off the full price menu.  Also, depending where you sit along the track, the food may arrive warmer than if you were at the bar or had it brought to you.  Still, everything tasted good and I got to try a few items I might not have know to order.  Fun times

nlDlRHIMQK7C8r4zmovn1w.text: Came here late one night during Sapporo's happy hour! The wait was not very long and my friend and I were seated promptly.   During happy hour, their conveyor belt sushi was about 1.75 a dish, but we also ordered full rolls because we were starving and figured it would be a good head start! Most, if not all the rolls on the speciality menu could also be taken from the conveyor, so if there is a roll you are not sure about on the menu, you can sample it from the belt.   The sushi was good, but in the same vein as other sort of mass produced sushi places (think ayce as opposed to a la carte) i felt the sushi didn't really taste all that impressive. It was certainly good, but it lacked that wow factor that comes when you eat fresh fish, which makes sense as most of these sushi servings have likely been out for hours for them to be discounted during happy hour. All in all though it's a nice place to go for food and a social gathering!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RtP1YLdG-McTBgC3yqk3AQ.text: Thought it was decentish. Not as flavorful as I'm used to but tasted fairly fresh and was a fun concept. Because it was conveyer style I enjoyed the unique aspect but overall disappointed on the quality of food and drink, which is what we came for primarily. Perfect for portions though: I don't eat much and my husband eats a lot so he tried a lot while I was full after a couple plates that I traditionally love and tried 1/2 of two others that looked appetizing/fun. Husband had many more and found a few he got more of. Service was okay but because you serve yourself it was fine. The tea however was the worst I've ever experienced and made me want to cry.... I love tea and even enjoy really cheap ones usually but suggest against the hot and cold teas here, ick

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c-VSFCk94Qo5PUOtgBWshg.text: Omg I love it here! I came here on a Monday afternoon and then in the same week went back on Friday night for my birthday! First off the staff is amazing and it's exceptionally clean. I didn't get the bartenders name but the man who works on Friday night is awesome! Thank you sir for the customer service and being so helpful.  All I have to say is how can you not love a place that charges $2.50 a plate! My goodness I ate so much food while I was here and I paid a lot less than I would have at an AYCE. The conveyor belt is such a unique idea and I love that you can just taste a little bit of everything without having to commit to an entire roll. Everything was fresh both days I was here and tasted amazing. I'm very picky with sushi and their wasn't one thing I didn't like.  If you don't see what you want on the belt you can order off the menu and they have plenty of options and many beautiful looking dishes. If you order off the menu the chefs send it out on a cute little robot that comes to your table. I have to admit that got a laugh out of me numerous times!    I choose to stick with the food on the belt but my friend ordered pork ramen that was amazing! I brought my mom on Friday since she is new to sushi and she loved everything as well! The one stand out dish to me was their Cajun and peppered albacore. Yummy!   Next time I want to try out their happy hour which I heard is the best time to go. Everything on the conveyor belt is suppose to drop down to $1.50 and you can grab a beer for $3. If you are on a budget this is an excellent place to go with your family.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First time trying this one. Sooooo good!
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Possibly some of the best scallops I&#39;ve eaten. Worth every penny for the two.
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soft shell crab off the menu. Absolutely delicious.

WrfYuHylEKyDzJli1qcFVw.text: Me and my wife have been here a dozen times over the last year and have loved this place every time we go.  Tip- order your food on the tablet ASAP. It can take a little bit for those items to come out. So do that quick. The food on the belt is great also. We love that we can sit down and start eating immediately and truly love the quality. Price wise it comes out cheaper than some of the AYCE places, so that's a plus!   If you like sushi, check this place out. It gets busy so don't be surprised if there's a wait! (Most of the time we go we just sit right down, but sometimes we have to wait 15-20min)

hitCLSWZ_hXMEakNAXPnTw.text: Revolving sushi in Vegas?? How good can it really be...   It was good fam. My friends and I sat down and we ate 50 plates in 40 minutes LOL. We were excited. All the salmon nigiri was delicious (king salmon, salmon belly). The smoked salmon tasted like lox so maybe pass on that one. The fatty tuna could've been better.. I was pleasantly surprised by the Alaskan halibut, it was so buttery. The lobster roll was good. The rainbow roll could've been better.  Eating here was the highlight of our trip! A nice place to have dinner before clubbing.  They also have a menu where you can send the kitchen you order - we didn't try this option, but the neighboring table looked like they enjoyed their special items!   It's 2.50 a plate, 1.75 a plate for late HH which starts at 10pm-close.

7VyOoJDWZklmYnGIwtGDyw.text: Clean and friendly  A different place, i have been to one in reno and in Japan this is more like the japanese ones, the robot is cool that brings our tour plates on special order. The rasberry  ice tea is good.   $2.50 per plate you get 3 pcs or you can get a full roll for$7.50 and the robot brings that.   Fun place i will be back.

4_0gBXywvCrzxIdwaQzIWw.text: I have been to Sapporo's twice now.  Each time was a treat!  Great atmosphere, very friendly and attentive staff.  The selection and the quality is outstanding!  My favorites are the Black Garlic Ramen (absolutely amazing!) and the popcorn lobster rolls!

-8FMZ-ZjRy3qyJZvURMUXQ.text: What's not to say about this place  It's freaking cool! The selection of sushi is awesome  For 2.50 a plate in the coveyer belt, the price is not bad. I hope it can be AYCE soon, that would be nice  The staff is awesome. I would come back here any day

v0ZN-pxub7dQfCQbCVA72w.text: Yep, that's right. Vegas finally has their own revolving sushi joint. In the sea of AYCE sushi spots, Sapporo is joining the many options for sushi in Sin City!  After hearing about this place recently opening (Dec 2017), me and a few friends stopped by for dinner and enjoyed ourselves. Don't get me wrong, it's a great place. The fish quality is good and the service was very attentive and nice. But I think I still prefer AYCE...   At $2.50 a plate, they can really stack up and we ended up paying about the same, if not more, per person as you could get at AYCE. Maybe I'm a little spoiled by the price at revolving sushi joints in Hawaii. But $2.50 for some of the items they offer is a little overpriced.   You can either order from the iPad or grab directly from the belt. I tend to like ordering from the iPad (so you know it's made somewhat more fresh)  In the end, we enjoyed ourselves and left thoroughly stuffed. The restaurant is very clean and nicely designed. It was a little empty when we were there but here's hoping more people catch on.

PPG3C6F78bnUDiiRH4d_Nw.text: My friend recommended me to this place 2 weeks ago and this is my third time here now. This place is seriously the most cash money you can get. I love getting to try different foods without having to purchase ayce because I never eat as much as ayce is worth. I love spending $10-15 for how much I would've eaten at an ayce place. I definitely recommend going here for a unique experience.

BEy1PZTuuL4lokT_Qf_-dA.text: Omfg the fish was FRESH AF !!!! This place is amazeballs. I have a ladyboner because my dinner was so good!  I haven't even mentioned that it's so fun to pluck your food off the conveyor belt, and when you order off the menu, your food comes out on this special flatbed truck. This is my new favorite place.  WOOT!

NLzAJBTyn2AKuV6eeUiKaw.text: The hostess is rude and impolite totally. Jan 5th 2018. She seats a guy who claims a family of 4 although he was only by himself which came after me despite I got here 1st. Time: 12:05pm

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I don&#39;t think I am coming back again ever.

bx7EMblOcPDpuSIeU2g72A.text: I had family in town, from Hawaii, and we were stoked to dine here since our usual spot back home, Genki Sushi, had the same exact concept. The host, Christian (not 100% with his name), was attentive and the most helpful of the staff during our experience here. This plan was given three stars because of him. Our server was a Caucasian lady who was really nice but wasn't around much? She came around like once? Other than that, the busser and host was always there to answer our questions or tend to our water refills. During our FIRST order on the Ipad, we ordered a bunch of nigiris, ramen for my son, and two udon bowls for my nieces. We probably had three rounds of orders through the Ipad and realized their udon never came at all. My cousin noticed the table that was sat maybe 10-15 minutes after us, had their udon orders. It definitely killed our vibe since my nieces had a long day of cheer competition. We first brought it to the attention of the busser, then the host, then our "server". Once they got it, my cousin wanted to take it to go but again, no one was around to bring to-go containers. Everyone in our party was done eating while they just got started on theirs. Poor girls. Don't get me wrong, they were all nice but if they came around more to make sure our orders were brought to our tables and scarfed down into our hungry bellies, this would've been a better experience. As for the menu itself, it's okay...I think it's not as generous as what we're used to. Hence, I'd rather get some sushi at an AYCE spot than here. We left hungry and dissatisfied but, tried to make the best of our experience. I guess I had HIGH expectations for this place...maybe that's why the outcome seems more disappointing. Would I come back? I don't know.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Db08juP5VLZyY7vFR8x6mg.text: Love the concept. It's not authentic, hardcore Japanese style sushi, but for the price, it's worth it. Often a wait, even with some tables empty. Good service. Good menu items plus what revolves on the conveyor belt. Have been multiple times. Quality fish, better than what you'd find at standard all you can eat spots.

x4EfjxKdmybXn7zPMqqm7w.text: Great quality fish for sure which was amazing considering the fact that the sushi is continuously cycling through. A good amount of variety and the happy hour is the best value.

A5BEjlFHSfbZG7P76TOeqw.text: This place brings rotating sushi to a new level! I've been to rotating sushi places in Asia, but this place is more hip and fun. Instead of bar seating, there are private booths that surround the sushi conveyor belt. Service was really good since the place was pretty empty. Our waiter came by to explain how each plate off the conveyor belt was $2.50 and how to work the iPad. Numerous other people came by to fill up water and pick up plates.  Each dish on the conveyor belt is never left on there for more than thirty minutes, meaning the dish is fresh. The plates typically have two pieces of sashimi or three pieces of a roll. Along with common sashimi pieces and rolls, there were some trendy items, such as sashimi tacos or unique rolls. From the belt, I had a salmon taco and octopus nigiri. We then ordered a few items from their main menu off the iPad. Their prices are pretty good. We ordered a $5 small bowl of ramen, $7.50 tiger roll, and $2.50 squid nigiri. The tiger roll was medium sized and beautifully presented. The ramen noodles were delicious, but their broth was too salty and there were not enough toppings. I really enjoyed the quality of the squid nigiri. It's incredibly fun when the iPad pieces come out, since they send this robot that zooms down the conveyer belt to where you sit!   I loved how modern and chic this place is. The prices are too high for me to order everything I wanted, so if I wanted to gorge, I would go for AYCE.

MmQ_dSmRbk41aSmO-r5rQg.text: Great find. So many times you go to sushi places and they give you more rice than seafood. I like the small portions and many plates. You get what you want. All for your takin with the revolving belt of sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rMeQgbfw8WCNy69SzuQdLg.text: Great quality fish, large selection, prices which are lower than the comparable competition and a fun environment makes this place a winner. The small plates on the conveyor belt are all a fixed price and you are charged by how many you take. This is great because instead of ordering an entire roll and discovering you don't like it, you can take a small plate of 3 to 4 pieces And not waste as much money if you don't care for it. You can also order full size or additional items from the tablet at your table.   Kids love this place and I recommend it if you are a sushi lover.

3Pjc7MM_3xi10CjqnGJG8g.text: This place was so good! I haven't had revolving sushi in forever and my friend told me about this place. The service was great. Our drinks were never empty and we got all our food really quick too. We arrived around 5pm and were able to be seated immediately. Around 6pm it was so busy. So maybe get there earlier than dinner time. Order the the tacos!

HvAAsTfALnDngstwsk81Bw.text: Great fun place.  Sushi was fresh with a good variety to choose from.  People were friendly.  I loved their fish on nigiri sushi was sliced generous, presented well and with a SMALL piece of rice.  Octopus sashimi in truffle oil was a must try

WIEgZ-9ViqTyHNKTuI587g.text: Wow... just wow. Our first revolving sushi place in Vegas and they did it right!  The place is very modern and upscale. Floors and booths are very clean. They have a cool wooden wall art long the entire side of the restaurant. Bathrooms are just as nice as the interior. The kitchen is spectated by a giant glass window so you can see the chefs and cooks work.   The food is just as awesome as the design of the place. 2.50 per plate on the conveyer, so I had my fixing there. Cooked items or special items are ordered through the iPad on the table.   Staff was very friendly and helpful with the menu. Food came out quick and I left with a full belly and a great experience!   Great job Sapporo! I'll be back soon!!

hUuTpPi0nn75Zg1NWA5YNQ.text: I've been here right at opening and several times late at night during Happy Hour. I can honestly say that the food is as fresh at the end as it is at the beginning (or vice-versa). Even though this is not an AYCE place, take into consideration the price of 2-piece nigiri at most Japanese restaurants. The regular price for nigiri here is half (or less than half) of what you would pay elsewhere (and even better during Happy Hour)! I also like the selection of rolls on the conveyor belt. They are regularly priced at an equal fraction of what you would pay for a whole roll on the menu, so you can try a wider selection of rolls instead of filling up on just a few. I have noticed that Happy Hour is getting a lot more crowded and busier. It is nice that they will hold your place if not everyone in your party is present, but they will not seat you or give you a table yet (which is fair, given how busy they can get). Now I don't know whether is was just because the last time I went during Happy Hour was during a weekend or if it is now generally applied, but compared to the first Happy Hour I went to, the price has increased. Overall, it is a really good place to go to get your sushi fix without feeling you need to overindulge to get your money's worth!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice concept, fresh and constantly changing!

vv9KWebHIgDcthX4eHjaww.text: this place is so cool! omg. i've always watched videos about revolving sushi but it's always in japan. it was such a cool neat experience. the only problem we had with the place was the wait time. when we arrived only half the seating was being used which caused for people waiting to kind of pile  up but soon the other side opened up and we were seated. all of the fish was so fresh and good. i can't get over the uni too omg. and what makes it even better is the price. $2.50 per plate. my boyf and i both ate til we were full and it came out to less than $40 for both of us compared to ayce sushi. and the quality is better here. such a fun time and the service was lovely too. would return again. probably tomorrow.

upsQ1K7qLwG9QNtE1YlhNQ.text: So excited that there is finally a revolving sushi bar in Las Vegas!   This place is very classy inside, with a chill atmosphere. Rolls and nigiri were on point  Our server was very attentive - kept my water full! And they have a very convenient iPad system at every table to order anything else from the kitchen.   Definitely our new favorite sushi place!

C-KRWwGrfib2rP2qXERSJA.text: Second time here, but our first time at happy hour - a great deal for good quality nigiri and other deliverables off of the conveyer belt. Our server was really nice, and we look forward to coming out here again!

Ty76MpKZLN-X_h11LvL7HA.text: Yay! Vegas is catching up with the food trends. Each plate from the conveyor belt costs $2.50 and ranges from sushi rolls, nigiri, and appetizers. The names and ingredients of each item is available via the iPad set-up on each table. You can also order full sized rolls and entrees on the iPad including ramen, miso soup, nigiri (raw fish with rice), sashimi plates (raw fish without the rice), and dessert! The set up is very time efficient because a majority of the orders are delivered to your party's table with a robot. There isn't much interaction with the servers unless you order drinks and prior to being seated; however, most of them are very friendly! For the most part, the quality of the raw fish is comparable to those of AYCE sushi joints throughout Las Vegas; however, I prefer coming here because I don't feel compelled to over eat. My favorites here include: the lobster roll (don't get this confused with the popcorn lobster roll, which is just California rolls w/ flavorless fried lobster on top), garlic edamame, tuna tacos, and the spicy tuna handroll. I would recommend coming here if you have a sushi craving but you're not hungry enough to make AYCE worth.

R7APkpAAHzfFePZCGF_C-A.text: This is a great place to take your kids to try different varieties of sushi. Plates are in small portions so you can keep eating different varieties. It's the only one in Vegas so it always seems busy. It's very clean and the staff was very helpful and friendly. If you're looking for excellent quality try elsewhere but quantity and variety this is the place to come! It's also super fun for the kids! Oh before I forget you can also order from the menu and a little robot cart will bring it right to your table. We will be back! They also have a happy hour  late at night.

npJevzkCTFGZ1nUkShvnEg.text: This is such a cool place to go. You can try  things without getting too much. A great variety of items to choose from. Items off the menu are always cooked just right. Staff is friendly and helpful.

EQOs0Hr_F2LOcIN2o3VKSg.text: This place is my holy land. You have to come after 10 PM or its not worth the price. -IsIVax7mYDsZVhp6L1q5A.text: First, love that we finally have a revolving sushi restaurant here in Las Vegas!    Great place!   Love that you can sit down and start eating right away.  the sushi is extremely fresh, if you are facing the kitchen you can actually see them cutting the  fish!  This is the perfect place to bring friends that trying sushi for the first time.   Pieces per plate can be anywhere from 1-4 pieces.   Each plate is $2.50 each! qryZUmL4CXu5GnNqPdsizQ.text: First time trying the revolving sushi concept!  This was fun to try, as there was a variety of items, few plates of each for you to share. There is a tablet for you to order special items and appetizers from as well, so you are not only restricted to whats rotating. By the way, the items are being kept fresh because everything is getting grabbed amd there is room to make new. When you place the special orders with your waiter or via tablet, it arrives on a moving belt to your table. At the end of your meal, your plates are counted (Each rotating plate is the same price) and your bill will be tallied.  I'm definetely goung to bring my friends here to check this place out!

oIGbfkqCGucuTRxBBWWLaw.text: I have been wanting to try a revolving sushi spot for years and was very excited when my girl told me there was one in town.  I jumped at the chance to meet her there and try it out, even though it was pretty late.  Got there and the place was large, which was surprising due to it being in Chinatown.  Even though it was large, half of the restaurant was closed which resulted in us waiting for an hour to get in, even though it was past 11:00 pm.  Maybe they didn't have enough chefs scheduled that late, idk.  I would definitely recommend staffing more though in the future, especially since it is HH late at night.   Finally sat down and it was so cool!  The food just comes around your tables and you grab what you want!  I know this is the core concept but for someone who has never experienced that, it was pretty dope.  Normally the plates are $2.50 each but during HH the plates were $1.50!  $1.50 sounds awesome until you find out that each plate has like 3 bites of food on them, which again, I suppose is part of the concept, to try a bit of everything without breaking the bank.  The sushi itself was just alright too, nothing over the top or amazing although I did see a few things I haven't before (sushi tacos and some lobster thing).  Let's just say I was lucky I wasn't that hungry or I would've ended up spending a whole lot more than $9.  Yes, I could've ordered whole rolls and other dishes at full price from the iPad on the table, and yes, I could've seen them delivered to my table on a cool light train but as I said earlier, I wasn't terribly hungry.   Concept: Awesome/Awesome Decoration: Pretty nice Service: Staff was very very nice but when everything but seating and drinks is automated it makes tipping a bit weird. Food: Not bad sushi for the plates that I had. Hipster factor: Yes Will I go here again?: Yes because my friends are dying to try it and I can always go for a few cheap bites of sushi.  I also want to try their other dishes!  Tips:  Go during HH.  Don't go if you are really hungry/have a big appetite and are on a budget.  Go to experience something new.  Prepare for a long wait if half of the restaurant is closed and there is any semblance of a line.  Definitely a cool experience though.

SbjyRmH3bPxP1ONIjkFbtg.text: Great place to enjoy sushi and sample your favorites as well as new dishes! If you like sushi this is a must!!!

ONq6xINEYOzdDmz_m_zcSw.text: Place is still "on point". Thanks for a nice evening.  Gotta keep writing or it's just a "tip". Don't know why I keep placing reviews. I get nothing from Yelp.

wa_I_D7_xPvdFNaYFpqFAw.text: Fresh sushi on a conveyor belt!   Very busy restaurant but a short wait due to the efficiency of the conveyer belt and the little tram on a track for orders that are not on the conveyor belt.  And you can't beat the price! We will be back!

nY6iEf02nkpYPMOJiFVwoA.text: we went here Saturday night around 11pm when their half off menu starts. I've never been to any type of conveyor food restaurant so it was interesting to me to see the mechanisms. we were told it would be a 10 minute wait and asked us to sign in. once seated, we ordered drinks which came promptly and ordered some ramen. while waiting for the ramen, we started to pick and choose which rolls we wanted from the conveyor and just grabbed them. i like the idea of not having to wait for your food to be made or cooked. they count your bill per plate. i think we had about 8 plates, plus two small bowls of ramen and drinks, the bill came out to around $40 for 2 people and i think we spent about an hour there. i would definitely recommend this place and i will be going back.

wNLR8ddGKfzHhz1BPbuhow.text: I'll start out by saying that my boyfriend and I can eat a lot of sushi, so if you're like us, take caution. Revolving sushi is a neat concept and a fun experience, but it does tend to add up if you order a lot. Plates here are $2.50 each no matter what it is, which I'm assuming is to help streamline the tally at the end. A bit different than other revolving sushi spots I've been to where the price will vary depending on the item.   The quality of the nigiri really surprised me. I had some tasty plates, such as the hamachi and the maguro. On the flip side, if you come at a down time, you'll have the same six rolls going around the conveyor. You also have the option to order other sushi/side dishes off a tablet that is at your table. There is a little robot train thing that delivers your food above the conveyor, which is adorable. To send it back to the kitchen after you grab your plate, just press the button.   I'd say that if you are coming here with a big appetite, do expect to pay more than an AYCE restaurant (it was about $75+ tax/tip for the two of us). However, it's a cool experience and the food is good too.

LEOzFrsA2pcGmyHzG9PNcA.text: This is the place you have to be if you are in Vegas. Prices are reasonable, sushi is fresh and delicious. Service is fast and friendly. Sushi conveyer rocks. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi conveyer for trying

27AMR8B5DZmV0Nzm8nPaGQ.text: Highly recommend this sushi restaurant if you're not really in the mood for all you can eat. The fish is high quality and there are a variety of options from appetizers, specialty rolls, nigiri, hand rolls, and dessert. Each plate comes with 2-3 pieces and everything on the conveyor belt is just $2.50. I went on a Monday night with two of my friends. Service was fast and friendly. We were pretty full and ended up with 15 plates. Overall, it was a great experience and I would definitely go back!

B4YQauCSOSIacbMt86h0uQ.text: Came here during happy hour at 10PM on a Sunday night to give it a try when it is only $1.50 per plate. Pretty glad I did! It tasted okay and some even tasted a bit fishy.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9y2VNmjaM06Noi4YIHQbvA.text: Great food and they really upped their Happy hour sushi by keeping the belt filled instead of it letting it run dry. They have cold glasses for beer and great tasting Ponzu. The Uni and Salmon Roe could be a little more plentiful, and the Blue Fin can be a bit questionable. However, in all they belong to a group of high quality restaurants and it is always a great late night sushi spot to go and enjoy until your belly's full.

mxoWBerRc_nd2GOtUnDJpg.text: What a fun place this is to eat! All the sushi is on conveyor belts and it is only $2.50 per plate (if you go past 10 pm it's $1.50). You get little tastes if everything. If you decide to order something from the kitchen it comes out on a little robot for delivery! Very futuristic. I truly enjoyed my food. I will definitely be back for more. Obviously the food that comes from the kitchen is best.... but for the price you can't go wrong!!!! Andddd it's decorated so nice. This is a must must must.

6DIVRSDfy3Y41cCfiyBI9A.text: Sapporo have great sushi. Every time waitress 'Felicia' was providing the best service!!! Very polite super nice to all customers. I'm happy and really appreciate her professionalism attitude, over all very good choice.

2wksEez_Oz60x0tbOwePAA.text: OK so this place is pretty cool especially if you want to take somebody that does not like sushi they can try little pieces as they come around to your table you only pay for what you takeoff conveyor belt ....now if you love sushi it's pretty awesome very reasonable prices on sushi... wow they have a creamy lobster that is absolutely the best I have ever had and for the price ....Lobster roll popcorn ...lobster roll and halibut roll are awesome I have not had any roll that I did not like .the most expensive role is $10 so if you want to have a decent meal it's not going to break the bank.... I would recommend this especially for somebody that is a little timid about sushi... Oh did I mention they have a happy hour with half price drinks and certain sushi rolls

AKxMyBikfEuocEPJ5ttedQ.text: I've been here a few times, and the last 2 times it was so busy. On the plus side They were fast to get us in. It's such an awesome unique place. You can choose anything off the revolver and order off of a menu on an electronic machine and the revolver brings its out.   I highly suggest trying this place!!

ibvXkVvdl4FGWQbFlPxxIA.text: My friend and I came here for the first time tonight. We ordered two sushi rolls (very reasonably priced), a couple dishes of nigiri, and two hand rolls. Our favorite was hands down the salmon belly nigiri. The salmon was so fresh and fatty, it melted in our mouths. We also liked the garlic tuna nigiri. The hand rolls were a little bit too spicy, but nonetheless we had a great first dining experience here. Will definitely be back :)

yg6KeVzh-XOFuQTA8iYtpA.text: It was a cool experience, but the food and quality was so-so, not excellent and not bad, we had one dish though, the hamachi taco, the fish tasted a bit off, a bit on the pricey side for small dishes, service was good, waitress was friendly, we did not pick from the revolving sushi but opted to order in fresh ones instead. It's a cool experience, I would come back, but I was not just as wowed, especially for it's higher end price. If I am craving for sushi, I would probably rather go to an all you can eat place that's not revolving.

FYMxhBxcaijCzmyUqtt6zA.text: The service in the beginning when it first opened was great but now it is very slow and the conveyor belt barely had any selections...it was a disappointment...after getting tired of waiting for the sushi I wanted I left...will never be coming back

08l_kd8cnrcWh4UQViltnQ.text: I gave them a 4 because this is their first ever revolving sushi in Las Vegas and because they have FATTY TUNA!!! I mean if you've been to Japan, Fatty tuna is the best sushi there is out there. I've tried other places that have fatty tuna in Las Vegas, and of course they were good, but it was just too damn expensive. $2.50 for 1 piece isn't really that bad.   I would've given a 5 Star, but the last time we went there, they were all out of Fatty Tuna, which totally sucked and not worth the money I spent there without the fatty tuna. Oh and also the train wasn't working, the one where you order through the iPad and it brings you the sushi through a train. Yes that wasn't working.   Overall, this place is the best when they have fatty tuna in stock. I hate that I have to call every time asking for fatty tuna tho. I'm sure it'll get better through the time being. I mean they did just open a few months ago.

OYyxHCBfwlVRcoqBhTgf3w.text: Finally there's a little more than just sushi! This place is really modern! Which I love! The service is exceptional! The food was delicious! The soft shell crab appetizer is so delicious! Also the grilled scallops!

lXuS4F_Xat2EBkre27Kh4Q.text: So good, and great service. As soon as you arrive the hostess greets you with a smile. The sushi was good, I'll be back!

jz3WBGgrXQ8QfUyeQhUCXg.text: Currently been to this place twice. I really like it. It's such a cute concept. My favorite is ordering items and having them delivered through this cute electric waiter thing. I love that all the plates on the revolving belt are the same price and that you can order anything from a screen on your table. The food is good. I love their tiny shrimp tacos. The green tea cake is good too. They have a lot of options to choose from and the plates come with 2 rolls which is good because you can try a lot more different rolls. I really like it when they have dessert on the sushi rotating belt because you get to try more. The employees are nice and are good about filling your drink. The booths are a good size. I highly recommend this place. It's a cool place to try and experience at least once. Very cute concept.

uTgFjMTb8QIiT8mgKgEKVQ.text: Me and my wife love this place! So glad Vegas has some good conveyor belt sushi now! Sushi is priced great, $2.50 a plate. Very cool modern atmosphere. Servers are very nice. One of our favorite sushi places in Vegas!

duX58D0tvUX98TkpSy1NIQ.text: I came here when they first opened and I was ecstatic about how there was FINALLY a conveyer belt sushi place in Las Vegas. This place was everything I dreamed for a conveyer belt sushi place to be. Thanks guys for the great sushi and experience!

PSXlGVKHuLHIZ_NRtJ8M8Q.text: Food is fresh and delish. The staff is friendly and fast. There's a bit of a wait. We got here around 8 pm on a Saturday night so it's expected. It's a different take on the sushi scene. It just makes it more fun that you can choose what you want to eat and just pick from the revolving belt. This is ala carte so for people who are used to ayce sushi, it can get pricey.

A tablet you can order rolls, soups, deserts etc. All rotating on a conveyor belt or if you order from tablet it comes right to you on conveyor belt. A great place for a little bit of everything!

cw4s0OdawJxRIgT1y8bw4Q.text: Love this place. Always crowded. Sushi just keeps on coming around on revolving belt then they count your plates at the end. Very good, clean and fresh. Don't miss it

tJb6AvOjd8eNbiFsA9mLIw.text: Good sushi- nothing out of this world fancy, but the revolving bar is pretty cool and very convenient. Service is sub par... but overall not a bad experience!

_IWiAhThSGuI69AuVdvz7g.text: I'm glad there's finally a revolving sushi restaurant in Vegas. It was definitely a fun experience. Bring your family and friends! The sushi was tasty. And also if you don't see something on the conveyor, (which were all $2.50 each)  you can order it on the iPad and it will be sent on a separate track right to your table! -- The menu also has other selections made to order.   I'm giving them 4 stars because at the end of our meal our plates were miscounted two times. It was all good though because our sever was very nice and I'm a patient person. Thanks for a great addition in Vegas.

Ghhv-S0J1owY5bLM2pCgKw.text: This is by far one if not my favorite sushi place for the value and convenience. I normally don't write reviews but man this is definitely a must.   Say you're stuck for business or any other events and craving late night sushi this place is fits the bill for such great value with happy hour it's practically half off each dish. With such a friendly staff and amazing food for fantastic price this is one place you will wanna stop by if you're in town for Vegas.

O_NKQ17BqJTOHktQfeR_gw.text: Great sushi and of course enjoy the novelty of the revolving sushi.  Last time I went to one was in Hong Kong.  I like the yellowtail sashimi.

sPCDtsZXoCSSLuCbZNxb9w.text: The first revolving sushi restaurant in Las Vegas has arrived and I love it! I've seen the concept before on T.V. in Japan and I thought how convenient! However, this place does not sacrifice quality for novelty. It is actually functional and practical. Let me tell you more.  Right when you walk in, you will notice the modern decor and cleanliness of the restaurant. Textured walls with warm lighting gave way to a sleek stainless steel conveyor belt  displaying a menagerie of covered plates of sushi. I was greeted right away and asked to write my name down for the waiting list. There was quite a few people waiting ahead of me, but it wasn't too bad. There was a mixed crowd of couples, friends in pairs, large groups, and every age group imaginable. I love how this new concept is bringing everyone together to have some great food easily. It wasn't before long before my name was called and I was seated along side the belt. Rows of food with a name sign right before it rolls towards you and you can just pick it off and set it on your table. The owner came by to go over how the conveyor belt works and showed me how to order other kitchen items on the iPad. He was incredibly helpful, patient, and hard working. He also explained that all of the rotating plate items are on a 30 minute timer, so after 30 minutes the unsold plate automatically gets kicked out and is not served. The fish served is also flown in daily. Hooray for freshness!   All the white plates on the conveyor belt has a set price so it is easy to keep track of how much you are going to spend by how many plates you stack up. So if you get pick happy, your tab can run as high as your plates! The special kitchen items on the iPad ranges from single hand rolls, to ramen bowls, full sushi rolls, desserts, appetizers ( like marinated pork belly ) and more of things I can't pronounce but I am sure to try in the future. If you order items from the iPad, the robot Roomba looking thing on top of the conveyor belt will roll out to you, flash some lights, and tell you your food is ready. You just pick up your dish and then it goes back in the kitchen area! So simple, but I just love it! I ordered the soft shell crab, tuna taco, yellowfin taco, and pork belly just to have it come out. Yes, I was amused by the robot, but a robot that brings me my food is a robot that makes sense. All of the sushi was really fresh. No fishiness or mushy textures. Just clean and bright flavors.  They are not big on putting mayo and creamy sauce in everything, do for once you can actually taste the quality of the fish you are eating. However, if you are into that yum yum sauce and the like you can find something on the iPad menu. The ramen noodle soup was brought out by a real person so that it won't spill. Smart. The soft shell crab was ok, not as soft as I wanted, but everything else was top notch. One of my favorites was the yellowfin taco. Firm and meaty with the crispy wonton taco shell. It was the perfect two bite tuna delight for me.  Service was really good and I think for being open on their sixth day, they are doing a great job. Everyone was working really hard and moving very fast. The owner was even helping  out with the tables and refilling drinks. The dedication and pride really shows in the product and how good the place looks. I think the growing popularity of this spot will only make them busier. I have no doubt that with the continued passion of the owner, chef, and workers of this new sushi concept in Vegas that this place will be a success. I will definitely be back and highly recommend.

bee5ot9JdMSGcmk4bUI_GQ.text: As I'm writing this, it was our second time here, and let me say that they need to hire more people for weekends. First time I came, my experience was really bad, so I decided to give it another chance, and it's still the same. Our server came by our table two times, that's it. It was to take our drink order and bring our drinks. He didn't come to give us our refills or check up on us, NOTHING. When we were finish eating, he didn't even come by for 20 minutes to give us our check so we just went up to the front.  Moving onto the food, it was okay. The fish just didn't taste as fresh to me, the rice was a little too hard and warm for the fish. I also saw a couple of the nigiri lids were kinda foggy. Me and my boyfriend ordered 3 hand-rolls, the T.N.T., and a couple nigiris.  Our iPad kept breaking down too and we had to have someone come over three times.  We'll give it another try one last time, but for the meantime, we will be taking our business elsewhere.

CUfOpC9yFbGNwAXJULPw-w.text: First time at this place yesterday. Perfect place to get your sushi fix without committing a whole roll. They sit you in a booth next to a conveyor belt that has  appetizer size sushi revolving around for you to eat, it's only $2.50 each! The also have a full menu. They have small ramen also for under $5. There are also deserts revolving around for you pick out. Ice cold lg bottle Sapporo we were set! Gets busy after five. We enjoyed it!

AG50tNxHVaeN65rS9BGEEw.text: Gave this place a visit today.  Interesting concept that I've seen before, but with a twist, the food delivery robot.  The wife and I were greeted immediately by two well dressed hosts/ waiters.  Seated immediately and given the quick run down on how to order.  Pretty easy, either pick up from the revolving conveyor belt, or order from the iPad like device at each table.  We started with the revolving selection and found familiar along with items we had not seen before.  We chose New Zealand King Salmon, Red Snapper Yuzu  w/ fresh wasabi, albacore, mackerel and Japanese Mackeral, Tomago, Baby Yellowtail, Yellowtail.  All were very fresh and tasty.  We ordered from the computer a Banzi Roll, Caterpillar Roll, Dragon Roll, Deep Fried Soft Shell crab, tuna roll, spicy salmon hand roll, Soft Shell crab hand roll, unagi, and a spicy yellowtail hand roll, and Shishito peppers. All items were freshly made and tasted very good.  While everything was fresh and good, there wasn't anything that really knocked my socks off.  But it is definitely a place to satisfy a sushi crave quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eel And tuna roll
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu and revolving conveyor

vVTYJ6LHTjX1Cc-_plriNw.text: This place is nicely decorated and it seems very inviting. The servers are nice and quick to cater to you when needed.   Food is average, seems like a gimmick. Nigiri sushi is all right, the only dish I enjoyed was the toro. Other than that, without the revolving part it would just be another mediocre sushi place.   They do have food that you could order on an iPad that then transport your food onto a serving device. Some of the prices vary from $-$$.   Great experience, but I probably wouldn't make it my go to sushi spot.

A2iCA9fV3fxSoKoN1igSjg.text: This was certainly a new and pleasant experience for my friends and I. Informative too.  Upon entry, the staff was extremely welcoming and friendly. Our server, Jay (?) was nice to explain the process of food going around the restaurant, such as chefs putting fresher items on the conveyor belt after every 30 minutes. Another detail to note was that, certain nigiri dishes had to be ordered specifically from the table's iPad (e.g. uni). The amount of stacked plates were also counted at the end of the meal to calculate your total, along with the billed amount from the iPad. For example, my friends and I pulled off 16 plates off the conveyor belt ($2.50/each), and ordered at least 5 other dishes (primarily special rolls and dessert) from the iPad (alone, totaled around $96) with a bottle of sake. Total bill came out to be around $145 (includes tax, but excludes gratuity).  Back to service... Knowledgeable and accommodating staff was appreciated. Also liked the way Jay had us check the bottle of sake (right brand and size) was alright with us before bringing out a cold one to chill in an ice bucket. Not to mention that he and his co-workers checked on us throughout the meal, and managed to throw in a joke or 2 around with us (e.g. we ordered all three dessert cakes).  The food, itself, was good. Made me think of what's served at other sushi restaurants around town, so it's up to par in terms of quality. I think I just appreciated the overall experience as a nice introduction to this kinda restaurant.  If I could mention one suggestion, it would be to stack the covers instead of the plates from the conveyor belt. I understand that the items need to be counted/tracked, but the covers looked neater stacked on the side, and did not have food (crumbs) on the plates to look at during our entire meal.

8AeyP87aaSWDhpkLR0wJbA.text: Sapporo is great to bring friends who are apprehensive to trying sushi. The great selection of non-sushi items helps ensure there's something for everyone!  Conveyor Belt Sushi: I loved the signage that leads with the sushi following.  The plates have two pieces to make it easy to try new sushi at $2.50 a plate, fantastic.  Upper Level VIP delivery Sushi & More: If you order sushi and other items from the kitchen, it will get delivered to you via a motorized tray that rides on the track above the conveyor belt.  It stops at your table, flashes a yellow light and a robotic voice instructs you to remove your order. Very cool, your social media fans will love it.  The conveyor belt sushi was fresh for sampling.  The sushi rolls we ordered from the kitchen was even fresher.  The half size ramen bowl, scallops, sushi tacos, scallops and steak were flavorsome.  The portions are smaller sampling sizes but good quality dishes for a great price.  Fantastic.  Ambiance: Contemporary lighting and decor, dark wood tables, black leather booths, pairs well with the conveyor belt for a clean high tech look.  Family night or date night, the vibe works just as well.  Sapporo just cracked my list of best places for a first date.  If the vibe is good, order slowly and try new dishes with your date.  Create that new memory together.  If the vibe is one star, order less dishes, save money and get that dessert dish delivered when the time is right.  Either way, the conveyor belt and touch pad ensures you have constant food possibilities all night.  Enjoy the food and enjoy the experience!  =)

ayEKNwwntxVwGf3m_yZnTg.text: Being a sushi addict this is a OKAY place for those who are inexperienced with sushi.  The fish to rice ratio is ridiculous, they feed you more rice than fish - which is good to keep expenses low but bad for quality.  Most if not ALL their nigiri is dry, the rolls are overly sauced and often too soggy when it comes out from the kitchen.  The customer service is nonexistent, literally, you have to flag someone down.. but they are however quick to question "tipping." LOL!

cdHCkpo_8dUU26Be3j-U9A.text: Stopped by before heading home and it did not disappoint! Good prices and good quality. The scallop and Bronzino was yummy and the toro  Our server was super sweet. Would definitely come back here whenever in Vegas!

bL_t7oSuAzFM5u2jfSjlnQ.text: My in-laws keep visiting from Utah and incessantly insist that we eat here every. single. night. Do I complain? Hell, no, because the fish here is fresh, the service here is great, and everyone can eat what they want and how much they want. I will forever love this place.

YHqfGa9dGHW96V91fWHsMw.text: This spot was fairly decent. The nigiri and belt items were all 2.50 each. The belt items include nigiri, half rolls, and various appetizers. The half rolls were a good idea so you can try some rolls without worrying about finishing the whole thing. The nigiri pieces are small but not too bad. The salmon skin hand roll was tasty. Tonkatsu Ramen was not bad, but not the greatest, most likely from a box of ramen. I would go again and try the pork belly and my usual picks of nigiri.

rAw_j9TVtFUr4RWMvHPSMQ.text: The first and only conveyor belt sushi in Vegas. Despite the roots and reasoning behind conveyor belt sushi restaurants (to sell cheaper cuts of fish to the masses), it's still a neat concept to me. You plop yourself to your seat and wait for food to come to you. If you must eat, might as well go all out lazy!  I've only been to under 10 conveyor belt sushi restaurants in the US and other countries and my review would be based on those experiences.  So, hooray for Vegas having conveyor belt/ revolving sushi. The biggest gripe I have is that the food selection is very limited. Tuna, salmon, crab, tamago, spicy tuna, a sprinkling of fatty tuna, surf clam, caterpillar roll, and a few others + dessert. I'm not sure what their policy is when it comes to taking off a plate that's been around a few times. They have an iPad at each table so if you want a specific item, you can order it and a little tray comes zipping above your head - you have to be alert though and pay attention because you might be grabbing other people's food across from you. If the light is on on your side, it's yours. However, their iPads need to be reset a lot.  The quality of their fish is just okay even during their first week of being open. Each plate is like $2.50 depending on what you get, you'll get 1-4 pieces per plate for the same price. You pay based on the number of plates.
