broM9DwF0YAP_LGUBgeApg.text: Came here Thursday night for dinner with my family from out of town. Plenty of parking when we went. We were seated right away when we arrived so that's plus.  Anything you grab from the conveyor belt is going to be $2.50 a plate. Anything fried or cooked from the conveyor belt is going to be cold or soggy, but that's expected. You get to order straight from the kitchen with their tablet menu & those are hot & fresh. The black garlic ramen noodle was really good. The broth was creamy & buttery, the portion was perfect. The waiters will check up on you from time to time for refills etc despite the food being self serve so that's awesome. The store was clean and very modern. There's an outdoor patio area for smokers & whatnot. Great environment & friendly staff. I would come here again with friends & family from out of town.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black garlic ramen noodles. Yes please!!
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plates from the conveyor belt. $2.50/ea

6o1FTMGMi903EyaSezG41g.text: The fish was very fresh. The dishes were unique and it's fun to watch the sushi move around the conveyor belt. We ordered from the little machine as well. I am a fan, but I wish it were AYCE. We definitely spent way more for lunch than we usually would have for sushi, but the quality was well worth it.

igOYATYw0czd6b44qIjvuw.text: YUMMYYYY! We decided to try this place out for the first time and here I am for the 4th time, finally sharing how amazing this place is! It's cheap in my opinion because everything in the conveyor belt is $2.50! They have 2 piece nigiris and 3 piece rolls along with small appetizers going around in the belt and they're actually REALLY GOOD! They even have small tonkotsu ramen bowls with all the veggies and even chashu! It was only $4.50, same with the udon noodle soup bowls! You can order full rolls but I suggest you just grab three different kinds of the 3 piece rolls for $7.50 ($2.50 x 3) because that's cheaper than paying 10 dollars for an 8 piece roll of the same thing when you can have 9 pieces of assortment! Your table will also have an iPad so you can order food/drinks/dessert anytime!   This place is so good! Besides the food, the place is really clean and the ambiance is so nice and relaxing! All the servers are nice and attentive! Definitely one of my favorite sushi places now. My bill when I go with another friend always comes to less than what I pay for in AYCE! We're both full walking out the door all the time!

IJjajMffP_gLVYZu7l1VqQ.text: I came in at 430 and out my name down on the menu. Waited till my party arrived at which point everyone that was there before and came after me had been seated (+30 min wait).   It's definitely an experience with pros and cons.  PRO: small portions which is great is you don't want to order a giant roll you may not like, lots of options for appetizers/rolls/nagiri, delivery is custom orders on the top conveyor is speedy and entertaining   CONS: $35 for dinner is more than many all you can eat places, nagiri is somewhat warm, very small portions of seaweed salad, no sauce for gyoza, some nagiri portions are very small and only 1 piece, hard to track down waitress, only one diner gets to see the food coming down conveyor as the other is always looking over their shoulder, no desert or eel nagiri on conveyor, every roll except lobster seem to have loads of cucumber in it

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halibut portions

bAE214INFVR6tUOWfUvPCw.text: Great place for a late dinner. Went during Happy Hour (10-close) $1.75 sushi plates and $4 Lg sake! Fun concept and great service.

q5a4kTtkCQSiTdw0Ytb_mQ.text: Great experience with my first conveyor belt restaurant.  Sushi was great, no waiting

f85e4yFmn-xvrFcTupGsmg.text: I was super excited to hear Vegas was finally getting a conveyor belt sushi joint & this place did not disappoint! I have to admit I did wait about a month or so before coming here for all the hype to die down. My boyfriend and I came on a Sunday around 7 pm and waited maybe around 20 minutes for a table, which isn't bad in my opinion. We were also easily able to find a parking spot right in front.   Once we were seated the host explained the concept to us. All of the conveyor items on the white plates are priced at $2.50 and there's also an iPad at the table to order specialty items which are different price ranges. The iPad orders arrive on a separate little cart which stops right at your table and lights up. We tried this with the Orange Salmon which was really cool.  During this visit we tried quite a few different things, but our overall favorites were the New Zealand salmon nigiri, the Garlic Tuna nigiri, and the Mexican roll. All of the fish was very fresh and the portion sizes were just right for trying multiple things.   We will definitely be back again soon. Awesome concept & great food!

twDtK1oCeCkh8pDCLOwh9A.text: Fun first time experience. Most of the rolls on the menu come out on a conveyor belt for easy & fast access. If not, you can order from the iPad on the table. Once your order is submitted, it will come out on a flat robot on top of the moving belt. Decent prices overall. Will be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Starting point.
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The name of the sushi comes before each plate.

Nj-bpnG_IXPb-wwJs86EbA.text: What a terrific sushi spot!  Entering the restaurant it is apparent it is well kept and clean, super clean. We went during "happy hour", I'll explain in more detail.  We were ushered to our booth very quickly by a friendly, welcoming very nice sever and she then explained the process.  That's when I noticed the conveyor belt with plates of sushi scooting along on the conveyor.  She said, you just grab a plate off the conveyor, which has 2,3 or 4 cuts of various sushi items and keep the plates and then they count the plates when you ask for your check.  During regular times each plate is $2.50!  Very reasonable, and AND during happy hour they drop the price to $1.75 per plate!  Each table has an iPad menu, where you can see the ingredients of each item as well as order additional menus items not on the conveyor and a ROBOT will bring your selection on a rail which sits over top the conveyor, it will stop at your table and flash lights alerting you to the arrival of your menu selection.  Super.   Each sushi item is preceded by a paper tag in a plastic holder identifying which item is following.  I watched like a little kid as plates covered in clear plastic tops scooted by on the conveyor, reading the sign, then scrolling the menu to see what was in the roll. Seriously, child like glee as each plate cruised the conveyor waiting to be picked.  Being vegan, I watched, looking for veggie options, which on the conveyor there were two. That's kind of a bummer. But I picked them right away. I then scrolled the menu and found a black garlic ramen, which I ordered. It arrived via the server rather than the robot as it could potentially spill.  It looked terrific, though once it arrived I noticed the little piece of meat not identified on the menus list of ingredients, "one pork" the waitress said. Super bummer. But I removed it and I gave in and plunged my chopsticks into the bowl. It was wonderful and after I added siracha and wasabi it was unreal good. The flavor of the black garlic and the near al dente noodles were terrific. This isn't your packaged $.19 variety of ramen, this was really very good.  Bummer the pork wasn't identified and bummer they really didn't have an all veggie ramen but wow it was good. I then  ordered the avocado roll, rice, avocado and seaweed paper wrap.  The avocado was fresh and a beautiful green and with a slice of ginger, dipped in my siracha concoction (siracha, wasabi and soy sauce mixed up into a paste) it was super tasty.  The avocado roll arrived via the robot and when it arrived a computerized voice said please take your order, or something, to be honest when it arrived and started flashing it's lights I jumped and grinned ear to ear like a toddler seeing the gifts Santa brings at Xmas, so I'm not exactly sure what the robot was saying. Within the iPad menu you can call an attendant or order direct off of the iPad, though I didn't realize you could order drinks off the iPad.  But, once I pressed the call server button our server arrived really fast and I asked for another Sapporo for her and some more siracha and ginger for me and it took maybe a minute and she was back with the items even though the place was really busy, not an empty booth and we were there quite some time watching people come in order, eat and leave and be replaced with new diners. Our server came by multiple times during our visit, despite closing down the place, they never rushed and it wasn't irritating how often they checked on us. They did so with a bow and a simple oh good oh good and a giggle and would back away to check on another table.  Terrific. A manager/owner guy was observing the entire restaurant bouncing back and forth between the isles watching the staff and the conveyors.  There wasn't one time a blank space was on the conveyor.  Also, new sushi items would suddenly come across the conveyor offering a new item.  Great!  My companion had a few different items off the conveyor and each she said was terrific, each one I picked was quite good as well including the garlic edamame. Not salty and when dipped in my siracha concoction it really shined for me.   In conclusion, the place is super friendly and a cool place to hang out.  The booths are big and comfortable and the staff is very attentive but not overbearing or rushing, just the right amount of attentive. In fact we were the last ones to leave and they all, each of them wished us well, thanked us and invited us back with giant smiles.  I would like to see more plant based/vegan options but I'll most definitely go back.

Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Robot delivering my avocado roll
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado roll.

11LoO4TmNQF7KUXH-v5e-Q.text: Love the concept! Small bites of sushi for affordable prices. Perfect for someone like me who can never decide what to try first. Being the visual eater that I am, I love the fact that I can see everything before I try it.   Great variety on the conveyor not to mention all the other items on the menu that I have yet to try. I'll have to come back again and check those out.   Honestly, there's just something about seeing your sushi moving along a conveyor belt that puts a smile on your face. Like a little assembly line of deliciousness.   Notable mention:  Staff is always very gracious and helpful.

lxIMTBsV8zV0-6ElG5BKeA.text: This place is awesome!! My wife and son wanted to take me here for Father's Day. I haven't eaten at a sushi restaurant with a moving carousel of sushi and robots that bring your orders to your table. Food is fresh, tastes great, and the portions aren't too much. All I really want you to know is, if you like sushi, this is a must eat at place.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi as it comes around on the carousel from the kitchen.
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basic rolls you can order if not on the carousel

ePxZ0VFUvJYMLF1t02Uusw.text: I would give Sapporo 10-stars if I could.  1) Special shout-out to Cliff and Pure, our host and waitress. They truly enjoyed their job and always had sincere smiles. Dining out with 3 young kids is never easy but the staff made it extra special.  2) Coming from SF, I expected a wait. So when I called to inquire about the wait, I was surprised that there was no wait during prime time for dinner.  3)Best deep fried brussel sprouts ever. Seriously.  4) The price. I definitely cannot get these prices in SF.  5) The service. It was so good that I had to list it out twice. As a mother of young kids, I always bring smaller utensils for the kids. When I accidentally left the utensils to bussed, Pure actually washed it before handing it back to me. That alone deserves 5 stars!   My kids didn't want to leave without saying goodbye and hugging our wonderful waitress, Pure. Thank you Sapporo for one of our most memorable dining experiences in Vegas.

BhOkZmPXXewn5RKArMZBrg.text: By far the BEST revolving sushi spot in Nevada and California. Las Vegas has another called Konbea but don't bother going there.   Food quality in Sapporo is top notch and  consistent. From their rolls, nigiris to their a la carte offerings, everything is fresh and decently priced. Ambiance is upscale. Good spot to take out of town visitors.  My only small complaint is their iced tea fiasco. Some servers would say their iced tea is refillable, some servers would say its not and we've been in this place A LOT. I mean come on!  Everything else is 5/5.

scQzqDV82E1Pzfx6agFyGw.text: Wow!!!!  Love it and can't wait to go back to Vegas and go again.  This was recommended by a local, it's off the strip and worth the short drive.  Food was great.  Unbelievable value!!! And the technology of their conveyer system is very fun too.

QtYOEXxy1q1lZKHqMzZT1A.text: Great selections and at 2.50 a plate you cant beat the price. The fish is fresh with a large variety of premium fish. Great price good food you cant beat.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w73WfzdRhyQkB3GhXSXE3g.text: This place is so cool! Sushi just rolls out in covered plates on a conveyor belt. If you don't see what you want you can order and it will come out on a motorized serving plate. They have an amazing happy hour on Friday and Saturdays 11pm to 2am and all their plates are $1.50.  It's rare that I love every sushi roll that I've tried in a sushi joint but I did! It was all very tasty and fresh. I even ventured out into ramen and it was phenomenal.   My favorites are: black garlic ramen , Mexican roll, Sapporo special salmon roll, popcorn lobster roll and tuna tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LFxsDmFuTIQxDpNeKcNxZA.text: This place is so fun! I took a friend from out of town and it was a new experience for all of us. We quickly got seated and the waiter was friendly and asked us if we had ever dined there before. He explained how it all worked - basically take what you want from the conveyor belt and order anything you don't see on the iPad and it will come out on a robot. If the light flashes towards your table, that is the signal to grab your food. We went to town, ate a bunch of sushi, ordered some miso soups (the waiters bring that out to you - I am assuming because of the spill risk) and got some hand rolls delivered by robot.   At the end of our meal, the waiter asked us if we needed to split checks (yes) and he quickly sorted it out without us having to do the math (woohoo). If you want tasty sushi, great service and a fun concept, definitely check it out!

KBhhFXyNqbXsYy2PURDsmA.text: I've gone to a few restaurants in Vegas before with 4-5 stars on Yelp and they've ended up big disappointments. However this restaurant was definitely not. This was the best revolving sushi experience I've ever had and I'm not even lying, it was worth every penny. Every single fish was perfectly sized and tasted as fresh as it can be, from toro (oh my god they had toro for only $3 a piece), salmon, yellowtail, baby yellowtail, mackerel, etc. Every single piece of nigiri was amazing. Usually, the sushi that are on the revolving belt would taste old and stale and not as freshly made, but that was not the case at all for this restaurant. Every piece we ate off the belt compared to the orders brought out to us tasted exactly the same. The ramen was great too, it was perfectly sized and for only five dollars! You'd still have room for your sushi. The tiny tacos were great and they definitely did not skimp out on the unagi nigiris. The hand rolls were stuffed and the seaweed did not taste soggy at all therefore we knew they definitely brought them out as soon as they were made. This is a restaurant I would for sure visit again the next time I am in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1 Piece Toro 2 Piece Mackerel 2 Piece Yellowtail
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 Piece Salmon Taco 2 Piece Unagi
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hand rolls

gy0nQEBSuOeteGqMb8IEvw.text: First off I have to say the food is great, this has become one of our favorite sushi restaurants for lunch in Las Vegas. It's family friendly. Sometimes the staff can be a little rushed, it gets busy. We always order a ton of food and it never tops 60 bucks.  Like i said, the place is family friendly. The reality is that our kids really love this place. It's technologically fun for the kids, there's a revolving belt of sushi and a robot on rails that brings food to the table from the kitchen. Also you order off a tablet off the table.   The place is clean and the staff is very attentive. The kitchen is qiuck to dish out food after you order.   The prices are good, happy hour is really good. Love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spider hand roll.
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy tuna, spicy salmon and spicy yellow tail hand rolls.

y3jyGwNJQXr9cIdtsGoTLQ.text: Ordered 7 different rolls and they were all a chopped up mess.  No wasabi, ginger or soy sauce.   The spicy salmon and spicy tuna tasted the same and sour.  Would have gotten better sushi at the grocery store!  This is a pic of the Mexican roll and the dragon roll.  For any of you that actually eat these rolls, this is not the norm for the filling.  Paid $11 for each of these in the pic and the filling consisted of imitation crab meat and dressing.  Will never order from here again!!  Save your money and your appetite for something more palatable!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XXE-gI4DR9aDAJdD85OMzQ.text: I had been looking forward to coming to this restaurant for quite some time as I was intrigued by their concept and eager to try new sushi items I never had the courage to try before. After trying Sapporo Revolving Sushi, I feel conveyor belt sushi is a brilliant concept, one I believe all sushi restaurants should adopt as a way to encourage guests to try new things in order to see exactly what sushi dishes are their favorites and reduce waste.   I mean, let's be honest here, we've all been to one of those "all you can eat" sushi restaurants where you end up ordering a sushi roll that wasn't what you were expecting and now you're forced to eat it or the establishment will charge you for wasting. Nothing sucks more than to be disappointed with your meal choice and to be forced to eat it anyway. Sapporo solves that problem completely.  Guests are either able to order from a wide touch screen menu at their table or simply just grab a plate from the conveyor belt as an ample variety of sushi items pass by them. Each plate from the conveyor belt will have two to three pieces of a particular sushi roll, such as the Mexican roll or the smoked salmon roll, which you can taste on the first round or, if you'd like, grab again the next time that item comes your way.   I tried a wide array of items including the sexy girl roll, yellow tail tacos, lobster roll, and even a white cake dessert! I simply loved having a variety of food items arriving to my table because there's nothing better than be able to sample great food over and over again.   Also, our server was fantastic. He made sure our drinks were refilled often and was able to provide great suggestions as to what menu items to order in between our indulging in the revolving sushi dishes. One of my friends who dined with us decided to try the filet mignon which was perfectly cooked and topped with a succulent sauce that left him yearning to order the dish a second time.   Definitely impressed with the great food and service Sapporo offers to their guests. I have no doubt that my next sushi craving will be satisfied at this fine establishment and I will continue to recommend it to all the sushi lovers I know!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Bw21_3oRXlVZFJ0stV0lew.text: We've heard nothing but good things about Sapporo and decided to finally give revolving sushi a try for ourselves. Japan always comes up with innovative ideas but conveyor sushi is just pure genius. It's super efficient, endless choices and WYSIWYG, small portions so you can try a bit of everything without waste, and best part is there's minimal human interaction required  We came in last night near midnight to take advantage of their sweet HH deal. There was a bit of a wait and more parties came in after we arrived. But that's to be expected because it was a Friday night  We got seated at a booth next to the kitchen and I was able to get a glimpse at all the action. What I saw was stacks of plates piled sky high and busy bee kitchen staff replenishing the conveyer belt with plate after plate. Reminds me of a factory in there!   I came for fish so I decided to start with nigiri. There's plenty of options for nigiri and they all looked fresh as it passed by on the belt. I picked out some of the more premium nigiri and enjoyed every one I tried. Wasn't a big fan of the rice though- a bit dry and fell apart easily. Also tried some of the rolls and loved how the ones with soft shell crab/shrimp tempura in them were still warm and crisp. My favorites of their specialty items included the mini shrimp tacos, popcorn lobster roll, and pepper tuna and smoked salmon nigiri  I recommend trying this place, especially from 10pm-close for their reverse HH- less people and amazing deals at 1.75 per plate for 2 piece nigiri and 3-4 piece rolls, discount drinks. Item selection seems limited during this time though. I wished to see some more non sushi items on the conveyor belt but never saw more than gyoza. If you're craving their other menu items, they're all available and you order straight from the screen at your table and it'll be delivered via conveyor belt on a musical platform

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyoza was the only non sushi option during late HH
Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fav: pepper tuna

HrP7l7KpuY5TXld9S2RhVQ.text: UPDATE: What a disappointment. After coming here regularly, I expected this place to be consistent. Seating was very fast but the service and food was what changed my review of this place from a solid five stars to a sad two stars. Our server never checked up on us nor were we given plates. The conveyor belt was empty for the most part and no new dishes were being placed in, so it was the same food. The iPad for ordering specific dishes and requesting the bill was pretty pointless as it took 30 minutes and a reminder to the waiter that our soft shell crab still hasn't arrived. Place was not busy at all like they usually are and other customers seemed to be getting upset as well and leaving. When we finally got ahold of our server, the soft shell crab was sent to the wrong table twice. At this point my family and I were frustrated solely due to the lack of service and lack of food on the conveyor belt. For first timers, this would not be a good first impression for them. Long wait times, lack of variety on conveyor belt, and terrible service. I'm sorry Sapporo, but as it stands now, this is clearly unacceptable. I may return back in the future and I hope this place improves.

YRYEXualSPEdgtvgS55EeA.text: Thinking about coming here but worried the food will be kinda sub par?  Trust me, RUN, don't walk here.  This is by far the most fun I've had a lot a sushi restaurant. The ambiance is beautiful, the food was amazing, and the revolving part with the little robots was so much fun.   I can't wait to come back.

-CAKUsjPqOsSZ9Pyo0xDmg.text: I came here once and wasn't too impressed with their sushi. The quality of the nigiris seemed identical to a lot of the AYCE joints I've visited. And yet this place charges quite a lot for their food for what it is. I ate up to my 30% capacity because of the pricing, and it was $30 for myself.   The concept might be cool and fun and worth checking out if you've never been to a conveyer belt sushi place before.

bGvRLt4yOlTkmtVuZES3rA.text: I am shocked at the 4 1/2 stars.  Maybe that is because I have had sushi on a conveyor belt before in Tokyo.   If this review was on presentation alone I would give it a 5, heck I might even push for a 6.  Unfortunately, I came here to eat sushi.  The way it works is that there is a constantly moving conveyor belt that has plates with a couple of pieces of sushi each.  Just take the plate you crave.  After dinner they count up each of these plates at $2.50 a piece.  For whole rolls, appetizers, and bigger dishes there is a computer screen.  These orders are prepared in the kitchen.  When they are ready a little robot that looks like it may be from Star Wars wheels down a track and stops at your table.  After repeatedly announcing your food is ready, it races back to the kitchen after you take your plate.  Unfortunately, for me the food did not stand up to the presentation.  I am not saying it was bad, it just wasn't sushi to me.  Everything is on the sweet side.  When I want sweets I go for ice cream.  That being said, I really loved the Strawberry roll.  It was really unique.  It tasted more like strawberry pie than sushi, but hey I love strawberry pie.  Go ahead and call me a hypocrite.  I do think this is the perfect place for a first time sushi patron or someone who is on the fence about trying sushi.  It felt like sushi with training wheels.  The only problem is, I already know how to ride the bike. After finishing dinner, I felt like going out for sushi.

nUMiD4ocTi3JXMklscJL1g.text: This is an amazing sushi place, and a completely different experience than any other sushi restaurants. The revolving sushi plates are so interesting, the digital ordering is way ahead of its time, and the prices are very exceptional. Great sushi for pros and beginners.

44nuRGODAZ2TVZahxSEelQ.text: Hands down the greatest concept in the history of sushi!! Who would've known that a simple addition to having a small R2D2 deliver your food straight from the kitchen to your table would be a hit. I love that you can order right from your table by using your self serve tablet and its very helpful that every menu options on the tablet shows photos of what you are going to order. Yes, I read pictures. I only read books with pictures anyways lol so they had already won me over lol! They do have servers roaming around to assist you/bus your table/take drink orders, so the interaction with an actual human is still present but is definitely not the highlight of this restaurant. As for pricing and quality, it's both there and it's very much affordable. They don't do ayce like most sushi restaurants in the area but that's ok. Overall, it's a great date spot, it's very clean and spacious but it can get busy quick and they always have a wait around dinner time so be prepared to be on the wait list for up to 30-45min. But I do highly recommend this spot if you're looking for a place to bring your sushi loving friends or maybe you're on a date! There's no way you can lose here.

fZ-Ax7G11KpyktzITLG1uA.text: What an interesting find outside of the Vegas riff-raff. With happy hour after 11, this place was a little gem in an area full of new and happening Asian restaurants. I understood it to be busy during regular hours, but it wasn't really busy around midnight. For someone who doesn't enjoy all the crowds of people on the strip, this might be the place to go for a decent meal where you could polish off decent sushi at a $1.50 per plate at happy hour. Normally they're $2.50. Not bad.   They have all the usual on the conveyor, and an iPad menu for all the regular stuff which is all very reasonably priced. Should you order something off the iPad, you get a cute little robot tray that comes to you and stops with your sushi and a friendly greeting. How fun, right?  It's a no brainer to come here before your big plans or early adventures, especially when its past 11pm because it won't be too bad. You can polish off all the sushi - rolls (popcorn - my favorite, tiger, garlic tuna, lobster, and more), nigiri (salmon, tuna, squid, octopus, striped bass, mackerel, yellow tail, sea bass), sashimi and lots of apps like gyoza.   Go nuts!

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

7iaxEHbw7EyER8_4vxPo5Q.text: I love this place! The sushi is so fresh.  The revolving sushi allows you to pretty much try everything on the menu.  I have been there 3 times in the last month and sushi is NOT usually my first choice to eat...but fantastic.  The popcorn lobster is my favorite.  Amazing late night happy hour.  Great date night or girls night place.

bueDcESIdW-VYuc-A8nTZw.text: Really cool place,  Fun, new idea to Vegas, can't get this in a casino !  Robot and servers and iPad ordering  (Robots deliver food items, minus the soup for obvious reasons.) Food was fresh & they make there dessert in house a big plus for me!  It would be awesome if they had a all you can eat option!

55p4VFhTPmjdMJFgBMuIqQ.text: This place is amazing! Have a seat, a waiter will get you whatever drink you want and then watch the sushi options pass by your table. Don't worry if one passes that you want and you miss it since it'll be back around in a few minutes. Anything that you may not find on the revolver you can order on a touch screen at your table. They have a wonderful happy hour with pricing and you pay by plate which is pretty cool. We went when it was busy so everything coming out was fresh and tasty. Decor is pretty, staff is nice and service is the quickest as you just reach out and grab whatever options you want to try. Highly recommend for the experience!

YRaQmXJ9ziZBpAzv7lAkxw.text: When arriving it seems like a regular Japanese restaurant but once seated you see the revolving sushi dishes on a belt. The place is very spacious and seems more upscale then the Kula places. They have way more options revolving and you can order off the actual menu, which we did a few items. The fried brussel sprouts were very tastey. It had a citrus flavor drizzled over it that made the whole dish that much more satisfying to eat. The garlic  edemame had a kick to it that was super yummy. The garlic mini ramen, was the perfect amount if you also wanted to have ramen as well with your sushi. The broth and ingrediants were all so flavorful in a small bowl. It's a must try. The sushi that were revolving were all fresh and so many different varieties more so than most revolving sushi places.  This place is a must try but it's not close to the strip at all. You would have to drive here or get an uber. But it's close to chinatown and many other places to eat.

0CSxqjTD8moQZQY63Bg8LQ.text: Went for the gimmick of the conveyer belt but must say I enjoyed myself and the food. Super clean and modern restaurant. Could definitely bring a date there. Sushi was good but no better or worse than any of the numerous AYCE places in town. $2.50 a plate sounds cheap but it adds up quickly. Didn't order any of the kitchen dishes but $10 a roll seemed standard via the iPad device for ordering Went around 7:30pm on a Sunday and seating was immediate but the place was far from empty. If they were slammed there's a bar you can sit at by the entrance so you can get lit while you wait for a table. Good spot if you don't want to wait for the chefs and you're ok with standard nigiri items. You can order sashimi from the kitchen but I didn't see any sashimirevolving  on the conveyer belt. Shout out to Japanese technology!

mZ4h2nt5ekNfOGTIC8QX8Q.text: My Vegas friends wanted to take me to this restaurant when I was visiting for my Birthday week. We didn't make a reservation, and ended up waiting 30mins because they have a full restaurant.   While I was waiting in front of Sapporo, I was drawn by the beauty of the interiors, and decors accompany with functional technologies. The dining table tops, light fixtures, with revolving belt, and a cute tablet to place your order for efficiency is just perfect. I love the Modernism, casual,  fansy, and laid back atmosphere.  The price for all plates are reasonable, not too expensive. Some of the specialty dishes cost a bit more. The food taste pretty good, and customer service is on point. We got a free sample of Filet Mignon, I took a bite, and it just melted in my mouth. It was very Yummy!   I'm super satisfy with this resturant, I can't wait until I'm visiting again. I'll definitively stop by when I get home.

nJOt4JSv5nJkXCsDpvUdYg.text: This place was sort of disappointing! The fish on the conveyor belt seems like it has been out there a while and did not look that great. The prices are also a little too steep for sushi I didn't find delicious.

FPh3VJIed2XN9QIqGhkrag.text: "Kaitenzushi" means, literally, "revolving sushi." In Japan, they are ubiquitous. Cheap and fast, they're where one goes for a quick lunch or a late night snack. They're not known for fresh, quality fish, variety, or superb service. I learned about sushi when I lived in Japan, so I was a little dubious when "kaitenzushi" came to Las Vegas.  Sapporo surprised me! I chose it to have my birthday dinner, and I was not disappointed at all! It is nothing like the kaitenzushi-yas that are found on every shopping arcade in Japan. Sapporo is clean, for one thing. It's modern decor makes it seem more like a hot nightclub than a restaurant. Seating is mostly booths, and the tables are large enough to hold a large number of small plates without making one feel crowded.   The nigiri menu is comprehensive, with offerings that often can't be found at AYCE sushi bars or a la carte Japanese restaurants. They had Spanish mackerel on the menu, as well as surf clam, white tuna, toro (the fatty belly meat from a blue fin tuna), and snow crab. All of the items for offer on the conveyor belt are the same price - $2.50 - and instead of raising the price on the more expensive items, they decrease the amount. While most of the nigiri comes in two pieces, the more expensive items, like the snow crab, are only one piece. The fish was fresh; no fishy smell or off colored. One exception, oddly enough, was the shrimp, which was over cooked, dry, and a little rubbery. The sauce on the unagi was also bit too sweet for my taste, but I enjoyed it nonetheless. The nigiri didn't have those huge slabs of seafood pressed on top of a tiny bit of rice that are so popular these days. Nigiri sushi is meant to be eaten in one bite, and Sapporo's nigiri is perfectly sized.  As I said, I learned sushi in Japan, where the innovative, beautifully made sushi rolls that one finds in America generally don't exist. So I tend not to order the crunchy tempura rolls, the spider rolls, or the volcano and tiger rolls. I didn't order any at Sapporo either, as they were much more expensive than the conveyor belt offerings, the most expensive were $10. But there were a good number of the rolls on the conveyor belt; mini rolls of just two or three pieces, that offered a taste of the rolls on the menu. There was also a decent appetizer menu, with items priced between $2.50 and $8. I didn't order any, but will be sure to try some of them on my next visit.  The turnover of the items on the conveyor belt was quick. I very rarely saw an item that made more than two go-rounds before customers selected it or it was removed and replaced. The conveyor belt itself was unobtrusive, adding to the clean ambience of the restaurant. An additional conveyor belt hovered over the main belt; if you ordered from the menu, by way of a tablet at the table, your order would arrive at your table on the overhead belt on a specially constructed cart. Very ingenious. I ordered a few items on the pad, just so I could check the delivery method. Everything I ordered came fairly quickly, nestled in its own little train car.  I also didn't order the noodles offered on the menu (three varieties of ramen and one udon bowl), because we were focusing on the sushi, but other customers were consuming them with obvious gusto. They were all priced at just under $5, a real bargain. The next time I dine here, I'm going to make sure to leave a little room for the black garlic ramen, which looked delicious!  So, if you're planning on picking up more than about ten plates per person, you might be better off, price-wise, going to an AYCE sushi bar. But the fresh fish, the novelty of the delivery system, and the modern decor all make this a great place to go for a light lunch, a late night snack, or a date! (Happy hour is from 10pm to closing, and all the belt items drop to $1.75, as well as discounted beer and sake!) Try it! I think you WILL like it! (And to the reviewer who said that the smoked salmon tasted like lox - DUH! What SHOULD smoked salmon taste like? And an FYI to that reviewer: You've probably never had REAL lox. The stuff you get at the supermarket is Nova, not lox, which is too salty for most American palates.)  Total price for our experience was $42.60. I tipped very little, as the servers tend largely to have nothing to do - they don't take your orders or deliver your food, or bus the tables. They are there mostly to deliver drinks and explain the whole system.

JsWJuaDeM2zMMP2tI7bzpg.text: Loved it there. My son loved how they bring food that you order on a little robot. Heather was such a great waitress.

eLmEwPBdJzNvxqZjcPIHEw.text: Bottom line first:  lots of surprisingly good sushi and rolls, but definitely pricy  We came for our first lunch stop for the weekend. Even though it was 1:30 for Black Friday, it was still pretty busy. We could have sat down right away to the set of booths with the broken conveyor belt, but  I decided to tough it out a little longer to have the real experience.   Despite being skeptical as lots of others, I felt there were plenty of good sushi from which to choose on the conveyor belts. Sexy Mama, red snapper, and seared Cajun albacore were the highlights. The small shrimp tacos were good too, but the portions were pretty small. We went through 20 plates between the four of us pretty quickly and ended up with a final count of 32.  At $2.50 a plate...well, you can do the math too.   It was a fun time, but with so many other value choices within the vicinity, I will probably frequent other establishments more often. But if you haven't had the conveyor belt experience, I wholly recommend this place.

I1Mj-D2afo4u0mYtQ9seRQ.text: ***Happy Hour*** This place is such a great deal on sushi during happy hour. I would recommend anyone trying to get their sushi fix to come here if you aren't trying to eat all you can eat and keep your bill reasonable. Waiters are attentive and friendly. I love Garlic and Tuna and the Garlic Tuna they serve us amazing and simple. You can also order of their very well priced menu. Soft shell crab is bomb.com I would highly recommend coming here. For what you pay, you are definitely getting your moneys worth.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AOOFAM1qrA6TyWocfrbHXw.text: I am giving Sapporo 2 stars because I rate a sushi restaurant based on the quality of the sushi, not its novelty of an old and tired concept of conveyor belt sushi that has been happening in Asia for more than twenty years.    If you're expecting fresh sushi, you're at the wrong place. The belt is way too long and you cannot beat the traditional cut-it-plate-it-bring-it-to-your-table sushi.  These sushi were prepared then a lid is put on top of a plate and it travels the length of the belt, which is pretty long and sometimes a couple times around.  If you're an avid sushi eater, you'll notice the fish is starting to dry up.  (Side note, revolving sushi restaurants in Asia are usually much smaller and are built like a bar.  The length of the belt surrounds the chef area and that's it.  You see the chef preparing the sushi and putting it on the belt.  And the patrons have a quick turnaround; you eat and you leave so the next person can come in, ensuring the turnaround of the sushi to be short and fresh.)  If you want to give this place a try for the novelty of it, then yes, it's definitely a fun and new idea for Las Vegas.  A great way to impress your non-Asian date, but I won't be coming back.

sJEGKfXIwx2OreAxwQt_0A.text: This place isn't AYCE so it can get real pricey. Sushi is so-so , nothing special. You better off come after hours since they have half price special. Avoid peak hours because you could be waiting for 30 + mins.

RoxCDXEdhMDIPIcKmEOfwA.text: While this is not my first time at a revolving sushi bar, it was our first time here.  We were not impressed.   The parking, while plentiful, is confusing because many of the spots located in front of the restaurant are designated for other businesses.  It wasn't busy, but we ended up parking at the bank next door.  When we entered the restaurant, there was a sign that said park anywhere.  That would've been helpful, say, in the actual lot where the cars are.  Just a thought. Strike 1.  There was a little bit of a wait, despite the restaurant being half full.  No biggie, but the hostess was not friendly at all.  Strike 2.  The food was just ok.  The selection on the belt was fairly limited and we saw many items go around multiple times over.  We ended up ordering from the menu, which is fine, but kinda defeats the purpose.  The fish tasted fine, but I wouldn't go so far as to say fresh.  Nothing was very memorable.  Strike 3.   You stack your plates and when you're ready to pay, they do a plate count.  I was not a huge fan of this, as I hated to see all the plates build up and not be cleared.    Given all the food offerings in Vegas, this is one I'd pass on.

V5Ly6fiJVBWQ-fXtqucwjQ.text: I LOOOOOVE SUSHI, but every sushi place kinda looks the same. This place however makes it an experience. The concept is so cool and the food was delicious

Awesome selection on the conveyor and if it is not on the belt you just order from a console on your table and a robot brings whatever you order directly to you. Hot sake on the cheap - great service - amazing sushi - we will definitely be going back!

dOSn_2Fx2H7iUwipQ01PkQ.text: We finally have a sushi restaurant like this in Vegas! For those from Hawaii like mwah, you should know about Genki for their sushi conveyor belt too. I always wondered if Vegas will eventually have one like it, and now it does! :]  My family and I have been wanting to come and try this place since it first opened up, but the few times that we had called to inquire about the wait times, it was a no go. Especially if you want to hit up this place on the weekends. So, we've put it off for a little. In the meantime, we have been faithful to our other go-to sushi joints lol  For our first visit, our group was told that the approximate wait time would be about 15 minutes. This held True as we were seated shortly after. Customer service was great and our table was constantly being checked up on to see if we needed anything else. But pretty much everything is done by yourself because all additional orders can be made on a personal tablet that is located on every table.  The restaurant's layout and design is modern yet simple. It has two sushi conveyor belts that past by all the tables, as well as two "food monorails" (as I call it lol) that deliver items that were ordered from the tablet. They run above the revolving sushi and will automatically stop at your table for you to grab. Awesome!  All the revolving food are covered with clear tops for visibility, but most importantly, to ensure freshness. That was my main concern for this place, as the food is constantly passing through tables.  To sum it all up, I had a really great dining experience and had fun handpicking and choosing everything. For dessert, the strawberry shortcake is good, as well as the matcha cake. This place is a must-try! Even if you're not in the area, don't hesitate to make the drive for it.

rdCLqqp2QwXTGByGrHK91g.text: Better than any sushi place I've been too.even better than San Diego .Tops to las vegas

iKJahKXaLtnthjkF2pWyRA.text: Las Vegas finally got a rotary sushi!!!!   Love this place. I finally got a new sushi place. Fresh sushi every 30 min. A variety of small plates. No need to question freshness & quality of sushi. Items are all well labeled and visually appetizing AND equally delicious.  The popcorn lobster was great. There was sauce on every bite. They actually had budlight....lol.  Our server ANN Marie from Hawaii was entertaining and very friendly. She actually checked back on us constantly. She was genuine and very respectful. So... ask for Ann Marie as your server.   Thank you Sapporo Revolving Sushi for finally opening. I will be back....

oBdGNE-y3-AR0nQ5m44tyQ.text: Came by a few weeks ago and sorry for the late post! Love this concept and my appetite was thoroughly satisfied and my wallet is still speaking to me! Revolving sushi is THE best way to go! Servers were exemplary and on top of everything! The menu is generous and portions are super satisfying! Warning! This place can be heavily addicting & if you have a wait for a table, it's worth the wait!

MQQOFABViXLW_7C_3pN-Dg.text: Very nice place to hangout w friends and family for dinner , great sushi choices, quite environment and nice staff. I find ordering from electronic menu is better quality than picking up the revolving plates, will sure be coming back.

9A-pljU_hqQjEaU9rbmLjw.text: What a fun experience! My first conveyor belt sushi experience was in Portland last summer and I fell in love. Such a great way to try new things without committing to a whole roll. Nice ambiance and smart layout. There are touch screens at each booth to order from the menu. A robot brings it right to your table on the track. So fun! Items from the conveyor are fresh and replenished frequently. The tempura was piping hot with asparagus, sweet potatoes, and onions. Attentive service from Jeremy. I highly recommend a visit here to get away from the chaos on the strip.

QmgyP915jAWSjI-BygWw6g.text: Finally a conveyor belt sushi spot in LV! We've been meaning to try this place out and I'm so glad we did. We came in tonight for dinner and were amazed how this place has not only great quality sushi but also excellent customer service. Our server was super friendly and attentive. He always came by to check on us to see if we needed anything. As for the food, the sushi was fresh and delicious. My boyfriend and I especially loved the shrimp tacos, garlic tuna, and spicy crab. We also loved the fact you can order other items on the menu with an iPad including appetizers, ramen, other specialty sushi rolls, and dessert. We ordered a few items, like the screaming-o and udon from the iPad, and everything came out delicious. My cousin ordered the black garlic ramen and she loved it. We'll definitely be coming back again.

P8D0-EqdiyW66SD3Z1Cwsw.text: place is really nicely decorated and really clean. Service was the best, wait staff was very friendly. My server Ann was very helpful and provided excellent service. Sushi was fresh and very tasty. I highly recommend this place. I will definitely be back next time i have a gig in vegas. Go Knights!

VL79pwNm2K69bV7j0VAg8w.text: Revolving sushi? Ok, I will give it a try but it's not my type of sushi restaurant. Not much options for me to choose from bc I am pregnant and can't eat raw fish so just had basic cooked items and not impressed with food. My husband couldn't eat his yellowtail nigiri he got from the conveyer belt bc it was too fishy for him. Price can adds up quickly and almost same price as all you can eat places. We rather go to all you can eat restaurants for better quality and options.

s-TzISM__h2XPvq15DMVPA.text: Awesome and super affordable!!  I am so in love with this place. I can't believe Las Vegas finally has revolving/conveyor belt sushi!! This place is all around great. First off the food and prices are amazing! Every plate on the conveyor belt if $2.50, specialty rolls are $7 - 9, ramen is only $4, and drinks are $2 - 7. I thought the sushi was pretty high quality and definitely worth $2.50. The garlic edamame and black garlic ramen are insanely good! Seriously $4.00 ramen, you can't go wrong.  They also offer hand rolls, tempura and dessert. Make sure you look through the menu as they have nigiri not usually on the conveyor.  I really like how updated this place is. It's very sleek and clean. The staff are super friendly and are very efficient.   This place is a great option for those who don't want to explode from all you can sushi places and who don't want to go to a fancy overpriced sushi bar.   TIPS: Visit this place before their prices go up. It is super affordable for the quality and novelty.   Get there early. We arrived at 11:35am (5 minutes after they opened) and they were almost full.   Don't worry about parking. You can park anywhere in the lot even if the parking says its for a certain store (Hotai Furniture)   Order from the ipad menu, they have so much to offer. Plus, a little robot tray delivers your food to you.

74fvrk0dlAl_sm67lj2K_g.text: I loved the concept of the revolving sushi and being high tech with the savvy ordering right at your table. The food selection was delicious that I would reccomend anyone who hasn't been here yet enjoy this atmosphere and food.  The only letdown was the drink selection. We ordered two cocktails. It seems that they messed up my friends drink since she ordered a margarita and it wasn't right. It wasn't lychee flavored and when we sent it back to get a new one, the only thing they did was add more simple syrup. With that being said, I probably won't be coming back.

dSYCkGQjA24N43XoAps1hg.text: Sapporo Revolving Sushi is a great edition to the Las Vegas food scene. It's a fun experience if you are a first timer and haven't been to a revolving sushi place before. The atmosphere & dining area here was clean and very modern. Our server was Jeremy and he was attentive & checked up on us frequently. Since it was our first time here , he explained to us how everything worked w/ their iPad ordering system & conveyor belt. Their ordering system was user friendly. Everything on conveyor belt was 2.50$ which I appreciate that they kept it simple. Onto the menu items - the quality of the fish w/ their rolls is similar to what you can get at AYCE. What I HIGHLY recommend is their orange salmon (order it on their iPad). Their orange salmon was my absolute favorite , definitely worth the 7.95$. My boyfriend loved the cheese tonkatsu appetizer & spider handroll. I liked that their handrolls aren't stuffed with just all rice. The only menu item we didn't like that we ordered was the black garlic ramen. The broth had good flavor especially with the black garlic oil , but the noodles were way too overcooked. If the noodles weren't so soggy and had more than just one small pork slice then it would be good value for it's 4.25$ price.  Dinner was around $52 total for the two of us. So it's pretty much about the same price as doing AYCE & we left pretty full and satisfied. Could've just ordered like 6 or 7 of those orange salmon only and left happy too. Overall - decent quality & great service.

We got the sushi rolls we wanted to try from there because it came with 3 pieces so we didn't have to commit with getting a whole roll of it. Uni was on the funnier side and the yellowtail was not good. Overall, this place is OK but nothing that I would crave to come back to.

Probably the best conveyor belt sushi I've ever had -- they have a main line of fresh, labeled dishes, and a tablet at each booth for special ordering from the menu, where items are either sent on a separate track directly to your table, or brought by a human server. Would definitely go back, and found the place originally via yelp.

G_XSv3h29LO-OPzYOkF4uQ.text: Pretty solid offerings and great if you wanted a quick in and out place when you're craving sushi.

qLTnNvYP42r9m-SJGMvhzg.text: First of all, service was great! Our waitress was so good about refilling our water and bringing us soy sauce, ginger, wasabi or whatever we may have needed.....mostly water since we were so dehydrated from drinki....I mean the heat. For 2.50 a plate, you really can't beat the variety and quality of this place. They definitely make their money on volume, as the pieces of nigiri are on the small side. However, this allows consumers to get a huge variety of fish they may not normally eat. My favorites had to be the Sexy Mama roll, TORO (1PC), New Zealand Salmon, premium yellowtail and the bluefin tuna. They look like they have a pretty good late night happy hour as well. Definitely one of the better revolving sushi experiences I've had, especially in the states.

I loved both the mixed flavors they had, spicy and sweet. The surprise was the steak sushi that they had, it blew my mind. The staff were so friendly and welcoming. And the interior design of the place was even better.

Since my first time coming here i've been going here once a week.  I normally go here after work with my co workers for happy hour!  Who can beat $2 beers and $1.50 sushi plate? And you can tell even tho its 11pm sushi are still fresh!  And shoutout to Tony for giving us the best service we can get!

UdvhBj41E17ePATYZUSWDg.text: Sushi on a conveyor belt moving to and around your table? Yes! Sold! First time to try such style of a restaurant was at Genki Sushi in Singapore and Hong Kong and now we have one here!   Did not disappoint!  Good amount of items on the menu from appetizers, sushi, drinks including spirits. Service was impeccable, manager made sure to spend time walking around to ensure proper service. Kitchen is visible and neat which is a plus when dining out.   For now, I'll give 5 stars.  Room for improvement? I would hope they can add more items to the menu. Less rolls and more nigiri options could be a good idea. On another note, could it be a possibility to create an AYCE option without sacrificing the current quality? A higher price point may be acceptable especially with this set up.   Look forward to returning soon.

23U1pKaLujS_gxL94N5_2w.text: I had been wanting to check this place out since it opened. Recently picked up a friend from the airport and she was famished after her flight. She loves sushi and since they don't have this kind of place back in Ohio, I figured this fit the bill. We went at about 2:30pm on a Wednesday so it wasn't crowded at all. We were seated right away and given a run down of how things worked. We ordered off the iPad and also chose items off the belt. I had the popcorn lobster and shrimp tacos. She got the Sapporo Special salmon roll and various other items off the belt. We split the Brussels sprouts. Everything was delicious and fresh. The service was great too, the ordered food came out quick. The servers were around whenever we needed them and were friendly. Price was great as well. Already planning on taking some other friends back for more of that yummy popcorn lobster!

Try a little of everything without committing to a full roll.  I was entertained by the conveyor belt and individual deliveries to tables. Friendly service. Super happy we'd researched and found this place. Will be back!

wKy6O7B7AV_TflHRnAlwNg.text: Vegas finally has a conveyor belt sushi spot! You have the option of grabbing plates off of the conveyor belt ($2.50) or ordering rolls, appetizers, kitchen specials, and desserts off of the tablet. Orders from the tablet will be delivered by a robotic trolley or the servers.   The atmosphere of the restaurant is clean and modern. We were immediately greeted by a hostess upon entry and only had to wait about 5 minutes to be seated. We noticed that the manager was very involved and made sure to interact with customers to ensure they were satisfied! Service was quick as well.   This place is great whether you have a small or large appetite. They do tend to get busy during the evenings so plan accordingly!

zxaq0OfYIljkxvLekBzqDA.text: Place is clean and comfortable. Good service, though at times it takes long just to receive a special order. Sushi was just so-so.

pwlmS8B7Z-i0kgdK1eHv2A.text: It's my first time eating there, the food is fine but their service is really poor. Our order took so long and the server is not that friendly

RKEWHYZA3aOxtQXZXLGXkw.text: Good food in a very clean and modern spot. The service is excellent, from both the robots and the people. Enjoyed picking off the rotating belt and ordering food on the robot train from the kitcken.

photos.caption: Photo of Sapporo Revolving Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Screaming O!

PBFBpu1OG7OG7avaupsLBw.text: Absolutely love this sushi restaurant. We just walked in on a week night for dinner and didn't wait in a line. Every plate on the conveyor belt was $2.50.  If you wanted anything from the kitchen or any appetizers or anything you didn't see on the belt can you just ordered it on the iPad connected to your table and a little robot came out on a second real directly to your table and delivered it to you. You press the button and send it back to the kitchen. It is all very techno and very cool.  I had a fabulous spider hand roll and some white tuna and tuna belly and my husband had some terrific Gyoza.   Hot green tea was exceptional.  The entire place was spotless and the staff was extremely attentive and professional. Arigato Gozaimasu for taking me back to Japan for a couple hours.

Z7gHpm7pqE5cA7_tOWTR-g.text: Quality is better than other japanese revolving concept. Price is fair but dont expect it to be as cheap as some of the other places are either. Their sweet shrimp is really good as well as their tonkatsu ramen.  The ramen is a fairly small bowl but the the broth is surprisingly good.  Glad to have found this place.

VLrf1rY66POoJ2DCqBmriA.text: Sapporo Revolving Sushi is a very unique experience that distinguishes itself from the AYCE counterparts. The sushi is placed on a conveyor belt that is delivered to each table. The sushi is decent quality. I would definitely recommend trying their salmon belly nigiri, it was absolutely mouth watering. It was so tender that the salmon dissolved in my mouth. Just as a rule of thumb, avoid anything that contains cream cheese if you are interested in consuming a lot of fish. My friend and I made the mistake of ordering a cream cheese filled roll halfway through the meal and prevented us from ordering more food. Which could be considered a good or bad thing depending on how you look at it. As a closing thought, I would recommend this place for people who want to try out something new!

uE0TLNd71xlNfXJi9ijzNQ.text: The first and only revolving sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. $2.50 per plate is cheap but it adds up once you consume mountains of plates of sushi. We ended up paying more than what we usually consume. Overall it was a good experience. The staff was good and attentive to our needs. Lastly they should add happy hour like $1 plates or something.

fene2T9N60Q7EluBmBkW5g.text: This place is amazing, full of energies and fun. Our server Kevin is very polite and caring, I drink lots hot teas and he mede sure my tea cup was always full. Their kitchen is super clear!

_2W6ea4dNUw7MnTItQ-RRg.text: Nice Decor, Nice everything really  But the food is smaller than average sized sushi. Quality is good except for the UNI,  which is a lower grade. I wouldn't say its unfresh, just not the good stuff.  I enjoyed my time there, the only problem is the portions. Compared to sushi trains in California. I eat twice as many plates at Sapporro.  My only real complaint is the food portions. Each sushi is like half the width.

MOzGNedg74JW6fGH_IUD2w.text: I've been to Sapporo three times now and I'd have to say it's a solid 3.8 stars. Here's a little list of pros and cons:   Pros:  *Super clean! This is important in any restaurant, especially when raw fish are involved  *Very tasty sushi. I was leery of the quality given that this is almost buffet style restaurant but it's actually quite good  *Half off happy hour at night! *Options like ramen and small plates for those looking to sample something other than sushi *Friendly staff *Low wait times if any  *Cool little robot trays that bring your food out when you order something from the kitchen  Cons: *Lack of variety. I wish they'd mix it up from time to time *Single occupant restroom  *Wait staff is friendly but never seems to freshen my beverage in a timely manner *Neighborhood is a little sketchy. Not that they can do much about this one

ag28_er0qfcEXUmxSGfKzQ.text: Great quality but be prepared to wait at peak hours. Pricey but bomb.

uMfnmWbs4VozA6sYzkLi4Q.text: I really like the concept of this place. Ordering from the tablet is convenient and so is picking sushi from the conveyor belt. I enjoyed the atmosphere, the decor was nice the restaurant was spacious and clean.  When it comes down to the quality of the sushi, I would say that the ingredients were fresh but the options fell short for my expectations. The rolls are pretty basic. I would have enjoyed this restaurant a little more if there were more extravagant/creative rolls. Most of the rolls tasted the same. Lacked flavor and sauces. Hopefully in the future they add more items on their menu. More variety.
